jobDescription: Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Ion™ endoluminal system is Intuitive's flexible robotic platform for minimally invasive biopsy in the peripheral lung, with an initial goal of improving the early diagnosis of lung cancer. As an engineering intern on the Advanced Product Development team, you will join a small multi-disciplinary team exploring new markets and technologies for the Ion platform. This role is an exciting opportunity to join team doing early phase investigation in a rapidly growing business, and to strengthen your skills in a challenging problem solving environment. Roles & Responsibilities Work as part of a cross-functional team in a fast-paced, startup-like organization Contribute to algorithms and software innovations in areas such as robotics, medical image analysis, and localization Prototype and iterate on designs Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Pursuing an MS or PhD in CS, EE, ME, BioE or related fields Great communication skills C++ knowledge preferred Interest and experience in computer vision, medical image analysis, robotics, sensor fusion and/or machine learning High levels of curiosity, independence, and technical ownership Bonus points for: Experience with development in Linux Experience with medical devices and product development in a regulated industry Experience with developing computer vision and machine learning algorithms Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : None JOB2896

Job Description Primary Function of Position: A da Vinci® Area Sales Manager is responsible for selling the da Vinci® Surgical System to greenfield and existing hospitals within the da Vinci® Area Sales Manager’s assigned territory. This requires a number of capabilities including knowledge in the use of robotics, the ability to build a team of advocates within each hospital, strong solution selling skills, and enough tenacity to insure sales objectives are met on a consistent basis. da Vinci® Area Sales Managers are expected to provide an extraordinary degree of information gathering and presenting to buying teams throughout the capital equipment purchasing process. Roles & Responsibilities Manage the complex sales process of da Vinci® Surgical Systems into new hospitals and upgrades into existing hospitals Build support from surgeons and administration for da Vinci® Surgery. Identify key institutions, generate market awareness, and drive sales of the da Vinci® Surgical System within an assigned sales territory Effectively manage transition of initial sale and installation to the sales team to drive procedural volume and growth Achieve quarterly sales targets Partner with the da Vinci® Area Sales Director to develop a sales plan for their local territory Build surgical advocacy teams at each hospital Develop initial contact and relationship with CEO and senior hospital administrators Organize and manage the sales process Develop knowledge of primary OR procedures Make business case for system purchase Resolve contractual issues and coordinate system installation upon purchase approval Handle all communications and administrative follow-up Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Qualifications Required Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Minimum of 5 years sales experience preference for experience in healthcare or capital sales Knowledge of the operating room environment Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Proven successful track record in capital medical equipment sales Sales management experience a plus Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Ability to travel up to 50%, dependent upon account distribution Success in introducing new technologies to the market is a plus Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary function of position: This role will specifically focus on our enterprise data warehousing and its modernization. The role is to help the customers and partners of the enterprise analytics team eliminate constraints from the legacy data architecture. The Associate Director is responsible for driving the architecture of data and processes to meet business needs. In addition, the Principal Data Architect will lead the design, build, and management of underlying data model that will deliver accurate, reliable data to the right place, in the right format, at the right time. This role will focus on the global enterprise data frameworks that will advance solutions such as data warehousing, business intelligence and advanced analytics. Job Description Collaborate with Enterprise Analytics portfolio holders, analysts, engineers, and support teams to make the enterprise data warehouse both fluid for change and always usable Develop technical solutions and frameworks to support the enterprise. Includes participating and understanding requirements, authoring best practice frameworks, and creating packaged data service offerings Deliver engagements and projects to optimize Intuitive data warehouse implementation while continually helping the organization migrate from their existing on-premises data warehouses to other cloud services. Continual innovation by leading Intuitive technology stakeholders to create a compelling vision of a data-driven enterprise in their environment Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum 12+ years of with data technology implementations 8+ years of experience leading development in large scale data warehouse environments 5+ years of hands-on experience maintaining MMP data warehouses 3+ years of hands-on experience with Snowflake of similar cloud data warehouse services Extensive hands-on experience in leading large-scale full-cycle enterprise data warehousing projects Extensive hands-on experience in data warehousing design, tuning and ETL/ELT process development Experience designing data warehouse environments and analyzing existing production deployments Ability to evaluate and plan migrations technical migrations between different data platforms Excellent SQL and strong hands-on scripting (bash, perl or python) ability Experience with cloud services in a variety of distributed computing, enterprise environments Understanding of database and analytical technologies in the industry including MPP databases, Data Warehouse design, BI reporting, Dashboard development and NoSQL storage Familiarity with continuous integration tools and targeted testing for reliable and quick deployments Experience independently solving complex problems Excellent technical documentation and communication skills Working in cross-functional teams to ensure superb end-to-end user experience for customers. Strong understanding of basic system engineering, object-oriented design, information risk and security guidelines, and architecture standards Additional Preferred Skills Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math Previous experience with Data Factory, Databricks to build ETLs and data models. Familiar with medical device manufacturing and product development processes Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description The Category Manager, NPI Sourcing will be responsible for sourcing direct materials and supplier selection of components to support NPI (New Products Introduction) programs. Actively identify & resolve potential supply issues that could impact program builds or supply chain strategy. Rapidly analyze and communicate key findings to senior leaders and execute resolutions. Lead and collaborate with cross-functional Supply Chain team members to ensure effective new product release to production purchasing. Support the tactical NPI purchasing team with tracking of orders, delivery commitments and inventory receipts both inside and outside of MRP. Act as an escalation point and liaison with the strategic sourcing team. Evaluates supplier reliability and aligns with Supplier Engineering, Design Engineering, and Supply Chain Management to develop new supply sources as needed. Monitors cost, schedule, and scope of assigned NPI projects. Other Roles And Responsibilities Optimize NPI supply chain performance through cost and scenario analysis, benchmarking, and negotiation. Develop supply chain strategies related to successful outcomes. End to End costed Bill of Material (BOM) responsibility with a focus on product launch goals of material availability, capacity, long term strategy, and cost. Lead and publish project material cost-models during each phase of NPI projects chain. Deep dive into sub-tier supply chains and all elements of the product production process. Lead & negotiate supply chain agreements related to quality, cost, delivery, capacity, and performance. Proactively resolve and/or escalate issues related to delivery, supplier performance, quality, or cost. Leads RFx (RFQ/RFI/RFP) events, understands key supplier capabilities, and match those capabilities to new designs and project schedules. Identify alternate sources of supply for critical components as required. Lead or support cross-functional Supply Chain team to identify, select and qualify new suppliers. Lead or represent NPI Purchasing at core team meetings and project phase-exit reviews. Work with engineering to assist suppliers in developing efficient manufacturing processes and production control to ensure BOMs are accurate and will function in a production environment. Support cross functional team on product cost & design for manufacturability. Coordinates engineering change order activity with suppliers and cross-functional teams. Lead or participate in the continuous improvement of current systems and processes. Be a functional, productive member of a high-performance team. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Must Have BS degree and a combination of education & experience in design engineering, manufacturing engineering, and direct material sourcing in a regulated industry manufacturing environment (medical preferred). 8+ years’ total experience working in direct materials in a New Product Introduction (NPI) environment. Hands on experience in any of the following strongly preferred: mechanical engineering, electrical engineering, optics, display technologies, precision CNC machining, plastic products, cast metals, or contract manufactures Experience with and a functional understanding of the manufacturing processes utilized by the suppliers of either mechanical components (precision machining, sheet metal, plastic injection molding and other plastics processes) or contract manufacturing, OEM or electro-mechanical components (motors / sensors), or electronic components (PCA/PCBA/Optics, etc) Working knowledge of buying, material planning, master scheduling, and forecasting. Nice to have Leadership skills A Masters Degree High analytics capability and experience Certifications: CPSM, CPIM, and/or PMP is a plus. Demonstrates concern for precision and thoroughness, ability to proactively follow-up on areas of responsibility in a timely manner. Experience working with engineers and manufacturing resources for prototype parts procurement, pilot activities and production launch of new products is a plus. Ability to enjoy and work effectively in a fast paced, chaotic environment of constant change. Ability to manage change quickly and gracefully. Significant computer experience including MS Office products and ERP systems, preferably SAP and Agile. Strong MS-Excel skills. Read and have a basic understanding of engineering drawings. Basic understanding of data visualization tools (similar to Tableau, Power BI etc.,) is a plus Experience with make vs. buy decisions & ROI analysis a plus Knowledge of Cost of Goods Sold (COGs) and cost levers. Experienced with supplier negotiations and contract development Exceptional pro-active problem solving & issue resolution skills Ability to form sourcing strategies and execute with broader cross-functional team (selling internally) Presentation skills and the ability to make complex topics simple to drive decision making Relationship manager: easily able to develop presence at all levels with suppliers, including interface with executive level audience Ability to switch between strategic and detail orientated thinking Ability to accurately assess suppliers and related performance trends: operational, sub-tier supply chain, business risks, technical, quality and technology/systems Collaboration at all levels of organization; includes interaction and communication with senior levels of internal management Understands the full product lifecycle and responsibilities of supporting teams/functions Ability to quickly assess business concerns and act on plans or strategies as required Travel: up to 25% to support interface with internal customers and supplier facing interactions Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Post Market Clinical Development Engineer uses their in-depth knowledge of the surgical environment and medical technology to investigate, understand, and address opportunities with products in the field work. The Post Market CDE also works with failure analysis/design engineers and clinicians to define, develop, and validate the clinical function of product improvements within our surgical robotic system platforms. They investigate and refine products including robotic systems, visualization platforms, instruments and accessories that ultimately improve the clinical outcome for patients. The primary focus of the CDE is to establish and validate data-driven clinical requirements to ensure a high-quality patient outcome. Roles & Responsibilities Apply in-depth knowledge of the operating room environment and of the da Vinci Surgical Systems to become an expert within the company on the clinical application of Intuitive’s products Work with regulatory surveillance, failure analysis engineering, clinical sales representatives, and surgeons, acting as a ‘detective’ to assess how use scenarios contribute to findings and address root cause Partner with Medical Safety Officer to characterize potential health hazards and feed evaluations to field action decision team Provide a clinical voice to product development by defining and assessing clinical performance of legacy products Collaborate closely with product engineering to define and assess products against clinical performance goals for product improvements Use an analytical approach to identify potential product enhancements Take an active role in sustaining engineering teams, including contributing to design reviews, and providing design guidance to engineering design teams Assess and document clinical risks, and identify appropriate mitigations Conduct pre-clinical testing to validate the safety and efficacy of new products Write protocols and conduct formal validation testing for product updates and releases, and modifications to existing designs, in order to validate the clinical safety and efficacy of the product. Support FDA/regulatory documentation and applications Provide subject matter expertise to user manual and training documentation development Maintain current knowledge of clinical applications of Intuitive’s products Collaborate with other organizations within the company as needed, including new product development, regulatory, quality, marketing, human factors, training, and sales Keep Intuitive’s vision and values at the forefront of decision making Perform other duties as required to support the company’s overall strategy and goals Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum of B.S. in Mechanical Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, or similar, advanced degree preferred Minimum of 5 years of experience in medical device industry with a B.S, 3 years experience with an M.S, or a PhD without experience Experience working in Risk Management specifically in ISO 14971 Experience working with surgeons in an operating room environment Fluent in surgical terminology and sound knowledge of anatomy and surgical technique Excellent mechanical aptitude and intuition for spatial relations, including the ability to understand complex mechanical products Excellent analytical capability and practical skills to develop test methods and draw conclusions Excellent teamwork skills with proven ability to cultivate collaboration across multiple disciplines Effective communication skills (verbal, written, presentation) Proven success recognizing critical issues and driving them to closure by taking coordinated action Self-starter needing minimal supervision Self-confident and able to react quickly under pressure Ability to travel up to 25% of the time, internationally and domestic Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical is widely considered the most exciting medical device company in the world today. Surgeons worldwide are changing the way surgery is performed by utilizing our robotic surgical device, the da Vinci® Surgical System, to enhance their surgical precision and greatly improve patient benefits. The Clinical Sales Associate will help maximize the utilization of installed da Vinci® Surgical Systems. Roles And Responsibilities Work with the Clinical Sales Manager to develop a strategy to drive utilization of the da Vinci® Surgical System Become a da Vinci® Surgery expert across all primary surgical specialties in order to support the development of surgical robotics programs in the assigned territory Support field efforts to achieve quarterly sales goals Support regional Sales and Marketing development events that create system awareness and procedure adoption Train and develop OR staff to be facile in pre, intra and postoperative system management Develop a da Vinci® Surgery plan for each surgical team to insure they are capable of using the system independently within a reasonable time frame Drive utilization of the da Vinci® system by working with surgical teams to select appropriate procedure applications Drive continuous expansion of the user base by working with key hospital staff and surgeon thought leaders to develop a qualified lead funnel Drive sales of instruments and accessories Responsibly manage administrative tasks; reporting of sales/procedures, outcomes of sales activities, submission of expense reports, etc. Lead surgical teams through training sessions, helping them understand system operations, OR integration and da Vinci® Surgery applications Be a resource to the surgical team, providing guidance and insight on the use of the da Vinci® Surgical System Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Minimum of two years prior sales experience Proven record of achievement and leadership Ambition and strong work ethic Ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Excellent interpersonal skills and persuasive communication skills Proven ability to work effectively as part of a team Ability to travel up to 25%, and work nights and weekends as needed Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical is widely considered the most exciting medical device company in the world today. Surgeons worldwide are changing the way surgery is performed by utilizing our robotic surgical device, the da Vinci® Surgical System, to enhance their surgical precision and greatly improve patient benefits. The Clinical Sales Associate will help maximize the utilization of installed da Vinci® Surgical Systems. Roles And Responsibilities Work with the Clinical Sales Manager to develop a strategy to drive utilization of the da Vinci® Surgical System Become a da Vinci® Surgery expert across all primary surgical specialties in order to support the development of surgical robotics programs in the assigned territory Support field efforts to achieve quarterly sales goals Support regional Sales and Marketing development events that create system awareness and procedure adoption Train and develop OR staff to be facile in pre, intra and postoperative system management Develop a da Vinci® Surgery plan for each surgical team to insure they are capable of using the system independently within a reasonable time frame Drive utilization of the da Vinci® system by working with surgical teams to select appropriate procedure applications Drive continuous expansion of the user base by working with key hospital staff and surgeon thought leaders to develop a qualified lead funnel Drive sales of instruments and accessories Responsibly manage administrative tasks; reporting of sales/procedures, outcomes of sales activities, submission of expense reports, etc. Lead surgical teams through training sessions, helping them understand system operations, OR integration and da Vinci® Surgery applications Be a resource to the surgical team, providing guidance and insight on the use of the da Vinci® Surgical System Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Minimum of two years prior sales experience Proven record of achievement and leadership Ambition and strong work ethic Ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Excellent interpersonal skills and persuasive communication skills Proven ability to work effectively as part of a team Ability to travel up to 25%, and work nights and weekends as needed Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The U.S. da Vinci® Clinical Sales Manager reports to the U.S. da Vinci® Clinical Sales Director. The da Vinci® Clinical Sales Manager plays a critical role in building and developing the clinical field sales team within his/her region. The major responsibilities are to manage and direct the utilization of the da Vinci Surgical System within their installed base. This will include managing installations, training and utilization growth within their assigned region and the hiring, training, and development of U.S. Account Managers. Roles & Responsibilities Develop and implement da Vinci® Surgery sales activities to achieve and exceed goals set by senior management Expand da Vinci® Surgery usage in all existing accounts Expand da Vinci® Surgery usage by selling and training new surgeons in all specialties applicable to the da Vinci® Surgical System Manage training and education process within installed base Lead new system installation process Prospect for new system installations and system upgrades to existing base Moderate to extensive travel Provide clinical sales team with new product information or new information on existing products Work with the training and marketing departments to implement new strategies and programs as directed by senior management Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Proven track record in da Vinci® Surgery Sales or clinical sales management experience In-depth knowledge of Operating Room Environment Strong background in selling medical capital equipment Previous record of managing and directing a sales force in the medical device industry Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Computer literate Training Requirements: Attend ISI field sales management training course Interviewing skills Remote field management Implementation of sales process Platform and presentation skill Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical is widely considered the most exciting medical device company in the world today. Surgeons worldwide are changing the way surgery is performed by utilizing our robotic surgical device, the da Vinci® Surgical System, to enhance their surgical precision and greatly improve patient benefits. The Clinical Sales Representative will help maximize the utilization of installed da Vinci® Surgical Systems. Roles & Responsibilities Work with the da Vinci® Clinical Sales Manager in developing a sales plan tailored to the local market Become a da Vinci® Surgery expert across all primary OR procedures to assist in the development of surgical teams Work with senior hospital staff and key surgeons in the development and execution of a plan to effectively integrate the da Vinci® at new customer sites, ensuring ongoing commitment to the system Develop a da Vinci® Surgery plan for each surgical team to support independent use of the technology Drive utilization of the da Vinci® System by collaborating with surgical teams to support usage of the technology Drive continuous expansion of the user base by working with key hospital staff and thought leaders to develop a qualified lead funnel. Regular activities consist of formal presentations, informal events, and get-togethers Effectively convert high potential leads and drive training activities Drive sales of instruments and accessories through new product introductions and solution selling Responsibly manage administrative tasks; reporting of sales/procedures, outcomes of sales activities, submission of expense reports, etc. Lead surgical teams through training sessions, helping them understand system operations, OR integration and da Vinci® Surgery applications Be a resource to the surgical team, providing guidance and insight on the use of the da Vinci® Surgical System Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required. A minimum of 5 years of sales experience including 2 or more years in healthcare sales. Proven track record in sales, achievement, and leadership. Excellent interpersonal skills and persuasive communication skills Ability to travel up to 25%, and work nights and weekends as needed  Success in introducing new technologies to the market is a plus. Knowledge of the Operating Room environment preferred.  This position may be hired at a lower profile. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical is widely considered the most exciting medical device company in the world today. Surgeons worldwide are changing the way surgery is performed by utilizing our robotic surgical device, the da Vinci® Surgical System, to enhance their surgical precision and greatly improve patient benefits. We have attracted some of the best and brightest on our team and now we are seeking entry level sales candidates to join our organization. The Clinical Territory Associate (CTA) will work closely with the Clinical Sales Manager to gain knowledge in all aspects of our business to include technical, clinical, and sales. He or She will train to be a da Vinci® Surgery technical and sales expert across all primary surgical specialties to develop surgical robotics programs in the assigned territory. During the first year of the job, the CTA will focus on the technical and clinical aspect of the job, and during the second year of the job, the CTA will progress and begin to focus on the sales aspect of the job. The CTA will have the opportunity to support a specific region by maximizing the utilization of installed da Vinci® Surgical Systems by leading product demonstrations/in-services and sales activities. This position is a developmental role and the time commitment includes some weekend work to accommodate surgeon schedules. Case Support -Be a resource to the surgical team by providing guidance, insight, and training on the use of the da Vinci® Surgical System Product Demonstrations/In-Services- Lead all technical in-services for customers to include OR staff, surgeons, etc. Selling Activities- Contribute to Clinical Sales Manager team quarterly sales goals by helping influence behavior change in customers such as product demonstrations/in-services, OR selling activities, and customer support trainings Customer Support- Support and or coordinate, under the direction of the local sales management team, regional sales and marketing development events that create system awareness and procedure adoption through product demonstrations/in-services and selling activities Administrative Duties- Responsibly manage administrative tasks: reporting of sales/procedures, outcomes of sales activities, submission of expense reports, and assigned ISU on-line modules using company required software system Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Bachelor’s degree required Sales degree a plus Minimum 1-year leadership experience or 1 year sales experience Proven record of achievement and leadership Ambition and strong work ethic Ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Excellent interpersonal skills and persuasive communication skills Proven ability to work effectively as part of a team Ability to travel up to 10%, and work nights and weekends as needed Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Data Privacy and Protection laws and regulations are evolving across the globe. The regulatory and operational impact to businesses is increasing in complexity and presenting new compliance challenges. Intuitive’s Global Privacy and Data Protection team helps develop and implement data privacy and protection safeguards, controls, and regulatory requirements into our products and services. The team supports Intuitive’s mission by promoting transparent, thoughtful, and deliberate collection, use, and dissemination of data in ethical, practical, and legally compliant ways. This Opportunity Will Expose An Intern To Several Key Areas Of The Global Privacy And Data Protection Program Including Reporting to the Director of Data Privacy Operations, the Data Privacy Intern(s) will be assigned two preceptors to gain experience specifically in Data Privacy Operations at Intuitive Surgical. Data Privacy Operations and Engineering Third Party Relationships Training and Guidance Privacy Breach Management Regulatory Privacy and Data Protection Roles & Responsibilities Data Privacy Intern(s) will have an opportunity to learn about multiple privacy program functions such as privacy by design, third party risk management, consent management and data flow mapping, privacy breach responsibilities, and training and awareness. Internship activities will also include conducting research into implicating regulation (e.g., HIPAA, GDPR, PIPEDA, etc.), participating in special projects, learning new technologies, etc. The internship experience will culminate in an official capstone project that will be documented and used by the team. Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The intern will report to Bill Nowlin, and day-to-day guidance will be delegated to either Robert Mostellar or Jeffrey Voien. Both Robert and Jeffrey report to me. Primary responsibility will be to shadow my team as they interact with business leaders to iteratively develop questions those leaders have about their business operations and their data, and develop insights iteratively. We also expect the intern to contribute meaningful analysis to, or solve, a stand-alone problem during his/her time with us. Roles & Responsibilities Become familiar with some ISI business and/or system-generated data, their restriction, and applicable use Wrangle said data into a form suitable for analysis and modeling Use advanced data science techniques and Tableau visualization to prepare explorable insights for business problems posed by senior leadership Join in explanatory and exploratory conversations with senior business leaders Present the intern’s findings (PowerPoint) him/herself to senior leadership (Unlike many data science positions where the individual interacts primarily with other data scientists, this person will interact directly with business leaders. This is a distinguishing feature of our positions that I believe should be strongly attractive to candidates.) Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Current enrollment in a Data Science degree-seeking program at the Master’s level. Associated advanced data wrangling skills, including SQL and python (or equivalent, such as R) and natural language procession. Associated modeling skills, including but not limited to, feature selection, recognizing and correcting bias in data, multivariate regression and logistic regression, random forest, clustering, etc. These skills should be part of any competent Master’s program. Strong interpersonal skills and communication skills (verbal, written, and graphically via Tableau or similar). Job Description Primary Function of Position: As a DevOps Engineer Intern, you will be working in our Infra OPS team on cloud orchestration and automation tools like Terraform and Ansible. The team consists of DevOps Engineers focused primarily on building automation pipeline, monitoring, performance tuning, and operation activities, etc. We also have Windows Engineer working on Windows automation using Ansible and Powershell. Roles And Responsibilities Using python/bash create application-specific monitors in Nagios, Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk-on-call etc. Using python/bash create automation and monitoring scripts Develop and deploy automation pipelines for serverless apps Implement DevOps practice by creating Jenkins/Gitlab pipeline for Docker builds CI/CD approval framework - script to create and populate a change request in ServiceNow/JIRA Learning Outcomes Exposure to learning advanced Terraform and Ansible for orchestration and configuration management Overall experience with Systems deployment, config management, and operations Ability to code in Python (advanced scripting as part of Network automation) Manage Kubernetes and Docker Ability to use a wide variety of open-source technologies and tools Ability to analyze and redesign business process workflows Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: Must be concurrently enrolled and returning to an academic program in the fall in an accredited degree-seeking program. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Requirements – To apply, you must be pursuing a 4-year Undergraduate Degree with a GPA of 3.0 or above, a 2-year Master’s Degree or a Doctorate Degree and returning to school in the fall. You must have the authorization to work within the United States. Computer science, Electrical engineering, Math science preferred Proficiency in Python, Bash or Ruby Strong knowledge of Linux - CentOS, Ubuntu, Windows Experience with Nginx, Kubernetes, Infrastructure as Code - Terraform, Ansible, Git, Puppet Knowledge of building docker containers Working knowledge of Load Balancers, FW and networking Exposure to Public Cloud Platforms – AWS (Preferred), GCP, Azure Commitment Must be available to work full-time hours, M-F for 10-12 weeks beginning Summer of 2023. We are an AA/EEO/Veterans/Disabled employer. jobTitle: Director, Automation Equipment and Test (AET) Engineering
jobDescription: Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description What We Are Looking For Director, Automation Equipment & Test (AET) Engineering within the Endoluminal team, reporting to the Senior Director of the Process Engineering organization. This is an exciting senior leadership opportunity to define and implement Intuitive’s strategic vision for manufacturing and test equipment, factory automation, and factory intelligence across our manufacturing sites globally. In addition to being a proven people leader, success in this role will require strong business and operations acumen, product development and medical device expertise, as well as technical leadership within mechanical, software, and electrical (i.e., mechatronics) engineering disciplines. Critical to the success of this role is proactive partnership with other senior Product Engineering and Manufacturing staff to scale operations for product quality, cost, and delivery objectives. Key Responsibilities Lead the Endoluminal Automation Equipment & Test (AET) Engineering team to design, build, document, and validate electro-mechanical production equipment, automated test equipment, tooling, and fixtures. Manage a team of Mechanical, Electrical, and Software Engineers including hiring, training, mentorship, academic/industry collaboration, and talent development. Additional functions may include Laser Services, Control Systems, Machine Vision, Engineering Technicians, Machinists, Technical Writers, and Data Analysts. Participate with Product Design engineering to implement Design for Assembly (DFA), Design For Automated Assembly (DFAA), and Design For Manufacturability (DFM) within the product development lifecycle. Effectively manage both internal and external equipment development projects, from concept definition and business case, through final qualification and facility transfers. Activities include performance specifications, factory acceptance testing, and IQ/OQ/PQ/PPQ within Intuitive’s overall Quality Management System (QMS). Support equipment engineering personnel and manufacturing sites globally, including United States (Sunnyvale and Atlanta) and Mexico. Improve product quality and reliability using Six Sigma, Cpk, Gauge R&R, and similar quality tools. Effectively leverage manufacturing data and factory intelligence to improve product design and operational efficiency. Knowledge And Abilities Proven ability to provide technical, strategic, and tactical leadership for staff and peers within global product development organization. Ability to listen to the needs of the business and actively seek ways to leverage technology in order to better address Intuitive’s opportunities or challenges. Excellent communicator who can communicate and evangelize globally, both within Intuitive, as well as with key opinion leaders (KOLs) and customers. Has a passion and experience for developing a team of highly technical professionals. Is committed to driving the tactics of key operations, while always thinking one step ahead for the future of the business; ability to lead complex, high visibility/high impact projects concurrently. Leveraging experience and expertise to recognize and resolve crucial issues exhibiting robust problem-solving skills and critical thinking. Ability to bring together multiple stakeholders to buy into solutions in situations of strong opposition. Excellent communication skills, written, spoken and public speaking. Leadership Capabilities Proven leadership management experience Build and develop credibility and relationships at all levels of the organization in order to successfully drive functional, product, and business objectives. Create an environment of high expectations and achievement. Challenge the organization and team to continuously improve and grow. Ownership of recruitment, retention and development of top talent. Provide coaching and mentoring to develop a leadership team, and lead by example to model expectations of Intuitive’s values and behaviors. Leverage Intuitive’s mission and goals and thoughtfully align local/functional objectives and goals to drive throughout the Process Engineering organization Represents the organization in relations with its customers and business and non-business communities Qualifications Key Position Requirements Minimum Bachelor’s degree in an engineering or scientific discipline. Advanced degrees (MS/PHD/MBA) are a plus. Requires minimum 7+ years of progressive people and operations leadership experience within a regulated hardware development industry. Medical device experience is a plus. Proven ability to inspire, attract and retain a team by leading with inclusion and diversity that will motivate people to produce their best work. Experience with a wide range of low/medium volume manufacturing processes including understanding of key input variables for quality, cost, and capacity. Ability to envision and lay foundations for meeting high-volume requirements in future years. Demonstrated success in unifying a product development and delivery strategy across a company/organization is needed. Advanced computer experience using Windows, MS Office Suite, SAP (or other ERP system), and Agile (or other PLM system). Multilingual in Spanish, German, or Mandarin Chinese and English is highly desired. 20% travel (including international) Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 10% of the time JOB2161

jobTitle: Director, HR Business Leader Human Resources and Finance
jobDescription: Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Key Responsibilities: In the role of Director of HR, candidate will have the opportunity to provide deep HR expertise in support of the Sr. HR Leaders who report up through the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) and Chief Financial Officer (CFO). The CHRO and CFO report directly to the Chief Executive Officer (CEO). This position will provide human capital centered thought leadership and strategic solutions to address business challenges of the Human Resources and Finance Corporate Functions. Partnering with the Vice President, Business Leader for Corporate Functions and the HR support structure, HR CoE’s (Centers of Expertise), Shared Services, and HR Solutions, you will proactively deliver initiatives and insight that drive/sustain human performance. Role And Responsibilities Candidate will serve as an HR leader who consults with client group leadership by providing talent-related business decision support, diagnostic and reactive analytics, human capital strategies, and organizational design support and change management. They will be the driver of solution development and deployment to support the talent strategies and needs. Focus centered solutions will need to address the needs of the business while considering broader implications within the overall enterprise. As a trusted advisor, the Director will design and deliver talent strategies that enable business success in alignment with corporate/functional group objectives and facilitating team assessments and interventions that enable high performance and organizational health. Thought Leadership Build a strong consultative relationship with senior executives, such that you are viewed as a trusted advisor and sounding board. Proactively collaborate with client group leaders and the HR team to translate business needs into impactful talent strategies and solutions that address the needs of the business while considering the broader implications. Partner with the extended HR team and client group leaders to drive implementation of strategies and programs, measure and track success and proactively drive improvement. Serve as a thought leader for the client groups on leadership expectations, culture, team performance and organizational design. Applies complex business information and analytics for effective decision making. Talent Management Partner with HR and Finance Corporate Function’s Executive teams to ensure employee experience and performance is aligned with Intuitive’s culture and business objectives. Develop and implement talent initiatives to optimize organizational health and effectiveness to deliver strong employee engagement In partnership with the business, establish and implement workforce plans to support the business objectives. Change Management Lead, develop, champion, and promote change in the workplace that is aligned to the company strategy and culture, building employee and organizational support and commitment. Uses expertise to shape cultural norms that optimize people and business performance. Qualifications Skills & Abilities: Position will need to influence and negotiate with the HR Leadership Team (HRLT), Centers of Expertise (CoEs), Shared Services, HR Solutions, Business Unit leadership (SVP/VP), and other business partners as necessary (e.g., Goal Setting, Difficult Feedback, Organizational Change, Management Coaching/Messaging, Human Capital Plans, Organizational transitions, etc.). Ability to drive HR activities and programs through a matrixed support model. Experience as an organizational leader with strong business acumen. Ability to draw from a broad range of sources: synthesize disparate pieces of information and relate them to the business issues at hand. Will often need to assess questions in the moment and provide insights, but also recognize that through their relationship/credibility defer when a definitive decision cannot be given. Ability to generate and apply novel solutions to inspire individual, team and organizations in new directions to support the business. Proactive collaboration with the global HR team and demonstrated ability to impact and influence to achieve business and organizational objectives. Analytical and conceptual thinking skills; ability to support recommendations through data and analysis. Ability to remain focused with strong attention to detail and deliver exceptional quality work. Ability to take a systems view outside the function and across the BU/company . Successful experience managing HR programs and projects. Exceptional communication (both oral and written) and interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build trust, credibility, and strong, productive relationships. Proven ability to work positively, collaboratively, and professionally within a team and across a global organization. Ability to drive change, think strategically and operationally. Ability to set priorities and be flexible in a changing environment; will be expected to use sound business judgement both in the moment as well as recognizing when others need to be involved in the decision-making process. Familiarity and comfort in working in a highly matrixed organization. Knowledge and demonstrated experience in working and communicating across cultures. Relevant industry experience a plus. Ability to travel internationally approximately 20% of the time. Education And Experience Minimum Bachelors (BS/BA) in Business Management, Human Resources, or related field is required Minimum of 12 years’ experience; of which 8+ years as an HRBP or in client-facing capacity (with progressive Executive level client group engagement (responsibilities). Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 10% of the time JOB1829

Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare’s hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Intuitive Overview: Intuitive is the world leader in robotic assisted surgery. As the industry pioneer, we pair ingenuity with intelligent technology to make a positive difference for patients and surgeons. For more than 25 years, we have developed new, minimally invasive surgical platforms and diagnostic tools to help solve complex healthcare challenges around the world. As pioneers, we’re not afraid to challenge the status quo and attempt what others view as impossible. We actively invest in our people to support their growth and contribution. Among our team, mutual respect, inclusive practices, and diversity of thought are a must — we believe a great idea can come from anywhere. Our technology has been used in approximately 10 million procedures. As we move into new areas and explore new technologies, we believe there is still tremendous opportunity to do great work in support of our mission. Intuitive Ventures Description Intuitive Ventures invests in and accelerates the digital, therapeutic, diagnostic, and device ecosystems of minimally invasive care. Our unique access to Intuitive’s industry-leading knowledge, care delivery innovation, and commercial reach, empowers us to cultivate the potential of startups that are advancing positive outcomes in healthcare. Through our inaugural $100 million fund, Intuitive Ventures is focused on accelerating the future of minimally invasive care by moving the ecosystem forward. Primary Function Intuitive has an immediate opening in San Francisco or Sunnyvale, CA for a Director of Intuitive Ventures. The candidate will work with the Head of Intuitive Ventures and cross-functional partners, to lead sourcing, due diligence, portfolio management and investing in transformative early-stage companies. The candidate will bring a strong track record in healthcare investing, proprietary deal flow in relevant fields and deep technical and operational insights from finance, venture capital, startup and/or life science experience. The candidate will be required to develop strong networks and investment theses, interact directly with senior leadership at Intuitive and manage due diligence processes and nimble teams. They will have the opportunity to leverage Intuitive’s deep technical, clinical and commercial strengths, as well as broad internal and external resources to advance deals and the ventures platform. They will play a key role in building the Intuitive Ventures portfolio and brand into an internationally recognized investing platform and contribute to development of a growing team as the group aligns to corporate venture capital best practices. This role requires commitment to healthcare advancement in support of Intuitive’s mission alongside a deep passion to make stellar financial returns – incentives are aligned to these dual goals. The candidate must excel in a high-energy, high performance, small-team environment. This role will report into the Head of Intuitive Ventures. Responsibilities Include This senior investment professional role will work closely with all members of the venture investing team and broader business stakeholders. Key duties include: Leading all aspects of the equity investment process for new deals and follow-ons. Activities include leading deal sourcing, thesis development, due diligence, financial analysis, term negotiation, closing processes and investment committee presentations for new and follow-on investments. Supporting in building Intuitive’s venture portfolio, taking an active role to provide portfolio company support and governance including Board Observer and Board Director roles. Active role in identifying opportunities to catalyze strategic engagement and collaboration and coordinate those engagements appropriately. Monitoring financial health and viability of portfolio and individual investments. Presenting options on addressing investment concerns and/or exit strategies, where applicable. Monitoring healthcare trends in key markets. Lead market landscapes and competitive analyses of investment opportunities in strategically relevant and priority sectors. Representing Intuitive Ventures through thought leadership and in external forums including attending industry conferences and venture events to identify prospective opportunities. Building and maintaining strategic relationships and networks with venture capitalists, entrepreneurs, and key opinion leaders in the innovative healthcare ecosystem globally. Qualifications Experience/ Skill Requirements: Advanced degree in related business and/or healthcare discipline; MD/MBA/Master’s Degree/PhD preferred. 10+ years in Venture Capital, Corporate Development, Private Equity, or Investment Banking. Additional experience in Management Consulting, Business Development, Product Marketing, or Product Management/Development is a plus Preferably 5+ years of relevant operational experience working within a fast-paced, medical device and/or biotechnology company. Expert knowledge of the healthcare venture ecosystem. Project management/leadership skills to lead/manage multifunctional teams to evaluate target opportunities and produce high quality analyses. Ability to drive projects to deliver timely results and follow through on commitments. Experience and track record in venture investment, execution and portfolio management, including experience in Board of Director and/or Observer roles. Expert analytical and financial modeling capabilities with motivation to teach and train team members on best practice skills and processes. Deep knowledge of international healthcare markets, latest scientific and technological advances and disruptive business models. Proven ability to build relationships and influence key stakeholders internal and external. Ability to gain alignment towards common objectives. Highly collaborative. Proven ability to work with and leverage resources cross-functionally and lead team both directly and indirectly. Demonstrated executive presence with exceptional communication and presentation skills. Demonstrated entrepreneurial drive. High integrity. Intellectual curiosity and strong learning ability. Job Description Primary Function: Position reports to the Senior Director, Global Supply Chain Responsibility for the design, performance and resiliency of Intuitive’s electronics and optics supply chain necessary to scale the manufacture and servicing of commercialized products. Leading a team of direct category managers and analysts located internationally to design scalable supply chains. Assist team with development and performance management of supplier partners, implementation of commercial mechanisms to ensure supply continuity and cost efficiencies, influencing of supplier/part selection at product development phase, defining sustaining engineering priorities for supply chain continuity and cost performance, as well as supporting Procurement in resolution of escalated supplier performance concerns or bottlenecks as applicable for electronics and optics suppliers. Will also support operational initiatives and plans as related to purchasing and sourcing direct materials across Intuitive’s global network of factory operations. Roles And Responsibilities People and team Lead, hire and mentor a team of supply chain strategists and analytical leaders in an agile and fast paced environment Maintains employee training curriculums, training compliance, and employee specific talent plans Creates and maintains employee succession and staffing plans for department workload distribution Develops, communicates and drives execution of goals to meet operational priorities and plans as related to Strategic Sourcing Emulate and drive Intuitive’s Culture by fostering our mission, founding principles, individual and leadership expectations Functional Develops and maintains operating procedures and practices associated with effective sourcing of direct materials to meet Company level standards and operational goals Presents and manages performance to core Strategic Sourcing metrics: examples include preferred supplier spend, supplier capacity readiness, supplier/part level risk mitigation, spend on contract, weighted cost performance and purchase price variance (PPV) performance Develops and maintains subcategory roadmaps, strategies and execution plans; solicits cross functional inputs and concerns to align efforts and achieve desired outcomes Engages with Sustaining Procurement, Master Scheduling, Supplier Engineering and Manufacturing functions to support build plan adherence, implementation of supplier capacity and risk mitigations as well as scenario planning as required Partners with NPI Sourcing team to influence supply chain and/or component selection decisions for new products Works in partnership with Sustaining and Supplier Engineering to scope and prioritize projects related to sustaining supply continuity: end of life, last time buy and other alternate sourcing efforts Develops and implements supply agreement terms for large spend, critical and/or high risk suppliers. Partners with Sustaining Procurement in executing supplier specific inventory, pricing or service level agreements where required Supports specific initiatives related to inventory performance to balance Company investment with service level requirements Leads resolution of significant/escalated supply constraint issues to ensure that business interruption risks are minimized. Job Description Primary Function of Position: As a member of the VSC (Vision Side Cart) NPD (New Product Development) team, this Electrical Engineer will be responsible for various PCA designs as part of Intuitive’s da Vinci system portfolio. The ideal candidate will possess a strong background in PCA design, high-speed digital design, system design, electrical testing procedures, and can carry a design/project through the entire product design cycle from “cradle to grave.” Roles & Responsibilities Be responsible for the design, testing, and troubleshooting for several PCAs Implement PCB stack-up designs that balances performance, cost, and manufacturability Work with internal NPI teams (e.g. procurement and manufacturing) as well as external CMs (Contract Manufacturers) and board fabrication vendors Perform board level bring-up and troubleshooting Collaborate with Firmware, Software, Mechanical, System Analysts, and Clinical teams on design, configuration, and integration Write V&V (Verification and Validation) protocols and associated scripts, as well as protocol execution Contribute to system design and architecture Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BS in Electrical Engineering Strong understanding of Digital logic design and transmission line theory Must have experience in PCA/B (Printed Circuit Assembly/Board) design Schematic capture experience a must (OrCAD preferred); PCB layout experience desired (Allegro preferred) Familiarity with simulation software (SI/PI) Experience with high-speed SERDES communication Benchtop/lab work, troubleshooting, and debug experience Ability to work well in a team environment and multi-task Ability to communicate effectively (written, oral) with the team Self-starter, highly motivated, insatiable curiosity, and willingness to learn Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The successful candidate will contribute broadly to the APD group, with focused contributions in FPGA Register Transfer Level (RTL) design and embedded software for robotic surgical platforms. As a member of this team, you will integrate complex functionality into complete surgical robotic solutions. The successful candidate must excel in a focused team environment, be able to derive solutions from rough requirements, and have a commitment to quality. Quick learning and a desire to understand requirements and create solutions are essential. A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required, as is the ability to make work fun and interesting. Supporting you will be a development and management team that knows and cares about what you are doing and promotes your success. Roles & Responsibilities Work in a cross-functional team to design, implement, and verify RTL in da Vinci™ Surgical System products using Verilog and SystemVerilog HDL. Design and implement RTL to interface with common robotic system components such as displays, sensors, and motor drivers. Develop effective self-checking testbenches to validate the RTL and report metrics for each test case. Design and/or develop modifications to existing IP, specifically focused on 3-phase motor control logic (e.g. BLDC commutation). Bring-up, troubleshoot, and integrate custom PCAs. Write and validate embedded software (C/C++) to interface with custom IP. Implement high-speed serial communications interfaces and inter-processor communication subsystems. Perform formal risk analysis and develop software mitigations. Follow rigorous design control methodology from design specification through design transfer to manufacturing. Write detailed design documentation (including specifications and verification plans) following Intuitive’s development guidelines. Support the Electrical Engineering team as needed with circuit design, PCA bring-up, and debug. Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Currently enrolled in Electrical or Computer Engineering Academic or practical experience with FPGA development is highly preferred Experience with: Writing complex RTL using SystemVerilog constructs such as interfaces and structures. Designing with fast fabric clock speeds and identifying and resolving CDC and timing violation issues. Interfacing with DDR3/4 and identifying bottle necks to improve performance using strategies like pipelining. Self-checking test benches using SystemVerilog with use of assertions to validate test sequences. Standard bench test equipment such as oscilloscopes, function generators, logic analyzers, protocol analyzers, etc. to verify and debug designs. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The U.S. ION® Endoluminal Sales Representative (ESR) reports to the U.S. ION® Endoluminal Sales Manager (ESM). The ION® ESR plays a critical role in the early adoption of the Ion® platform in expanding access to minimally invasive care for lung biopsy. This individual will be primarily focused on building and supporting early sustainable users and programs and the development of KOL’s and programs that can highlight the early clinical, economic and strategic value of ION®. Roles And Responsibilities Provide procedural support to new users to promote safety and effective progression through their learning curves Work with senior hospital staff and key physicians in the development and execution of a plan to effectively integrate Ion® at new customer sites, ensuring ongoing commitment to and utilization of the system Facilitate critical user and procedural data capture to create effective QTI and benchmarking metrics Work closely with the ESM and Marketing team to build Ion Catalyst Programs driven through the clinical, economic and strategic validation and impact of a robotus ION® robotic bioposy program Management of all associated activities to include case observations, training labs, attend first case series and development of teams and programs Become a clinical expert in the relative spaces. (Pulmonology, Oncology, Interventional Radiology and integration of Thoracic Treatment) Collaboration with daVinci local sales teams, leadership and Key Accounts to ensure consistent alignment and communication with internal and external stakeholders while implementing market strategy in major MSAs Responsibly manage administrative tasks, SFDC management, submission of expense reports, etc. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required A minimum of 5 years of sales experience including 2 or more years in healthcare sales Demonstrated ability to manage complexity and work in an environment of change Proven ability to understand new market dynamics and drive adoption of disruptive technology Effective communication and interpersonal skills Background in selling medical capital equipment Excellent clinical selling skills and ability to quickly develop credibility with a highly educated customer base Ability to travel up to 60% and located near a major airline hub Knowledge of the Pulmonology/Bronchoscopy space environment is a plus Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 50% of the time JOB3050

Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Strategic Alliances team is responsible for developing, executing and managing a partnership strategy to unlock new Endoluminal (“EL”) growth opportunities, bridge existing product/technology gaps and enable an “open access” platform. The Intern will support the prioritization of the pipeline of opportunities by analyzing new market opportunities (i.e. competitive landscape, barriers to adoption, market size) and their fit/impact within the future EL product portfolio. Roles & Responsibilities Conduct independent research on clinical, scientific and technical topics (i.e. scientific publications, patents, clinical studies); Attend company pitches and provide input and analysis on specific opportunities reviewed by the team; Support diligence, including the analysis of company materials, financial reports, develop competitive landscapes; Engage in technical product discussions with key Intuitive engineering and product stakeholders to understand gaps and assess fit of new technology within the portfolio; Creation of market adoption models to show potential financial value of new opportunities Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Current enrollment in a Science, Engineering or related degree-seeking program at the Master’s, or Doctorate level and/or work experience and knowledge of the healthcare/ life sciences ecosystem. Experience with financial analysis including interrogation of financial statements, building business models and projections in Microsoft excel Strong analytic and research skills and ability to communicate complex ideas and synthesized insights in simple written and verbal formats Self-starter and ability to work effectively across multiple teams, projects and deadlines Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 25% of the time JOB2660
