Job Description Primary Function of Position: Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineers (Systems Analysts) at Intuitive perform a central role in the design, development, and support of new products in the daVinci Surgery product lines. Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineers are primarily responsible for the tele-robotic motion & force control algorithms, robotic manipulator control, and safety algorithms for new surgical robots, instruments, accessories, and endoscopes. This responsibility crosses into mechanical, software, control, user interface, electrical, and safety engineering where all the subsystems are integrated together. Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineers strive to provide early design input, quickly prove out new designs, and seek out solutions to subtle and challenging problems in system integration, system safety, and motion & force control. Responsibilities continue until the products are shipping to customers with the highest quality and reliability. The Manager of a Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineering (Systems Analysis) team establishes individual responsibilities within their team, towards projects needing motion & force control algorithms and safety systems. They are responsible for tactical milestones for the projects their team supports. They advise senior management on the technical strategy for a product or a platform project. They maintain active liaison with other Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineering teams, software & hardware teams, manufacturing teams, and user facing & clinical engineering teams, to enable cohesion of design inputs, design architecture, specifications, and verification. They are expected to hire, coach, and retain Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineering talent within their group. Roles & Responsibilities Lead a team of Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineers towards successful accomplishment of product implementation with best-in-class solutions and architectures Provide in-depth analysis and characterization of electromechanical architectures during the entire design life cycle. Facilitate mechanical, electrical, and software integration of new prototypes and new products including complete robotic systems, manipulators, instruments, accessories, and endoscopes Analyze complex electro-mechanical devices for dynamic safety and clinical risk Implement safety monitoring algorithms based on sound physics and risk analysis Participate in clinical observations and experiments to ensure that performance requirements are relevant and realistic Adhere to, and contribute to, design control processes, including design reviews, presentations, documentation, and verification and validation testing activities Document and pursue intellectual property Communicate system architectural choices to the cross functional engineering team Improve cross functional workflow and interaction through tool building and teaching others Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum Masters in robotics related engineering field 6 + years of experience in control of mechatronic systems OR a Ph.D. with 3 years of experience in control of mechatronic systems. Minimum 1-3 years of people management experience, 3-5 years of cross-functional technical leadership in a Robotic Algorithms and Controls Engineers or equivalent role. Familiarity with design control processes. Strong embedded C/C++ programming capabilities as well as electromechanical and software integration skills. Strong engineering intuition for mechatronic systems, combined with detailed and data-oriented approach, to develop and push designs to completion. Nice To Have Prior experience in product development under medical device standards (such as ISO 13485, IEC 60601, and IEC 62304) is a plus. Understanding of, and experience in, implementing classical and modern servo control systems. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to facilitate robust decisions. Passion for product quality and continuous improvements across multiple functions. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Product Security Operations Team is responsible for software products, infrastructure, cloud services, and IoMT solutions that collect and analyze medical device machine data from thousands of systems deployed world-wide. The ideal candidate for the position of Manager/Sr. Manager- Application Security will have proven experience working in web and mobile application development, application security testing, threat modeling, vulnerability management, and product security management. This position requires a candidate with strong cybersecurity, technical, and interpersonal skills. The ability to work effectively and collaboratively with the business, pre-market cybersecurity, peer Engineering teams, and across business units to deliver high quality solutions that ensure patient safety and data/system security. Roles And Responsibilities Serves as a leader in Product Security team, manage team of application security engineers and support team’s mission by performing application security testing, threat modeling and support engineering teams Lead penetration testing, secure code reviews and threat modeling efforts for applications, support vulnerability management and incident response as required Perform security assessment, risk analysis, and report findings and recommend corrective actions Lead application security tools integration into CI/CD pipeline and development lifecycle Perform vendor security assessments and conduct security trainings for development teams Provide technical leadership in design of complex systems and contribute to technical directions and strategic decisions Develop metrics to assess, track and communicate progress, risks, and trends Work with key stakeholders to architect, select, and implement security-first tools for application security engineering function Prepare business and technical analysis Ensures comprehensive, real time status updates and report to key stakeholders Staying current with new and evolving security topics and technologies via formal trainings and self-directed education Other duties as assigned Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum Five or more years’ experience in web / mobile application development / testing / security Deep understanding of application security risks (XSS/CSRF, SQL injection, etc.) Hands-on experience with AWS technologies (EC2, VPC, EBS, ALB, RDS, S3, EKS, etc...) Hands-on experience with AWS Security, Identity & Compliance services (Amazon GuardDuty, Amazon Inspector, AWS Security Hub, etc...) Experience with secure code review in languages such as: Java, Python, C#, NodeJS, JavaScript Proficient with SQL, stored procedures, and general database interaction Passion for understanding and researching new vulnerabilities and exploitation techniques Proficient in complex network design (firewalls, load-balancing, TLS, switching and routing) Experience with application debug and troubleshooting, security logs, log aggregation and SIEM technologies Practical knowledge of OWASP Top Ten, how to discover, triage, verify and resolve the issues Knowledge of common security flaws and resolution as published by SANS, CWE, CVE, CVSS etc. Understanding of application threat modeling, secure coding principles and SDLC security best practices Expert level knowledge of TCP/IP, SSL/TLS, HTTP, switching and routing, Windows & Linux OS, Relational SQL databases Extensive experience with Splunk, Syslog, Nessus, nMap, Metasploit, Nexpose and Qualys guard CISSP, GCIA, GIAC, GISF, GSEC, SSCP, OSCP, OSWE or equivalent certification preferred. Work constructively with highly technical peers when security best practices and feature requests intersect Familiarity with common web application testing tools for DAST, SAST, SCA and IAST analysis such as Burp Suite, Checkmarx etc. BS/BA desirable along with demonstration of sophisticated and logical thought processes. Strong analytic skills as proven by a track record of analyzing and fixing complex problems in products and processes. Excellent judgment in the presence of competing priorities and incomplete data; proven ability to make difficult trade-offs with good judgment. Strong written and verbal communication skills and experience in working effectively in cross-functional teams Excellent judgement in the presence of competing priorities and incomplete data; proven ability to make difficult trade-offs with good judgement B.S in Computer Science or related technical major, or commensurate experience Ability to present and whiteboard technical architectures and workflows A strong desire to make work fun. Travel: <10~20% Job location: Sunnyvale, CA Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The mission of Supplier Engineering is to bring top quality components to our production lines by building a world-class supplier network that can ensure continuity of supply, growth to support our demand, achieve yearly cost reductions, and mitigate supply chain risks. The ideal candidate will apply their broad and deep hands-on experience in manufacturing and design of mechanical components and mechanisms to lead a team of high performing supplier engineers that support Multiport DaVinci Accessories for both on-going sustaining and new product introduction efforts. Roles And Responsibilities Manage and grow a high performing team of Supplier Engineers. Maintain a culture of achieving challenging goals. Coach and empower your team to continually improve. Work closely with design, manufacturing, and project teams to launch new products; implement performance, quality, capacity, and cost improvements. Manage project plans and timelines. Communicate to stakeholders on status. Seek out new suppliers in support of product needs. Assess suppliers for capability to fit Intuitive’s quality and business requirements. Develop suppliers to excel in all KPIs including Supplier Owned Quality, Capacity, lead time/on-time delivery and Sub-tier Management. Empower suppliers to own completion of part qualification deliverables: pFMEA, Special Process Validations, FAI, Cpk Studies, Capacity Studies, DfX, and cost analysis. Ensure compliance to quality management system and regulatory requirements by supporting supplier audits. Lead your team to solve complex problems using structured problem-solving techniques. Apply improvements for supplier process issues by using true root cause analysis and corresponding corrective and preventive actions. Develop and execute supply chain strategy and optimizations Collaborate with the Global Purchasing team to develop and execute the capacity plan to meet the long term demand forecast by part. Leadership Requisites Keep the organization’s vision and values at the forefront of decision-making and action Efficiently plan, manage, and execute projects that enable Intuitive to satisfy rapidly growing demand for Multiport Accessories. Manage the planning and implementation of supplier change management projects using the Supplier Change Request process (SCR) Establish milestones and success criteria for responsible projects. Drive decisions and escalate key issues quickly maintaining stakeholder alignment. Own new products during pilot production phase through successful and sustained project launch. This includes driving new product introduction schedules, resolving manufacturability issues, and driving improvements. Provide technical support for failure analysis of discrepant production components, assemblies, and field returns. Lead investigations where appropriate. Lead/participate in continuous improvement initiatives focused on material cost reduction, capacity enhancement, streamlining of supply chain, and commodity strategy. Mentor and set project tasks for Supplier Engineers on their specific project team and on other teams as needed to further company expertise & effectiveness. Empower your team to make decisions and celebrate their successes. z Carefully identify resource gaps and opportunities. Lead by example showing agility as a leader, resilience to difficult challenges and embracing changes to improve efficiency of the organization. Proactively identify gaps in process efficiency and lead change within the organization to facilitate the work of your team. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Systems Analysts (Robotic Control Engineers) at Intuitive Surgical perform a central role in the design, development, and support of new products in the DaVinci Surgery product lines. Systems Analysts are primarily responsible for the tele-robotic motion and force control algorithms, robotic manipulator control, and safety algorithms for new surgical robots, instruments, accessories, and endoscopes. This responsibility crosses into electrical, mechanical, software, control, user interface, and safety engineering where all the subsystems are integrated together. Systems Analysts strive to provide early design input, quickly prove out new designs, and seek out solutions to subtle and challenging problems in system integration, system safety, and motion & force control. Responsibilities continue until the products are shipping to customers with the highest quality and reliability. The Manager of a Systems Analysis team establishes the individual responsibilities within their team, towards projects needing motion & force control algorithms and safety systems. They are responsible for technical milestones for the projects their team supports. They advise senior management on the technical strategy for a product or a platform project. They maintain active liaison with other Systems Analysis teams, software & hardware teams, manufacturing teams, and user facing & clinical engineering teams, to enable cohesion of design inputs, design architecture, specifications, and verification. They are expected to hire, mentor & support career progress, and retain Systems Analysis talent within their group. Roles & Responsibilities Manage and lead a team of Systems Analysts towards successful accomplishment of product implementation with best in class solutions and architectures Provide in-depth analysis and characterization of electromechanical architectures during the entire design life cycle. Facilitate mechanical, electrical, and software integration of new prototypes and new products including complete robotic systems, manipulators, instruments, accessories, and endoscopes Analyze complex electro-mechanical devices for dynamic safety and clinical risk Implement safety monitoring algorithms based on sound physics and risk analysis Participate in clinical observations and experiments to ensure that performance requirements are relevant and realistic Adhere to, and contribute to, design control processes, including design reviews, presentations, documentation, and verification and validation testing activities Document and pursue intellectual property Communicate system architectural choices to the cross functional engineering team Improve cross functional workflow and interaction through tool building and teaching others Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Ph.D. (preferred) with at least 5 years of experience in control of mechatronic systems or Masters in robotics related engineering field, with a minimum 8 years of experience. At least 3-5 years of cross-functional technical leadership in a Systems Analyst or equivalent role. Familiarity with design control processes including risk analysis and formal verification. Prior experience in product development under medical device standards (such as ISO 13485, IEC 60601, and IEC 62304), is a plus. Strong embedded C/C++ and Matlab programming capabilities as well as electromechanical and software integration skills. Understanding of, and experience in, implementing classical and modern servo control systems. Strong engineering intuition for mechatronic systems, combined with detailed and data-oriented approach, to develop and push designs to completion. Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to facilitate robust decisions. Passion for product quality and continuous improvements across multiple functions. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Manager of Vision R&D Engineering will be responsible for leading a team of engineers who a) contribute towards the next generation vision product families focusing on endoscope cables across various product lines, b) devise engineering test methods for engineering product evaluations and characterization. This role is a key part of making data driven decisions to improve product designs prior to launch in addition to improving existing production released hardware. The role will be leading cross functional teams for development on current and new products. Roles And Responsibilities This key technical management role will guide and mentor a talented R&D engineering organization responsible for not only owning and developing the next generation of electro-opto-mechanical product designs, and also work with a team on devising robust engineering test methods for product evaluations and characterization for endoscopes and accessories. The team shall work closely with the electrical, optical, and other mechanical teams to collaboratively develop these novel designs. Preferred Skills Skillset in all areas is preferred, however candidates with skillset in two or more areas will be considered This role will flex between the areas listed below, based on project needs and candidate strengths. Requirements: Interface with clinical, usability, I&A design, and interfacing design teams to develop, negotiate, decompose/establish trace relationships for, and substantiate instrument and instrument interaction requirements. Risk: Lead the team to discover failure modes, and characterize design feature candidates to advance understanding of safety, performance, and business risk. Drive failure investigations, managing the agenda, driving experimental approach, and executing experiments. Design Feature Integration and Testing: Own design feature integration efforts with team, to advance the development of the full device. Lead the team through product development and testing to explore interactions between features and relationship between behavior of individual features vs the full device performance. Drive tradeoff decision making through use of said requirements and understanding of said risk and design feature interaction. Test: Drive the development of new methods, or improve existing test methods to enable rigorous risk characterization and failure mode discovery. Tasks include leading the team through designing and building custom test fixtures / setups, clinical relevance substantiation, automation as applicable, and stratification of test conditions. Additional Duties Provide technical leadership to the Vision R&D Engineering organization Lead, and be responsible for novel product development work on endoscopes, and test method development for endoscopes and accessories Analyze the current product performance, to identify opportunities for design improvements and implement changes Establish group and individual objectives, priorities, and metrics to: Communicate results to stakeholders or in formal documentation when appropriate. Ensure fulfillment of current customer demands Ensure progress towards Product Development goals Ensure reliability and efficiency improvements of existing products Ensure the professional development of individual team members Collaborate with the Endoscope design teams on multiple platforms, New Product Introduction (NPI) and Manufacturing teams to implement required manufacturing processes (Equipment, Manufacturing Instructions, Travelers, etc.) Maintain compliance with medical device quality system, discrepant material disposition and Engineering Change Order (ECO) implementation. Lead cross functional team(s) in our Product Development Process (PDP) including: generating formal design documentation, review, and control (e.g. design reviews, ECOs, etc.), test method development, compliance with applicable local standards Work with cross functional development team (RA/QA/ME/NPV/CDE) to develop and manage project contracts, including; project plans, budgets, managing timeline, risks and issues to meet customer and business goals Plan, budget and staff projects, tracking performance throughout. Work with Quality Engineering group to ensure that the team follows appropriate GMP, design history file (DHF), and device history record (DHR) guidelines per FDA requirements, and support design reviews in accordance with product development procedures. Clearly define and motivate unmet needs and their context in the marketplace. Coach, develop and manage the engineering team through influential leadership, balancing the development objectives of the team with the needs of the organization. Qualifications Core Competencies, Skills and Experience Requirements: Minimum B.S. degree in Engineering discipline, M.S. preferred. Minimum of 8 years’ of direct experience managing/mentoring engineers is preferred Minimum of 10 years’ experience in design, manufacturing, or service environment for complex electro-mechanical products. Experience with medical device design and interface design is preferred. Track record of leading and developing sustainable teams. Knowledge of ISO requirements and GEP/GMP guidelines. Familiarity with sterilization processes and design guidelines for sterilization and reprocessing Familiarity with small part assembly and manufacture A passion for creating robust and reliable products An excitement to get to the bottom of challenging technical problems Proven ability to maintain schedule while bringing products from concept to manufacturing introduction. Strong mechanical engineering intuition Track record as a systems level architect and demonstrated ability to lead teams to realize the architectural vision Ability to motivate, mentor, and inspire a high capacity technical team. Prior responsibility for validation of products is a plus. Strong quantitative process development skills including (d)FMEA, (p)FMEA, tolerance analysis, DoE, SPC, GR&R, and CpK. Familiarity with mechanical CAD software (Solidworks). Excellent organizational skills; Able to manage multiple fast-paced projects simultaneously. Prior experience with Agile Change Control and SAP is a plus. Ability to communicate effectively and professionally across a range of technical disciplines with a broad slate of stakeholders, including management, peers, customers, and suppliers. Prior experience with the Design Control processes for medical devices and clinical application of surgical instruments is a plus Experience in an ISO 13485, ISO 9001, or medical dev

Job Description At Intuitive, we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. Our mission is our guiding force; our culture is the DNA that makes us unique. As a pioneer in robotic-assisted surgery (RAS), we have been expanding our innovations through technology to help make a difference in the world. We believe a great idea can come from anywhere—inclusion and mutual respect are vital to our culture. We value character grounded in integrity, a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and diverse experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and strive to achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s help to advance the world of minimally invasive care. Overview Intuitive is creating a new surgical robotic system manufacturing facility in Peachtree Corners, GA. This position will be a key member of a new manufacturing engineering team that will establish, transfer, qualify and scale complex medical surgical robotic systems manufacturing lines. This position requires an extremely motivated individual with high capacity to learn, analyze and drive technical issues to closure in the manufacturing environment. It requires both a proactive mindset to build a strong technical understanding of the product/processes, and a high level of urgency to react to unplanned problems when they arise. Joining Intuitive means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority. Primary Function Of Position You will be responsible for supporting the duplication, qualification, and sustaining of manufacturing lines that build Multi Port (MP) robotic systems in Peachtree Corners. You will perform regular analysis of factory data and use it to anticipate and solve manufacturing/quality problems. Deliver improvements in yield, reliability, serviceability, manufacturability, testability, capacity and cost. Interface with cross-functional engineering teams including electrical, mechanical and software disciplines. This position is highly collaborative, and strong communication/presentation skills will provide you with high visibility amongst the engineering, production and management teams. Roles & Responsibilities Duplicate, qualify and scale surgical robotic systems manufacturing lines in the new facility Provides product and process Design for Manufacturability input to enhance manufacturability and servicing. Takes ownership of products from production phase through end-of-life. Assists in creation and maintenance of efficient “mid-volume” manufacturing assembly line, specifying and/or refining BOMs, work flow processes and detailed work instructions. Provides training and support to production technicians. Design, qualify, document and introduce production and service assembly/test fixtures and equipment. Takes responsibility for maintaining compliance with medical device quality system including corrective action closure, discrepant material dispositions and ECO implementation. Provides technical support analyzing and /or performing failure analysis for discrepant production components, assemblies and field returns. Leads/participates in initiative focused on yield improvement, material cost reduction, capacity enhancement, and outsourcing of assemblies. Must possess strong communication skills to interface with technicians, product development, planning, purchasing, regulatory, inspection, customer support and clinical marketing organizations. Manage and allocate team resources over multiple projects. Negotiate for needed resources from other teams to enable project success as needed. Creating budget estimates for tooling, test equipment, prototype designs, and first article activities. Assist material procurement and supplier quality teams with development and maintenance of contract manufacturers for mechanical assembly. Performs other duties as required. Travel: Position may require up to 25% travel initially, primarily within U.S. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Required Candidate must be of high character and energy with regard for detail. Demonstrated Electro-mechanical and/or Process Engineering ability. Demonstrated ability in failure analysis and continuous improvement. Minimum BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent. Minimum 3-5 years relevant work experience. “Self-starter” attitude and comfort in a hands-on environment, where he/she can demonstrate an ability to work with other engineers to influence product design to improve reliability. Troubleshooting mind set - an ability to systematically and effectively break down a system or process into subparts to identify failures and troubleshoot to component level. Excellent documentation skills and ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing across all levels of the organization. Preferred Minimum MS degree in an Engineering discipline. Minimum 5-7 years relevant work experience as a design or manufacturing engineer supporting product with significant mechanical content. Prior experience with various sensor applications and technologies, including reliability and performance assessment. Prior experience working in an FDA/ISO regulated environment. Demonstrated ability to effectively design experiments. Prior project leadership experience. Prior supplier quality responsibility. Prior responsibility for process, equipment or product validation/verification. Prior experience establishing new manufacturing lines. Prior experience applying automated equipment, complex mechanism manufacturing, or robotics. Machine tool experience a plus. Experience with ASME Y14.5 Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerance. Experience in Just-In-Time, Demand Flow Technology, and Lean Manufacturing techniques. Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: An Equipment technician providing mechanical and electrical troubleshooting and repairs for Manufacturing and Test equipment used to produce minimally invasive medical devices for the Ion robotic-assisted endoluminal platform. In addition, this candidate will assist the Ion Equipment Engineering staff in equipment assembly, testing, rebuild, and validation. This manufacturing and test equipment will range in complexity from custom manual fixtures to semi-automated electro-mechanical systems. This position will play a critical role in sustaining Ion production and assisting the engineering development and implementation of cutting-edge manufacturing capabilities for Ion operations. Responsibilities Performs assembly, installation, troubleshooting, and repairs on electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing processes. Read mechanical drawings, electrical wiring and pneumatic diagrams Install, diagnose, and repair equipment at assembly and component level Troubleshoot equipment software under supervision. Work with Preventive Maintenance team to perform PM procedures on a periodic basis. Support activities related to equipment qualification and process validation Work with Equipment engineering staff and other teams to contribute ideas and improvement regarding the design, maintenance, or process of manufacturing equipment. Review/maintain spare parts for equipment Work overtime when necessary to support high priority requests or meet project goals. Perform other duties as needed to assist with Equipment engineering projects Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: A minimum of a High School diploma or GED required. Associate of Science Degree preferred. Minimum 2 years of experience of relevant electrical/mechanical tests, troubleshooting, and repair. Vocational or technical education or certification in addition to prior work experience a plus. Experience in equipment used in catheter and similar manufacturing process preferred Experience in assembly of mechatronics components such as sensors, motion and vision components Uses a variety of hand, power, and test tools and equipment; machining experience a plus Basic wiring (AC/DC), cabling, and electronics knowledge; handling ESD-sensitive components a plus Self-motivated, strong work ethics, flexible, organized Works well with others in a supportive and dynamic team environment Able to effectively communicate ideas and issues to Equipment staff and other teams Proficiency in basic computer skills, such as Word and Excel; SAP a plus Experience working in a clean room environment a plus Lift up to 50 pounds to a workbench under ideal conditions Able to travel periodically (10%) Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The primary role for this position is to partner with Manufacturing to develop and sustain a well-trained and flexible workforce through hands-on training, mentoring, and formal certification. Work closely with Production and Training Supervisor to identify and prioritize quarterly training goals based on production needs and training scorecard. Routinely meet with Production and Training Supervisors to review training plan in order to achieve quarterly goals. Assist in maintaining the accuracy of manufacturing and training documentations to ensure the effectiveness of the training program. Roles & Responsibilities Deliver OJT training courses in the areas of manufacturing skills and processes, quality system/GMP practices and requirements, information technology tools, and other subjects as required. Assess employee skills and provide feedback to management Track and maintain training data for accuracy Provide technical support to Manufacturing personnel and the production line as needed. Conduct training of Manufacturing personnel and perform certifications per certification criteria and requirements. Perform weekly and monthly audits of manufacturing area based on Manufacturing Standards and Guidelines. Solicit Training Evaluation from Manufacturing personnel to identify areas for improvement in training process. Properly complete manufacturing documentation, initiate reports, escalate quality issues, report efficiency, and record measurements as needed. Maintain excellent attendance record Identify and prevent gaps in training and production coverage Update/ red-line MPIs using PowerPoint/Excel/Word as required. Perform other duties as assigned Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Education and/or experience: Minimum High School Diploma or equivalent Experience with relevant manufacturing related software such as Agile, SAP, and ISU Perform at a high level with consistency and be in good standing, (e.g. QPN quality issues and Attendance). In addition you must demonstrate leadership, independence, and meet CCEE standards. Basic level of competency with MS Word, Excel and preferably PowerPoint Ability to present training course material to individuals and groups and to effectively facilitate their learning process Excellent written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills A firm understanding of Demand Flow Technology/Lean Manufacturing concepts and disciplines. A firm understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Intuitive Surgical quality system requirements. Solid understanding of all manufacturing guidelines, policies, procedures, DOPs, etc. Has an understandingof MPI/WI templates, Design Controls, Change Controls, Product and Engineering Processes Preferred twelve (12) months of experience in ISI product manufacturing. Excellent technical assembly capabilities and exceptional track record in production. Provide both support in the training department and with manufacturing production Leading by example and be a strong team player Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The successful candidate will design, implement, debug, and verify embedded and PC software necessary for the automated production of new robotic surgical platforms. Job Description Primary Function of Position: We are seeking multiple Marketing MBA Interns to support teams across the organization. These positions have the opportunity to make a direct impact on Intuitive’s product and procedural initiatives which make Intuitive’s offering available to patients worldwide. With the direction and supervision of a mentor, the MBA Intern will play a role in creating strategy for markets and products which will enable adoption and growth of the company’s commercial portfolio. Based on candidate’s interest and qualifications, Internship positions may be available in: Corporate Product Portfolio Marketing Corporate Hospital Marketing Please note that the deadline to apply is 1/6/2023, unless otherwise noted in your campus portal. Roles And Responsibilities This position has responsibility and authority to: Deliver analysis and strategy to drive marketing direction of a procedure, product and/or service, possibly including, but not limited to: positioning, messaging, segmentation, pricing, market share review, collateral gap analyses, and conducting market research. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to create go-to-market plans and rollout strategies that will enable successful launches. Develop an understanding of the value proposition and how to communicate that message to key customers and constituencies such as physicians, providers, and sales force. Work with key stakeholders to better understand how the procedure, product and/or service are being utilized and determine how to communicate that value proposition to target customers The Marketing MBA Intern Will Gain a deep understanding of procedures, products, and/or services and their value propositions Analyze and assess the dynamics of the particular market, its associated call point, and how Intuitive’s offerings are positioned within this context Work cross-functionally to develop a strategy for the project – including identifying key success criteria and metrics which are measurable and executable Spend time interfacing with customers and Intuitive experts to gather first-hand knowledge of the project’s potential impact and how best to execute on its goals Complete and deliver strategy and action plan, including key tools, identified as needs for part of the marketing strategy Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Material Handler 2 is a position requiring experience in warehousing operations, advanced technical skills (equipment operation, cycle counting, space utilization, handling efficiency), in-depth knowledge of inventory management systems and software (Agile, SAP, WMS). Primary Roles And Responsibilities This position will fulfill the following roles: Receiving: Receiving materials, physically and systemically, to be used in production operations and engineering projects. Parts Put-away: Physically and systemically moving approved Production materials from Incoming Quality staging areas into Warehouse storage locations. Warehouse: Parts Replenishment: Point-of-use parts replenishment for designated production lines. MT (Material Transfer): Fulfilling and transacting MT requests, received either electronically or via hard copy. Sales Order Fulfillment: Fulfilling and transacting Sales Orders and Service Transfer Orders. Pack Out: Packing System carts, FRUs (Field Replaceable Units) and kits. Qualifications Responsibilities: Comply with general Good Warehouse Practices (GWP) and Warehouse housekeeping processes. Communicate verbally and via email the status of material movements and transactions to appropriate internal customers. Actively participate in the Continuous Improvement program, including the creation and implementation of small scale improvements. Perform material movement transactions accurately in SAP, including WMS movements Be trained and certified to operate advanced material handling equipment. (Stand-up and order picking lift trucks, and/or electric pallet jack). Effectively apply knowledge of material flow and basic warehousing principles to Material Handling assignments (FIFO, consolidation, lean principles.) Participate in cross-functional projects. At the direction of the Supervisor, support training new personnel or cross-train existing personnel, including all required documentation, record keeping and reporting. Perform cycle counts and other Warehouse activities as needed. Working knowledge of Lean Manufacturing 5s, and Kanban processes a plus. Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Material Handler 3 is an advanced position requiring significant experience in warehousing operations, exceptional technical skills (equipment operation, counting, space utilization, handling efficiency), in-depth knowledge of ISI’s inventory management systems and software (Agile, SAP, WMS), strong interpersonal and communication skills. The Material Handler 3 is responsible for material-handling duties in support of Production operations, both Sustaining and NPI, and other internal customers. To be eligible, a Material Handler must be in good standing (attendance, quality, behavior) and certified to and excel in a minimum of 3 key tasks from the following: receiving (tote and bulk); parts put-away (tote and bulk); point-of-use parts replenishment (Route Runner); material transfers (MT); stock transfer orders (STO); single parts presentation kitting (SPP); systems packing (all carts); Mexico deliveries. Primary Roles And Responsibilities Following training and certification(s), this position has responsibility and authority for: Receiving materials, physically and systemically, to be used in production operations and engineering projects. Physically and systemically moving approved Production materials from IQC staging areas into SMKT storage locations. Point-of-use parts replenishment for designated production lines. Production parts replenishment via SPP kitting. Fulfilling and transacting MT requests, received either electronically or via hard copy. Fulfilling and transacting Sales Orders. Fulfilling and transacting STOs Parts replenishment for the Mexicali plant. Packing System carts, FRUs and kits. Performing systemic transactions in both SAP and ISI’s Warehouse Management System (WMS). Complying with materials management policies and processes, including First In/ First Out (FIFO) material rotation, 5-S, Safety, Quality, and Good Warehousing/Housekeeping processes. Participating in or leading the daily cycle counts. Operating powered material handling equipment (stand-up and sit-down fork lift, electric pallet jack, order-picking machine). Communicating via e-mail the status of material movements and transactions to Supervisor (when appropriate), Lead and internal customers. Secondary Roles and Responsibilities: Implement projects, including leading project teams, as directed by Supervisor or Lead. Identify areas or opportunities for operational improvement. Focusing on efficiency and quality, develop proposals for systems and process improvement. Gain consensus from Supervisor and drive the implementation of improvements. Become knowledgeable of all key tasks performed by Lead and fill the Lead position when the Lead is absent, including the assignment of department personnel throughout a shift and maintenance/issuance of required reports . Be proficient in the role of deputized trainer. At the direction of the Supervisor, train new personnel or cross-train existing personnel, including all required documentation, record keeping and reporting. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Competency Requirements: (competency is based on: education, training, skills and experience.) Possess high school degree or equivalent. Minimum 3-years of experience in Material Handling operations preferred. Ability to effectively communicate with peers and internal customers, both verbally and written. Inventory control experience (cycle counting, physical inventories) preferred. Experience and/or certification in operating powered material-handling equipment preferred. Ability to lift material up to 50 lbs. Extensive walking and repetitive physical motion (squatting, bending, lifting, climbing ladders) is required. Experience with computer systems (MS Office, SAP, Agile, WMS) preferred. Certified to a minimum of 3 key material-handling tasks. Must consistently exceed efficiency standards and quality goals when performing them. Strong interpersonal skills, specifically leadership, coaching and training. Strong verbal and written skills required to effectively communicate with Team members and internal customers. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Material Handler 3 is an advanced position requiring significant experience in warehousing operations, exceptional technical skills (equipment operation, counting, space utilization, handling efficiency), in-depth knowledge of ISI’s inventory management systems and software (Agile, SAP, WMS), strong interpersonal and communication skills. The Material Handler 3 is responsible for material-handling duties in support of Production operations, both Sustaining and NPI, and other internal customers. To be eligible, a Material Handler must be in good standing (attendance, quality, behavior) and certified to and excel in a minimum of 3 key tasks from the following: receiving (tote and bulk); parts put-away (tote and bulk); point-of-use parts replenishment (Route Runner); material transfers (MT); stock transfer orders (STO); single parts presentation kitting (SPP); systems packing (all carts); Mexico deliveries. Primary Roles And Responsibilities Following training and certification(s), this position has responsibility and authority for: Receiving materials, physically and systemically, to be used in production operations and engineering projects. Physically and systemically moving approved Production materials from IQC staging areas into SMKT storage locations. Point-of-use parts replenishment for designated production lines. Production parts replenishment via SPP kitting. Fulfilling and transacting MT requests, received either electronically or via hard copy. Fulfilling and transacting Sales Orders. Fulfilling and transacting STOs Parts replenishment for the Mexicali plant. Packing System carts, FRUs and kits. Performing systemic transactions in both SAP and ISI’s Warehouse Management System (WMS). Complying with materials management policies and processes, including First In/ First Out (FIFO) material rotation, 5-S, Safety, Quality, and Good Warehousing/Housekeeping processes. Participating in or leading the daily cycle counts. Operating powered material handling equipment (stand-up and sit-down fork lift, electric pallet jack, order-picking machine). Communicating via e-mail the status of material movements and transactions to Supervisor (when appropriate), Lead and internal customers. Secondary Roles And Responsibilities Implement projects, including leading project teams, as directed by Supervisor or Lead. Identify areas or opportunities for operational improvement. Focusing on efficiency and quality, develop proposals for systems and process improvement. Gain consensus from Supervisor and drive the implementation of improvements. Become knowledgeable of all key tasks performed by Lead and fill the Lead position when the Lead is absent, including the assignment of department personnel throughout a shift and maintenance/issuance of required reports . Be proficient in the role of deputized trainer. At the direction of the Supervisor, train new personnel or cross-train existing personnel, including all required documentation, record keeping and reporting. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Competency Requirements: (competency is based on: education, training, skills and experience.) Possess high school degree or equivalent. Minimum 3-years of experience in Material Handling operations preferred. Ability to effectively communicate with peers and internal customers, both verbally and written. Inventory control experience (cycle counting, physical inventories) preferred. Experience and/or certification in operating powered material-handling equipment preferred. Ability to lift material up to 50 lbs. Extensive walking and repetitive physical motion (squatting, bending, lifting, climbing ladders) is required. Experience with computer systems (MS Office, SAP, Agile, WMS) preferred. Certified to a minimum of 3 key material-handling tasks. Must consistently exceed efficiency standards and quality goals when performing them. Strong interpersonal skills, specifically leadership, coaching and training. Strong verbal and written skills required to effectively communicate with Team members and internal customers. Researches, analyzes, and makes recommendations for the resolution of job related issues. Able to demonstrate accuracy and thoroughness in completing work assignments. Job Description The Mechanical Design Engineer must utilize creativity and sound engineering judgment in the design of parts and subassemblies of next generation mechanical systems for medical capital equipment. The Mechanical Design Engineer is expected to use machine design and analytical skills to conceptualize, develop, and verify new mechanical designs. They are responsible for key system components and will interface with suppliers and manufacturing to build high-quality hardware prototypes and productize new designs. The Mechanical Engineer should be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time constraints and ambiguous or incomplete information typical of research and development. Apply today and join one of the most exciting mechanical design and mechanical systems teams working on world-class surgical robotics. Roles & Responsibilities Designing components and producing mechanical drawings in a regulated environment for volume manufacturing processes which may include cast metal, injection molded plastic, sheet metal stamped, and others Working within multi-disciplinary teams to define requirements for new and current designs Rapid development and iteration of full-scale prototypes of candidate architectures to satisfy requirements Developing mechanical assemblies, with careful consideration for key functions and safety Designing for manufacturability, reliability, serviceability, and cost Selecting and managing vendors in the prototype phase Collaborating with manufacturing to create product assembly tooling, fixtures, and instructions Developing and performing component verification testing and product validation testing Supporting production of final product by troubleshooting process and component problems Providing engineering support to Manufacturing, Test Engineering, and Service to facilitate transfer of designs Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Required Minimum BSME, or similar Interest in the medical applications of robotics Ownership of key components or assemblies through multiple products Comfortable with all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer Passion for details in creating robust and reliable machines designed for mission-critical applications Experience designing for volume manufacturing processes such as metal casting, plastic injection molding, sheet metal stamping, compression molding, thermoforming, etc. Ability to apply knowledge of engineering materials and component selection criteria to product designs through strong concept development, design analysis, hands-on prototyping, and reliability testing skills Proficiency using CAD, analysis Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Self-driven with the ability to excel in a high-energy, small, focused team environment, to maintain a strong sense of shared responsibility and reward, and to make work fun and interesting Preferred Post-graduate study or equivalent work experience preferred Robotics or Mechanical Systems design experience. Surgical or medical device product experience is a plus. Ability to execute and document component and assembly changes in an automated change control system and demonstrate that the changes were made properly Effective collaboration with multi-disciplinary functions like clinical, human factors, industrial design, interaction design, etc. Experience with Finite Element Simulation (FEM, FEA ,CFD, Multiphysics, etc.) tools to design mechanical assemblies SolidWorks experience Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Multiport Systems Mechanical Engineering team is responsible for the development of the next generation da Vinci Surgical System from product concept through market launch. The team is searching for a Mechanical Engineer to work on a cross-functional team to develop and execute designs to support additional audio/visual features for the system. The Mechanical Engineer is expected to use machine design and analytical skills to conceptualize, develop, and verify new mechanical designs for medical capital equipment. They are responsible for key system components and will interface with suppliers and manufacturing to build high-quality hardware prototypes and productize new designs. The Mechanical Engineer should be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time constraints and ambiguous or incomplete information typical of research and development. A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared required as well as a commitment to product quality. Roles & Responsibilities Designing components and producing mechanical drawings in a government regulated environment Working within multi-disciplinary teams to define requirements for new and current designs Ownership of key components or assemblies through multiple product launches to market Creating and managing design requirements, specifications, failure-modes analysis, and associated verification and validation testing. Collaborating with vendors, suppliers, quality and manufacturing Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BSME or similar, with minimum 4 years of relevant experience. Proficiency using CAD, FEA and CFD simulation tools, and computational analysis (e.g. Matlab) to optimize designs. Direct experience in complete documentation of designs and release of designs in a rigorous document-control system Understanding of the basic elements of tolerance analysis when designing mechanical structures and some knowledge of design for manufacturability Experience in designing and working with machine shops to have fixtures and parts built for quick, prototype evaluation Detail-oriented in creating reliable systems that harmonize multiple requirements, e.g. structural, thermal, packaging, acoustic, cleanability, ergonomics, user-interface. Comfortable with all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer Self-driven with the ability to excel in a high-energy, focused team environment, to maintain a strong sense of shared responsibility and reward, and to make work interesting and intellectually vibrant. Preferred Post-graduate study, MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience preferred. Experience in growing design maturity for product launches, scalable manufacturing processes, design for reliability, yield, and cost. Experience in design work on audio/visual enclosures and assemblies Effective collaboration with cross-functional teams such as industrial design, human factors, clinical engineers, and interaction design. Solidworks, Matlab, Ansys and Windchill experience. Job Description Primary Function of Position: As Equipment Engineer you will use your background and experience with manufacturing equipment, to develop and deploy automated assembly lines. The successful candidate will work closely with Automation, Controls and Process Engineering, Maintenance, vendors and other teams to define, improve and monitor equipment reliability, throughput and process capability. They define, deploy, monitor and improve the Preventive Maintenance specifications, SPC on tool parameters, bill of material and spare parts requirement. They review, analyze and investigate equipment related scraps and provide root cause analysis and effective corrective actions. The position acts as a technical advisor on all equipment issues and provides technical feedback to the Automation and Manufacturing Engineering team. They are hands-on technical individuals with strong electromechanical troubleshooting skills. Roles & Responsibilities Support manufacturing and development of automated assembly equipment. Lead or be an active team member to drive continuous improvement programs relating to equipment performance and reliability, maximize Mean Productive Time Between Failure (MTBF), and Operational Uptime (AOU), and minimize Mean Time To Repair (MTTR). Manage day-to-day equipment issues in a production environment related to breakdowns, improvements, and upgrades. Develop maintenance and calibration documentation and procedures. Provide technical feedback, influence design and implementation of upgrades to improve reliability and increase production output. Support equipment related projects which includes but not limited to: Purchase and definition of new equipment, set-up, qualification, and release of equipment into production. Maintenance and upgrading of existing machines to set up of new equipment/lines. Production line duplications and bring up. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mechatronics or related area. A minimum of three years of equipment management experience with a working knowledge of equipment qualification, calibration and PM procedures and practices. Previous experience in medical device, aerospace or other regulated manufacturing environment. Excellent mechanical and electrical aptitude. Knowledge in equipment control systems, PLC Knowledge 6 sigma methodology. Drafting and mechanical design experience is a plus (Solidworks) Ability to read electrical & plumbing schematics. Project planning and execution. Data Analysis with MiniTAB or JMP. Problem Solving. Logical thinking and root cause analysis capability. Able to travel periodically (5-10%). Bilingual (Spanish) a plus. Job Description Intuitive Surgical, Inc. produces the Ion Bronchoscopy system, a minimally invasive robotic catheter system that accesses deep into the lungs and offers treatment not possible with conventional tools. Primary Function Of Position The engineer will work within the Instruments and Accessories (I&A) team to develop next generation devices through design feature integration. The role will involve a mix of direct design work, investigation into individual feature vs. full device behavior, testing, project leadership, and systems engineering practices to drive objective feature development and tradeoff decisions. The ideal candidate (i) possesses the grit and energy to achieve progress within a large team with a broad range of technical perspectives and (ii) is motivated by and capable of situational endurance and flexibility –able to shift between leader, partner, supporter, or learner, between hustle vs. deliberation, between dialogue vs. hands-on lab work, based on context. Roles & Responsibilities The engineer will own one or more instrument design integration efforts. As such, role responsibility may flex between the areas listed to support those efforts accordingly. Skillset in all areas is preferred, however candidates with skillset in one or more areas will be considered: Partner with team members to determine questions regarding individual feature vs. integrated performance. Design, build and/or test full or partial prototypes to tackle said questions. Discover failure modes and drive understanding of safety, performance, and business risk via said prototype testing (prospective) and/or failure investigation (retrospective). Develop new, or improve existing, test method arsenal to support characterization and failure mode discovery. Design and build custom test setups, strategize test conditions, substantiate clinical relevance, perform MSA, implement automation, etc. Partner with process engineering as needed to inform assembly interface design and DFM. Partner with interfacing design teams as needed to inform instrument interfacing features. Interface with clinical, usability, and design teams to develop, negotiate, decompose/establish trace relationships for, and substantiate instrument and instrument interaction requirements. Facilitate tradeoff decisions based on learnings from the above duties. Additional Duties Communicate results to stakeholders or in formal documentation when appropriate. Perform data analysis with sound statistical approaches where appropriate. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Education: B.S. in Mechanical, Electrical, Biomedical, or Software Engineering, or other equivalent degree – required. Higher level Engineering degree(s) – a plus Experience Minimum 5 years of experience in an Engineering job role in a regulated environment – required. Higher level degree(s) in Engineering or Science field may be used to offset minimum required years of experience Direct experience in a Process engineering role and/or Systems engineering role, or else education, experience, or exposure to relevant practices – strongly preferred Experience with electromechanical medical devices with software – strongly preferred Experience with catheters / flexible / steerable instruments – preferred Other Required Duty-specific Experience Hands on experience troubleshooting / investigating device failures Experience developing well-reasoned experimental plans; ability to provide problem solving / investigation thought leadership Preferred Duty-specific Experience Experience developing test setups or parts; proficiency with CAD – strongly preferred Experience navigating / developing requirements Experience with medical device risk assessment Experience building prototypes and/or coordinating prototype builds Experience with 1 or more automation tools or coding languages Experience troubleshooting or developing software or electrical design features Experience with data analysis tools and statistical methods – a plus Soft Skills Demonstrated endurance operating within organizational and project complexity Ability to find room for opportunities (‘abundance’ mindset) on a large team / project Demonstrated ability to follow through / sense of urgency Demonstrated hands-on approach and habitual curiosity Excellent written and verbal communication skillset Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Post Market Surveillance Quality Analyst will provide support to Intuitive Surgical’s Post Market Surveillance Team. Primary responsibilities include, but are not limited to, working closely with the legal department to ensure legal complaints are accurately reported / filed / and tracked, ensure the complaint handling process and records meet the FDA, ISO13485 and other world-wide regulatory requirements, ensure quality procedures/standards are followed, and other Post Market Surveillance activities as required. Roles And Responsibilities Quality review of MDR and other regulatory reports to ensure that reports are documented and reported accurately. Quality review of complaint records to ensure that records are complete and accurate. Training and guidance to Post Market Surveillance analysts regarding complaint and regulatory reporting quality. Provide input, guidance, training and mentoring regarding complaint and regulatory reporting across the organization. Support complaint closure activities to ensure timely complaint investigations with the highest level of quality. Identify gaps in the complaint process and support implementation of corrective plans and other solutions to ensure continued compliance with applicable regulations. Assist in field action activities as needed. Participate as the Post Market Surveillance representative on other projects as requested. medical device company, regulated environment or equivalent Quality or regulatory affairs experience in a medical device company a plus Experience in U.S. FDA Medical Device Reporting Experience in preferred Ability to independently analyze various forms of quality data provide actionable output Ability to synthesize data and observations to see trends, identify gaps against regulations and make Job Description What we’re looking for: As Intuitive’s Employee Communications & Engagement team, we are passionate about creating a workplace where employees are informed, engaged, and inspired to have a positive impact on each other, our company, and the world. As the newest member, you’ll enable our leaders and team members to deliver engaging and effective presentations to a talented group of people—our employees! If you have a keen eye for detail and experience designing strategic and creative PowerPoint and keynote presentations for corporate, internal audiences—this position is for you. This Position Will Partner with our content specialists, writers, and cross-functional clients to develop strategic and effective PowerPoint presentations for diverse, global internal audiences. Apply brand standards to build visually engaging design assets to tell creative and effective stories through presentations. Distill complex and abstract concepts to emphasize key messages with infographics, diagrams, animations, icons, graphics, charts, photography, and illustrations within presentations. Manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously; meet tight deadlines while maintaining a high quality of work, including meeting clients’ requirements and timelines while managing multiple deliverables simultaneously. Measure effectiveness and success through established key performance indicators. Ability to stay calm under pressure. Expert-level skills in Microsoft Office (PowerPoint, Outlook) and Adobe Creative Suite. Bachelor’s degree in graphic design or equivalent. 6+ years of related work experience with a creative agency or in an internal design role with a focus on presentation design. Job Description Primary Function of Position: We are seeking multiple Product Management MBA Interns to support teams across the organization. This position has the opportunity to make a direct impact on Intuitive’s product and procedural initiatives which make Intuitive’s solutions available to patients worldwide. With the direction and supervision of a Group Manager or Sr. Marketing Manager, the MBA Intern will play a role in creating strategy for markets and products which will enable adoption and growth of the company’s commercial portfolio. Based on candidate’s interest and qualifications, Product Management Internship positions may be available in hardware, software, digital, and services. Please note that the deadline to apply is 1/6/2023, unless otherwise noted in your campus portal. Roles And Responsibilities This position has responsibility and authority to: Deliver analysis, insights and strategy to drive direction of a product and/or service, possibly including, but not limited to: positioning, value proposition, segmentation, pricing, market share review, conducting market research, and product requirements. Define product claims and pillars, and collaborate with cross-functional teams in multiple regions to create go-to-market plans and rollout strategies that will enable successful launches Develop an understanding of the offering’s value proposition and how to communicate that message to key customers and constituencies such as physicians, providers, payers, and the sales force. Work with Key Opinion Leaders to better understand how the product and/or service are being utilized and determine how to communicate that value proposition to target customers The Product Management MBA Intern Will Gain a deep understanding of products, and/or services and their value propositions Analyze and assess the dynamics of the particular market, its associated call point, and how an Intuitive product/service(s) is positioned within this context Catalog user needs, product feedback, and other primary market research to create long-term product roadmaps Quickly respond to ad hoc analytic or research requests common in this dynamic, fast-paced, data-driven environment Work cross-functionally to develop a strategy for the project including identifying key success criteria and metrics which are measurable and executable Spend time interfacing with customers and Intuitive sales representatives to gather first-hand knowledge of the project’s potential impact and how best to execute on its goals Complete and deliver strategy and action plan, including tools and key performance indicators Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Job Description Opportunity: The Program Manager – Leadership Development role is an opportunity to operationalize Intuitive’s leadership development strategy by designing and managing leadership development programs and projects that ensure the highest program quality to our people leaders globally. You’ll play a key role on our Global Talent Management team by partnering with the Director of Leadership Development, business stakeholders, internal leadership development experts, and cross-functional learning teams to design and deliver leadership development programs and solutions. To be successful in this role, you will be a seasoned and experienced program leader with a wide range of experiences in the areas of Leadership Development, Coaching, Learning and Development and Program Management. Ideal candidate will have strong program management, change management and organizational skills, as well as a critical thinking and creative mindset, decision-making ability, and leadership development expertise. The program leader must be able to navigate global stakeholders and influence and manage multiple stakeholders and cross-functional project teams. The program leader should also have strong data and analytics capabilities for determining appropriate program evaluation strategies and learning impact. Additionally, the candidate should have experience facilitating in-person and virtual content with a good understanding of adult learning theory. Extensive instructional design experience is not required, but comfort with updating and continuously improving learning materials is preferred. We ask that you can proactively manage work requirements with an ability to articulate bandwidth and project status in a high-paced environment with competing priorities and deadlines. The Program Manager will contribute to multi-year strategic planning for leadership development, own the on-going delivery of and budgeting for training courses, and guide program logistics in partnership with the Training Coordinator. If you exemplify our company values of providing value to our patients and customers and want to be part of a team that is passionate about enabling our employees to do great work and grow in their careers, this is the role for you! Primary Responsibilities Perform as overall program leader to design, develop and deliver global leadership development programs. Drive and lead change efforts by building change management and communication plans to ensure stakeholder management, organizational readiness and effective deployment strategies that position the program for desired outcomes and success. Partner with HR Reporting, Data and Analytics team to develop program evaluation strategies and conduct post-project/program measurement, including capturing relevant, timely feedback and incorporating successes and areas for improvement into continuous improvement of the programs Develop program materials, including socialization and marketing materials, participant materials and other program tools or resources, in partnership with Instructional Design team Develop and manage leadership development program budgets, including the timely tracking & balancing of program expenses Prioritize tasks across multiple leadership development program deliverables Leverage multiple channels of delivery (audio, visual, digital) to meet our communications needs Manage relationships with key internal Centers of Excellence stakeholders, HR Business Partners, program business sponsors/stakeholders Identify, contract and manager external training vendors to design and/or deliver on global programs Create, market, and manage training schedules and rosters in partnership with program coordinator(s) Facilitate program kick-offs and/or select program learning modules Oversee program support for in-person and virtual classrooms Respond to employee questions & requests about GTD programs and resources Identify, recommend, and execute on continuous improvements to systems, processes, and tools to enhance learner experience Support programs on-site in California, Georgia, other US and international company locations, as well as virtually Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum Educational/Environment Qualifications: Minimum 8-10 years of experience in learning and leadership development program management (preferably in an HR, learning & design, human behavior, and/or education-focused role) and/or equivalent learn Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in organizational development, psychology, instructional design, HR, or education). Master’s degree preferred Ability to travel to key sites, including global locations, to support effective program design and delivery Available periodic evenings and/or weekend hours for global support or delivery Travel <50% Required Skills/Abilities: Demonstrated experience in the delivery of best-in-class learning & development programs Organizational and project management skills with a focus on detailed execution Strong consulting skills (assessing learning/training needs and making appropriate recommendations) to navigate learning needs, priorities and global stakeholder input Proven experience with global event coordination/training program logistics Success maintaining relationships with external vendors and consultants Problem-solving and analytical mindset, interested in process improvement Experience with learning measurement strategies, including learning impact and business outcomes, identifying trends and opportunities Effective presentation and facilitation skills for small- to large-sized groups Team player with the ability to build productive working relationships and collaborate cross-functionally Communicates effectively across multiple levels of leadership, including strong verbal and facilitation skills for training people leaders at the manager and director levels. Experience and interest in interacting with a globally distributed, multi-cultural employee population Technical savvy with Excel, Word, PowerPoint; ability to learn new software Ability to work in a team toward common goals, as well as self-directed to complete individual deliverables Knowledge of adult learning theory and leadership development practices Preferred Skills/Abilities: Knowledge of needs assessment practices Program reporting and data analytics Use of, or strong interest in using, development assessment tools with individuals and groups (ex: EQ, HBDI, MBTI, StrengthsFinder, LIFO, etc) Use of digital collaboration tools and web conferencing / virtual classroom software Experience with reporting/survey analytics
