Job Description Function: Manages procurement of high value, complex direct materials to support business requirements: includes purchase order management, sourcing, contract negotiations, spend analysis, inventory management, and supplier performance management. Mentors other buyers within the purchasing team and may lead cross-functional commodity team and/or have supervisory responsibilities. Identifies and drives key procurement initiatives. Roles And Responsibilities Reviews, administers, and manages long-term purchase order and delivery commitments to designated suppliers as necessary to support production and/or sales requirements within the business. Reviews, interprets, and communicates material demand forecast and manages capacity planning for assigned commodity groups and/or supplier relationships. Leads alignment of production supplier requirements and sourcing strategies with those of new product development (NPI) for designated suppliers/commodities to ensure uninterrupted material availability, alignment of risk, and cost goals with long term vision for the commodity / business. Owns performance management and improvement efforts for designated suppliers, including leading supplier business reviews. Utilizes lean sourcing principles (kanban, consignment, and other similar material pull methods) to achieve 100% material availability and optimize on-hand inventory. Embraces continuous improvement techniques to drive toward attainment of key purchasing metrics (supplier on-time delivery, quality, risk management, inventory velocity, and cost reduction). Leads complex cross-functional projects to mitigate risk, improve quality, and/or reduce cost within assigned supply base, including management of change cut-ins. Leverages problem solving skills and develops counter-measures to implement long-term solutions to identified problems. Mentors colleagues within the supply chain organization. Identifies process and training improvement opportunities and drives closure of identified gaps. Leverages best practice supplier selection techniques to identify a core supply base able to offer lowest total cost of ownership and high quality product. Provides leadership within assigned commodity team: Prioritizing commodity team projects. Ensuring commodity team achieves goals. Identifying and completing risk mitigation and cost reduction projects. Leveraging knowledge of commodity trends to drive strategies. Cost and contracting Leads construction of annual cost reduction plan to achieve corporate initiative plan for designed suppliers/parts and/or commodity team. Leads creation, negotiation, and management of commercial agreements – covering cost, quality, and delivery terms. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS degree or equivalent and 10+ years of purchasing experience in a regulated industry manufacturing environment (medical device preferred). Master’s degree preferred. Certifications: CPSM, CPIM, and/or PMP preferred. Significant computer experience including MS Office products and ERP systems, preferably SAP and Agile. Strong Excel skills. Proven track record of effective project management in a fast-paced manufacturing company (medical device preferred). Thorough knowledge of and experience working with kanban systems and other lean principles. Working knowledge of buying, material planning, master scheduling, and forecasting. Demonstrates concern for precision and thoroughness. Proven ability to consistently achieve stretch goals and objectives. Experience with people management and/or extensive cross-functional team leadership. Proven track record of promoting positive team culture and employee development. Ability to handle multiple tasks and projects successfully. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Strong negotiation skills and experience with proven track record of savings. ~25% travel to both domestic and international suppliers. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Regulatory Lead serves as the primary regulatory representative and Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the product group. The Regulatory Lead liaises with cross functional organizations, as well as global regulatory counterparts, focusing on product lifecycle management including supporting ongoing product changes and continuous improvement projects. Regulatory expert and SME on the product group, including classifications, indications, applicable regulatory standards and guidance docs., emerging regulations and regulators/industry perspective for the product group. Roles & Responsibilities Act as Regulatory Lead during initial transfer and transition of product from New Product Introduction to Operations/Sustaining. Evaluate changes to products including changes to design, material, labeling, packaging, manufacturing process, and facility. Support product engineering and manufacturing teams on regulatory issues, including review of design input, risk management and test documentation Assess the impact of the product/process changes and determine regulatory pathway for US and EU markets Gather information from international counterparts for ROW regarding the impact of changes and work with international counterparts to coordinate global regulatory submissions/approvals Provide risk-based guidance and strategic input into projects and issues and help facilitate cross functional alignment and resolution. Mentor team members in regulatory aspects as well as product and process expertise. Perform other duties as required Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Education: Minimum B.S. or higher in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, or Pharmacy preferred. Non-technical degree with equivalent complex medical device experience acceptable Experience: Minimum 10 years regulatory experience with 5+ years of experience in submissions and technical documentation for a medical device company Experience with end-to-end product lifecycle for complex products including mechanical, electrical, and software elements In-depth understanding of FDA and CE mark regulations Expert level understanding of design controls and risk management with experience in verification and validation methods, requirements management, risk analysis, product labeling and documentation Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and handle multiple projects simultaneously Strong verbal and written communication skills, proven ability to translate technical documentation into effective internal documentation, and regulatory submissions Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Job Description: Systems Analysts (Robotic Algorithms and Control Engineers) at Intuitive Surgical strive to create the safest and highest quality robotic system for minimally invasive surgery though rigorous and robust technical analysis. This Systems Analyst position is responsible for algorithms and controls required to support the development and production of new instruments for the da Vinci Surgical System. Required skills include knowledge of control systems, robot kinematics, and a solid understanding of mechanical systems. Key Responsibilities Develop and own the tele-operated motion performance of robotic surgical instruments. Ensuring motion fidelity will involve: Work closely with the clinical development team to understand performance requirements Work closely with the mechanical design team to optimize the mechanism for motion fidelity Use analysis and experimentation to develop a deep understanding of the behavior and limitations of the instrument mechanism Modify and tuning the algorithms to optimize motion fidelity Implement features and algorithms to support new instruments, such as extending a cutter, or forming staples. Perform the risk analysis and implementation of safety algorithms. This includes documentation of risks, requirements, and test protocols in order to support requests for approval by regulatory agencies such as the FDA. Collaborate with the manufacturing team to develop automated fixtures for calibrating, testing, and aiding assembly of the instrument. Additionally, determine manufacturing test specifications that will ensure instrument performance. Lead by having a breadth of technical knowledge that enables a top-level view of the entire project. Using this perspective, you will act as an interface between the various technical specialties. You are expected to take ownership of issues that cross disciplinary boundaries, and use your broad skillset to ensure the success of the project. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum PhD (preferred) or MS in robotics-related field. Minimum 4 years of experience in a related field preferred. Demonstrate intuitive understanding of mechanical phenomena with ability to do rigorous analysis. C/C++ and Matlab programming skills, as well as hardware, software, and mechanism integration skills. Knowledge of Python is a plus. Knowledge of classical and modern servo control systems. Knowledge of serial-arm robot kinematics. Knowledge of statistics is a plus. Knowledge of electrical and mechanical design principles and CAD tools is a plus. Demonstrate excellent communication skills both written and verbal. Have the ability to work independently and the determination to solve challenging problems. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Core Technologies Engineering (CTE) group within Intuitive has an immediate opening in Sunnyvale, CA, for an intern focusing on our robotic data streaming platforms. A successful candidate must excel in a high-energy focused team environment, must have excellent communication skills, and must be able to learn existing systems rapidly and drive to creative—yet practical—solutions. Roles & Responsibilities Partner with the mentor and senior members of the streaming and tools team to identify solutions in embedded data aggregation and streaming capabilities that supports data processing pipelines Envision and implement improvements to robot’s data pipeline that is versatile and has high performance Your will focus on performance constraints so that system data is provided in real-time even when a procedure is in progress with no impact on system performance and surgical procedures You will work on solutions in one or more of these areas - communication tools, protocols, API for data serialization/de-serialization, authentication, encryption/decryption, parsers etc. You will look measure and track the performance and resource utilization of your solution Your system will have good forward and backward compatibility and ensure robust cross-product testing and validation Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Ideally have a Bachelor's or post-graduate degree in Computer Science, Math, or Engineering, but we will consider equivalent industry experience as well Experience in building embedded applications Experience in data pipeline or streaming infrastructure or data serialization Experience in C++ or Python Understanding of pub/sub and streaming architectures will be a plus. Our systems currently use a combination of gRPC, ZeroMQ, TCP, UDP, websockets and Crossbar. Experience with various data serialization libraries and techniques will be a plus. We use Protobuf. Job Description Job Description The Robotics Debug Electronics position will be responsible for providing troubleshooting, testing, repairs, and technician support for the Engineering and Manufacturing departments. This includes testing and debugging of electro-mechanical systems. This position will also support execution of product Verification and Validation activities along with providing documentation support for lead project engineers as needed. Roles And Responsibilities Provide technician support to Manufacturing, Test Engineering, and Field Service on surgical robotic systems and follow the escalation process delivering engineering evaluation. Diagnose failures on Systems Mfg line (System level failures, Sub-assembly failures, Test fixture failures). Debug and repair PCAs (Printed Circuit Assemblies). Perform quick triage of the issue and recommend best course of action to keep production moving. Perform simple reworks on the spot (cable crimping, solder components, tap threads, clean optics, adjust alignments etc.). Perform failure analysis to component level and investigate root cause. Recommend corrective / preventive actions. Document & disposition non-conformance material (VR’s). Build cables, harnesses, test assemblies and fixtures for robotic systems. Support the all-engineering departments with technician tasks and execution of a broad range of verification protocols through effective prioritization and project management. Assist in the execution of design Verification and Validation activities in accordance with applicable medical regulatory standards. Follow approved Design Control procedures for product development in accordance with FDA guidelines. Perform other engineering technician duties as needed. Required Skills Ability to troubleshoot complex PCAs down to component level. Effectively use of troubleshooting and measurement equipment like oscilloscopes, multimeters, function generators, custom test platforms. Expert hand soldering and through-hole and surface mount rework skills. Experience with standard electrical and mechanical hand tools. Experience with reading, understanding, and modifying electrical schematics and wiring diagrams. Familiarity with a broad range of electronic components and hardware. Solid knowledge of electromechanical system engineering principals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential with the proven ability to work well in team environment. Good communication skills to be able to collaborate effectively with production techs, supervisors, training dept. as well as Mfg./Design/Test Engineers. Working knowledge of computers, word processing and spreadsheet applications for documentation and data presentation. Familiarity the use of Agile or similar lifecycle management system tool Qualifications Required Skills Ability to troubleshoot complex PCAs down to component level. Effectively use of troubleshooting and measurement equipment like oscilloscopes, multimeters, function generators, custom test platforms. Expert hand soldering and through-hole and surface mount rework skills. Experience with standard electrical and mechanical hand tools. Experience with reading, understanding, and modifying electrical schematics and wiring diagrams. Familiarity with a broad range of electronic components and hardware. Solid knowledge of electromechanical system engineering principals. Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential with the proven ability to work well in team environment. Good communication skills to be able to collaborate effectively with production techs, supervisors, training dept. as well as Mfg./Design/Test Engineers. Working knowledge of computers, word processing and spreadsheet applications for documentation and data presentation. Familiarity the use of Agile or similar lifecycle management system tool Education/Experience Minimum Associates degree, trade school, military technical training or equivalent. A minimum of five years of troubleshooting experience, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 7-10+ years of experience. Ability to travel up to 10% of the time Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Senior Director RAQA Audit will oversee, establish and maintain Intuitive’s (ISI) program to ensure compliance with global regulatory requirements, international standards, company policies and procedures. The role will provide compliance oversight to all ISI’s operations across its facilities, suppliers, global distribution network, and clinical investigation partners. This role includes strategic oversight and management of all facility, supplier and clinical investigation site inspections and audits on a global basis and requires developing close and effective relationships with our auditing/notified bodies and government authorities. The role will require a current understanding of applicable laws, regulations and standards so that risks are identified and managed appropriately. The successful candidate will develop and oversee a team to manage the internal audit activities performed by ISI or by third party contractors on our behalf and will coordinate the audit schedule for our external audit partners in relation to our QMS, ISO and MDSAP certification audits. The role will also ensure the effective identification, management and closure of all internal and external audit findings in partnership with other RAQA stakeholders, Clinical Affairs and cross-functional partners. For supplier auditing, this position will partner with the Supplier Engineering teams, Quality Engineering, Quality Systems & Compliance and global partners to define the overall Supplier Quality Management (SQM) strategy, including developing a clear mission, vision, and prioritization. The individual will also be responsible for developing and maintaining a systematic and standardized approach to SQM including global policies/procedures, quality agreements, forms/templates and supplier quality metrics etc. that are compliant with all applicable international regulatory requirements. The Senior Director is also be responsible for ensuring effective coordination of supplier/vendor audits, governance of the Supplier Corrective Action program and management of Approved Supplier List (ASL) in conjunction with global and Business Unit teams. For Clinical Investigation auditing, the position will partner with Clinical Affairs and Global Regulatory Affairs teams to develop a program of audit and oversight to ensure adherence to Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and the relevant requirements of FDA Investigational Device Exemptions (IDE), ISO 14155 and other relevant clinical investigation requirements. Preparation and support for FDA Bioresearch Monitoring (BiMo), competent authority and other audits as required. Note: these requirements are in addition to the oversight that will be applied to the process of clinical evaluations written in support of our international regulatory filings (e.g. under the EU MDR). Roles & Responsibilities Audit Compliance Lead and facilitate internal and external audits and inspections of ISI sites, including FDA QSIT, BIMO, and for cause inspections, MDSAP certification and surveillance audits, competent authority and other inspections and audits as required. Support oversight of audits and inspections of ISI’s business partners as required. Act as organization SME for Audits and Inspections and provide training/consultation to internal customers on auditing strategy, technique and behaviors. Develop internal audit plans, manage audit schedules and perform audits and inspection per plan (either internally or through a third party contractor). Develop systems to ensure the effective identification, management and closure of all internal and external audit findings and oversee effective hand-off to appropriate partners to remediate issues resulting from regulatory assessments in accordance with documented plans (Notified Bodies nonconformity, FDA 483 findings, etc.). Liaise with Global Regulatory Affairs and other stakeholders to proactively identify and anticipate risk of non-compliance in a dynamic global environment, ensuring conformance to regulatory requirements, internal processes and policies. Key member of escalation and investigation teams to understand, interpret and provide guidance on required compliance actions and measures. Lead training/consultation efforts to internal customers on applicable regulatory requirements (proactively and reactively). Play a key role in developing and managing the company’s compliance strategy for product issues as well as process/quality system issues. Liaising with international regulatory and standards stakeholders as applicable to help them understand and develop effective compliance strategies for ISI technologies. Lead implementation and continuous improvements of the quality and regulatory compliance audit programs, auditor qualification programs, and company-wide inspection readiness. Understand and interface with regional regulatory counterparts for understanding and applying global regulatory requirements (including but not limited to US FDA, EU MDR, Japan, Korea and all MDSAP regions). Implement training and education programs to share knowledge within RAQA and broader company stakeholder groups. Provide guidance, expertise, and direction to ISI's cross-functional teams on product risk, escalations, compliance actions, and any applicable Corrective & Preventive Actions (CAPAs). Partner with the Data Analytics teams to inform compliance activities including reporting to quality review meetings, responses to agency requests for information and support to quality improvement projects. Supplier Quality Establish plan and performance metrics/KPIs for SQM function. Collaborate cross-functionally to develop and implement a highly effective supplier quality management program focused on innovative solutions to address business challenges and deliver maximum value to the business. Develop and report key supplier quality metrics to cross-functional management. Develop supplier audit plan, manage audit schedule and perform audits and inspection per plan (either internally or by a third party contractor). Identify, develop and implement strategic quality initiatives to ensure continuous improvement with respect to supplier quality performance. Ensure supplier qualification and assessment activities per established procedures, including initial onboarding, maintaining the supplier files and updating the Approved Supplier List (ASL.). Maintain the Approved Supplier List and implement the use of internal quality systems resulting in successful resolution of supplier quality problems and performance issues. Evaluate an

Job Description The Team The Advanced Research group within Intuitive Surgical is searching for a hands-on engineer with a focus on the design of next generation advanced energy catheter instruments, contributing to the exploration of novel concepts for new energy applications. This role is an exciting opportunity to join a small and innovative team in the early phases of product development. The Advanced Research team at Intuitive is a cross-functional team dedicated to the creation of the innovative medical robotic platforms, technologies and programs. We create transformational technologies in order to address the major pain points and unmet needs in our healthcare system. Our goal is to create the future of healthcare through platforms and ecosystems that empower providers and teams in order to deliver transformational life-enhancing care. This role is an exciting opportunity to join a small and innovative team in the very early phases of product development. Joining Intuitive Surgical means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient outcomes as our highest priority. We are recruiting for a Senior Electromechanical Engineer, Advanced Energy, in Sunnyvale, CA. Primary Function Of The Position The Senior Electromechanical Engineer, Advanced Energy, is responsible for the technical development of advanced energy products at Intuitive. Their focus will be on research of advanced energy technology as well as development of catheters and instruments, contributing to the exploration of a novel system concept for a new application of surgical robotics. They will be a responsible member of the Advanced Research team supporting innovative technology development and commercialization. They will have both the technical depth to resolve complex electrical, mechanical, material and design issues, as well as the ability to work in an interdisciplinary team to troubleshoot and root cause higher system level issues. They must have strong technical depth in relevant areas, and have a track record of successful product development efforts. Using their subject matter expertise, exceptional communication skills and through cross-functional collaboration, they will investigate and develop advanced energy applications for novel clinical applications across our robotic surgical systems. They must excel in a high-energy, focused, small-team environment, and have a commitment to high quality prototypes and concepts. A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required, as well as a commitment to high product quality. Responsibilities Work in a small, cross-functional project team to perform research, develop and verify new concepts for advanced energy catheters and other flexible surgical instruments Develop, implement, assess and document new test methods, solutions and designs according to corporate standards and departmental operating procedures Hands-on assembly and testing of equipment, fixtures and devices to support proof of concept, design development, pre-clinical and V&V activities Perform tests, critically analyze results and make design changes or recommendations to the design team Investigate and determine root cause of emerging technology, design, manufacturing, or material defects Research and review literature and prior art to inform technology development, design decisions and system architectures Observe clinical cases and participate in interviews with clinical experts to inform designs Provide support for pre-clinical and clinical labs Development and documentation of design documentation including but not limited to: design requirements, design outputs, and risk analyses using appropriate change control procedures Establish individual goals consistent with overall project goals OTHER Keeps the organization’s vision and values at the forefront of decision making and action Performs other duties as required to support the company's overall strategy and goals Qualifications Preferred Qualifications Minimum education: BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, related engineering or scientific discipline, or equivalent work experience Typical minimum of 8 years of relevant experience, minimum 6 years with a masters Demonstrated ability to work in cross-functional research and development teams Crucial to have hands-on experience in application of both mechanical and electrical principles to technology development and/or catheter/instrument R&D Experience with electromechanical research and development in the medical device industry Experience with bench and hybrid tissue test method development for both research and development. Experience with FDA QSR 21 CFR Part 820, ISO 13485, IEC 60601 and other related external standards Familiar with all phases of the product development lifecycle; including proof-of-concept, design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer Some experience with plastics, plastics molding, extrusions, testing, process equipment, adhesives, and/or disposable medical products needed Some experience with Nitinol or other superelastic / shape memory materials is a strong plus High autonomy and ability to work independently under limited supervision to determine and develop approach to solutions. Some knowledge of component manufacturing processes, catheter development tools and prototyping equipment Proficiency using CAD to design and document mechanisms; SolidWorks preferred Ability to communicate effectively (written & oral) across all levels and organizations Commitment: Must be available to work full-time and commute/relocate to Sunnyvale, CA Up to 10% travel. Some international travel may be required. Primary Location: Sunnyvale, CA Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The primary objective of an Engineering Technician is to provide troubleshooting, testing, repairs, equipment maintenance and MRB evaluation services to systems manufacturing line meeting Quality and productivity goals within manufacturing. This person will play a significant role in the areas of Failure Analysis, First Pass Yield and MRB review. Roles And Responsibilities Follow Production escalation process and provide engineering evaluation of any interruptions to production lines. Perform quick triage of issues and recommend best course of action to keep production moving. This includes performing simple reworks on the spot such as cable crimping, solder components, tap threads, clean optics, adjust alignment, etc. Document all activities during escalation support in formal records. Diagnose failures on Systems Mfg line for system level failures, sub-assembly failures, and test fixture failures. Perform failure analysis down to component level, investigate root causes, and recommend corrective / preventive actions. Proactively provides feedback to management and engineering regarding production process, quality, and workmanship issues. Execute engineering level tests and collect data to support design of experiment activities or characterize a device. Review non-conforming parts in MRB, analyze failures in detail, make decisions on dispositions, and document all findings in formal records. Perform root cause investigation on non-conforming materials and provide feedback to engineering for quality improvements. Document findings of investigation in quality notifications, which are part of official Device History Records. Collaborate with manufacturing engineers to resolve manufacture, process, and quality issues. Support engineering with electronics/PCA programming and functional testing in the early phase of new product launches to shake out bugs and suggest improvements. Cross-train or mentor others in areas of expertise. Perform other engineering technician duties as needed. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum 5 years of component level troubleshooting experience on FPGA/Microprocessor-based Printed Circuit Assemblies (PCAs). Ability to perform failure analysis and troubleshooting with minimal supervision. Ability to troubleshoot complex PCAs down to component level. Effectively use of troubleshooting and measurement equipment such as oscilloscopes, multimeters, function generators, and custom test platforms. Understand wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, fab drawings, and mechanical component drawings. Working knowledge of computers, word processing and spreadsheet applications for documentation and data presentation. Ability to read, modify, and execute test scripts for debug. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to variety of technologies that allow effective troubleshooting. Good communication skills to be able to partner effectively with production techs, supervisors, trainers as well as Mfg/Design/Test Engineers. Sense of urgency and Multi-tasking is essential to be able to support production line effectively. Experience with Agile, SAP, MES, and SPC or equivalent tools. Good communication and documentation skills. Strong analytic and problem solving skills. Must possess extensive knowledge/experience in troubleshooting electromechanical issues. Education/Experience: High school diploma, trade school, military technical training or equivalent. Experience with troubleshooting is preferred. Open to new college graduates with a BSEE degree Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 10% of the time JOB1973.1

Job Description Primary Function of Position: The primary objective of an Engineering Technician is to provide troubleshooting, testing, repairs, equipment maintenance and MRB evaluation services to systems manufacturing line meeting Quality and productivity goals within manufacturing. This person will play a significant role in the areas of Failure Analysis, First Pass Yield and MRB review. Roles And Responsibilities Follow Production escalation process and provide engineering evaluation of any interruptions to production lines. Perform quick triage of issues and recommend best course of action to keep production moving. This includes performing simple reworks on the spot such as cable crimping, solder components, tap threads, clean optics, adjust alignment, etc. Document all activities during escalation support in formal records. Diagnose failures on Systems Mfg line for system level failures, sub-assembly failures, and test fixture failures. Perform failure analysis down to component level, investigate root causes, and recommend corrective / preventive actions. Proactively provides feedback to management and engineering regarding production process, quality, and workmanship issues. Execute engineering level tests and collect data to support design of experiment activities or characterize a device. Review non-conforming parts in MRB, analyze failures in detail, make decisions on dispositions, and document all findings in formal records. Perform root cause investigation on non-conforming materials and provide feedback to engineering for quality improvements. Document findings of investigation in quality notifications, which are part of official Device History Records. Collaborate with manufacturing engineers to resolve manufacture, process, and quality issues. Support engineering with electronics/PCA programming and functional testing in the early phase of new product launches to shake out bugs and suggest improvements. Cross-train or mentor others in areas of expertise. Perform other engineering technician duties as needed. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum 5 years of component level troubleshooting experience on FPGA/Microprocessor-based Printed Circuit Assemblies (PCAs). Ability to perform failure analysis and troubleshooting with minimal supervision. Ability to troubleshoot complex PCAs down to component level. Effectively use of troubleshooting and measurement equipment such as oscilloscopes, multimeters, function generators, and custom test platforms. Understand wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, fab drawings, and mechanical component drawings. Working knowledge of computers, word processing and spreadsheet applications for documentation and data presentation. Ability to read, modify, and execute test scripts for debug. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to variety of technologies that allow effective troubleshooting. Good communication skills to be able to partner effectively with production techs, supervisors, trainers as well as Mfg/Design/Test Engineers. Sense of urgency and Multi-tasking is essential to be able to support production line effectively. Experience with Agile, SAP, MES, and SPC or equivalent tools. Good communication and documentation skills. Strong analytic and problem solving skills. Must possess extensive knowledge/experience in troubleshooting electromechanical issues. Education/Experience: High school diploma, trade school, military technical training or equivalent. Experience with troubleshooting is preferred. Open to new college graduates with a BSEE degree Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 10% of the time JOB1973.1

Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical™, the world leader in surgical robotics, is seeking a Senior FPGA/Verification engineer to join the da Vinci new product development team. This position will have broad responsibility for developing complex FPGA solutions for communications, video, control processing and other advanced capabilities. This role works directly on products that have real world impact. Candidates must be self-motivated, creative, resourceful, capable of thriving in a fast-paced environment, and possess good technical breadth and depth. Roles And Responsibilities Candidates must be self-motivated, creative, resourceful, capable of thriving in a fast-paced environment and possess good technical breadth and depth. Roles And Responsibilities Implement efficient FPGA designs of one or more of the following robotic system components: video signal processing, DMA, high-speed communications, sensors, motor control, and integration of modern embedded computing modules. Collaborate with cross-functional partners in Electrical Engineering, Software Development and Systems Analysis to refine systems architecture and implementation. Develop FPGA RTL in System Verilog as a senior team member. Use modern verification methodologies such as UVM to validate RTL designs and contribute to our library of verification solutions. Follow rigorous design control methodology from design specification through design verification. Write detailed design documentation, including specifications and verification protocols. Integrate, debug and support the product after launch. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BSEE, MSEE preferred. System Verilog preferred; Verilog required UVM or OVM verification experiences are highly desirable. Expert in FPGA design or front-end IC design. Understanding static timing analysis and SDC timing constraints Strong communication, presentation, and documentation skills. Familiarity with at least one of the scripting languages such as Python, Tcl, Perl or Shell Familiarity with version control systems such as GIT or SVN. Experience with Xilinx FPGA design tools (Vivado, Chipscope) and Questa Sim is a plus Hands-on engineering abilities with oscilloscope and logic analyzer is a plus Ability to work well in a team environment. Minimum 5+ years of RTL coding and verification experience. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Senior Human Factors Engineer works closely with interaction designers, clinical engineers, and technical product managers to inform and guide development of new products, and ensure that those products are safe and easy to use. As part of new product development projects, they conduct user research, analyze and characterize use-related risks, and conduct usability testing of products prior to launch. They have primary responsibility for creating usability risk analyses and conducting final usability validation studies. The Senior Human Factors Engineer also works closely with the regulatory group to create the usability engineering documentation required for submission to medical device regulatory agencies. Roles And Responsibilities Collect and synthesize detailed information on how users interact with Intuitive products through various techniques including interviews, simulations, direct observations, task analyses, and persona development. Present results of field observations, research, and usability testing to the New Product Development organization. Contribute to user interface designs by negotiating design recommendations to mitigate use errors and improve usability. Assist creation and revision of user-interface requirements documents. Analyze complaints from on-market products and update usability risk assessment and escalate usability-related issues as necessary. Design, execute, and report on usability (human factors) tests at various stages of product development from early prototypes all the way through formal FDA-mandated validation testing. Write and execute usability test protocols. Analyze test data and write test reports. Develop validation strategies for projects involving updates to existing products. Lead the efforts required to create and update usability risk analyses for Intuitive Surgical’s products. Maintain traces between use risks, mitigations, and validation test cases. Reinforce a human centered design approach across the organization. Represent the Human Factors function on core teams for large projects. Coordinate human factors efforts across projects involving several sub-systems. Manage usability engineering activities within development projects and provide schedules and status to technical product managers and engineering project managers. Mentor junior human factors engineers (e.g. interns) and others in organization in usability engineering methods and best practices, as well as Intuitive product development processes. Lead or support the development of usability engineering processes within the multiport engineering group, including the creation and maintenance of department operating procedures, test plan templates, etc. Prepare and review documentation for submission to regulatory agencies and notified bodies. Answer questions and provide additional justification and rationale to any questions received. Keep abreast of regulations and best practices for medical device human factors (e.g. IEC 62366, AAMI HE75, FDA Applying Human Factors and Usability Engineering to Medical Devices) and advise management regarding potential improvements to internal processes and regulatory issues related to usability engineering. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS in Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Computer Science with human-computer interface (HCI) emphasis, Human Centered Design, or related field. MS strongly preferred. Minimum 8+ years relevant Human Factors/Usability Engineering experience in hardware product development industry Experience in medical device, or similar regulated industry, a significant plus Ability to lead usability engineering activities (i.e. establishing usability requirements; creating usability risk analyses, test protocols, and test reports) for a complex, software-controlled electro-mechanical medical device Ability to interface with customers in a highly professional manner Ability to analyze and synthesize large quantities of information into usable communications Superior ability to write accurate, clear, and concise protocols, reports, operating procedures, etc. in a timely manner Excellent verbal communication and presentation skills Ability to work with and across various groups and levels of management within the organization, including other engineering groups, marketing, clinical engineering, and regulatory. Excellent collaboration skills. Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles to product research, development, and design Ability to travel internationally as well as domestically (up to 20%) Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws. Shift : Day Travel : 25% of the time JOB2728

Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Senior Human Factors Engineer conducts user research and usability testing of Intuitive products prior to launch. In the role of user research, the Sr. HF engineer provides the New Product Development group with in-depth analysis of the user and existing product use. In the role of usability tester, the Sr. HF engineer ensures new products are safe, easy to use, and easy to learn by analyzing risks, and developing and executing Human Factors testing. The Senior Human Factors Engineer also tracks data characterizing how users interact with Intuitive products in the field. The Senior Human Factors Engineer uses this data to ensure risk analyses are up-to-date and inform design decisions for new products and feature updates. The Senior Human Factors Engineer works closely with Interaction Designers, Clinical Engineers, Regulatory Affairs Specialists, Quality Systems Engineers, and Technical Product Managers to inform and guide development of new products. Roles And Responsibilities Collect and synthesize detailed information about how users interact with Intuitive Surgical’s products through various techniques including interviews, simulations, direct observation at hospitals, task analysis, and persona development. Present results of field observations, research, and usability testing to the New Product Development organization. Contribute to user interface designs by providing guidance, ideas, and feedback to Interaction Designers and developers. Analyze complaints from on-market products for usability-related issues. Support the design, execution, and reporting on usability (human factors) tests at various stages of product development from early prototypes all the way through formal FDA mandated validation testing. Work with cross functional teams to create and maintain usability risk analyses and user interface requirements for Intuitive Surgical’s products. Maintain traces between use risks, mitigations, and validation test cases. Reinforce a human centered design approach across the organization. Represent the Human Factors function on core teams for small to medium sized projects. Keep abreast of regulations and best practices for medical device human factors (e.g. IEC 62366, AAMI HE75, FDA Applying Human Factors and Usability Engineering to Medical Devices). Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS or MS in Human Factors Engineering, Cognitive Psychology, Computer Science with human-computer interface (HCI) emphasis, Human Centered Design, or related field. Minimum 5 year relevant HF experience in industry Experience in medical device, or similar regulated industry, a significant plus Superior ability to empathize with people and to understand the human condition Ability to interface with customers in a highly professional manner Excellent communication (verbal, written, and formal presentation) and collaboration skills Ability to analyze and synthesize large quantities of information into usable communications Ability to work with and across various groups and levels of management within the organization, including other engineering groups, marketing, clinical engineering, and regulatory Ability to apply user-centered design and usability engineering principles to product research, development, and design Ability to travel internationally as well as domestically (up to 25%) Experience with SQL and/or natural language processing a plus Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position As Senior Inclusion and Diversity (I&D) Manager at Intuitive, you will shape how we engage and support our employees from underrepresented communities. In this position, reporting to Intuitive’s Vice President of Global Inclusion and Diversity, you will focus on select communities (people of color, women, veterans, LGBTQ+ employees and/or employees with a disability). You will spearhead the growth and support of these communities through our employee resource groups (ERGs), engagement with external organizations, and close partnership with other HR functions and the broader Intuitive organization. Exemplifying our core expectations of Leadership, Focus, Agility and Creativity, you will bring a spirit of learning and continuous improvement to the company’s I&D efforts. Responsibilities Serve as one of two strategic I&D leads for underrepresented groups at Intuitive, including people of color, women, veterans, LGBTQ+ employees and employees with a disability. Advise and monitor all aspects of employee resource group (ERG) health, including membership growth, employee engagement strategies, leadership and resource planning. Provide ad hoc coaching and advice to ERG leaders on an ongoing basis. Partner with ERGs, Marketing, Employee Communications & Engagement, and other stakeholders to develop and execute on key “cultural moments” throughout the year. Supervise external agency supporting these strategies. Identify and establish partnerships with external organizations who provide support and resources for underrepresented groups. Effectively connect these partners with internal stakeholders to maximize and measure the value of these partnerships, and ensure financial investments are providing ROI. Represent Intuitive in external organizations and benchmarking processes in assigned areas of expertise. Actively research and share external best practices back into the I&D team and broader HR organization. Work with internal teams -- such as Public Affairs, Intuitive Foundation, Corporate Sustainability and Social Responsibility, Marketing, Supplier Diversity, Facilities, and others -- to drive positive awareness, engagement and change for employees and customers from underrepresented groups. Act as an I&D advocate and resource for other HR functions such as Total Rewards, Global Talent Management, Talent Acquisition, and HR Business Partners, influencing our programs, practices, and support offerings. Contribute to cross-team projects and initiatives, such as events, newsletters, trainings, and other key deliverables. Qualifications Qualifications Core Competencies, Skills And Experience Requirements Minimum 10 years of professional experience and three years in Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) or related roles Experience with employee resource groups (ERGs) and how to best support and advocate for employees from underrepresented identities within a corporate environment Passionate about I&D while understanding how to meet people “where they are” with sensitivity and diplomacy Experience in public speaking with small- and large-sized groups (in-person & virtually) Proven success maintaining relationships with external organizations, vendors and consultants, including budget oversight Ability to build strong, clear written and visual content in formats including Word and PowerPoint; visual design capability a plus Experience in measuring the effectiveness of employee I&D efforts and adjusting strategies based on data and feedback Strong collaboration and cross-cultural skills to work across stakeholders, organizations and geographies Minimum Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description What We Are Looking For Senior Manager, NPI Manufacturing Engineering within the Endoluminal team, reporting to the Director of the Manufacturing Engineering organization. Contribute your technical manufacturing, leadership, and project management skills to a dynamic manufacturing engineering team creating precision instruments for robotic-assisted endoluminal devices. This key technical management role will guide and mentor a talented engineering team responsible for supporting NPI Endoluminal manufacturing by creating and improving manufacturing processes, authoring all associated manufacturing documentation, dispositioning discrepant material, and maintaining compliance with our quality system. Key Responsibilities Lead a team of NPI Manufacturing Engineers, in collaboration with other organizations, to support production of complex products with responsibilities including but not limited to: Establish group and individual objectives, priorities, and metrics Ensure fulfillment of product development goals Develop new production processes and production lines Ensure the professional development of individual team members Ensure production of products meets expected output Ensure quality requirements are fulfilled and maintained Maintain compliance with medical device quality system including corrective action closure, discrepant material disposition and Engineering Change Order (ECO) implementation through Agile PLM. Provide technical support for failure analysis and root cause investigation of product failures. Plan, budget, and staff projects, tracking performance throughout. Manage and allocate team resources over multiple projects. Provide and solicit resources to and from other teams as necessary. Work with Quality group to ensure that the team follows appropriate GMP, Design History File (DHF), and Device History Record (DHR) guidelines per FDA requirements, and support design reviews in accordance with product development procedures. Improve product quality and reliability using Six Sigma, Cpk, Gauge R&R, and similar quality tools. Effectively leverage manufacturing data and factory intelligence to improve product design and operational efficiency. Complete cost analysis and lead cost reduction efforts. Attract, mentor, and train new employees. Create, maintain, and improve “mid-volume” manufacturing lines, specifying and/or refining BOMs, workflow processes, manufacturing plans, and detailed work instructions. Analyze manufacturing lines from a risk perspective (pFMEA) to incorporate and validate critical tests used in manufacturing. Assume responsibility for the validation of manufacturing equipment and processes leveraging standard qualification approaches (IQ/OQ/PQ/DQ/PPQ). Provide production line support for day-to-day engineering issues on production and NPI lines. Identify and implement continuous improvement projects with respect to first pass yield, cycle time reduction, product reliability, capacity enhancements, and cost reduction. Provide technical support analyzing and/or performing failure analysis for discrepant production components, assemblies, and field returns. Qualifications Key Position Requirements Minimum Bachelor’s degree in engineering discipline, M.S. preferred. Successful experience leading multiple complex projects. Minimum of 7 years’ engineering experience manufacturing complex electro-mechanical products. Experience with the processes, equipment, and materials used to manufacture flexible endoscopes and catheters strongly preferred. Ability to motivate, mentor, and inspire a high-capacity technical team. Experience developing products from early-stage concept to volume manufacturing. Mechanical design and analysis expertise desired. Prior responsibility for validation of processes, equipment, and products. Strong quantitative process development skills including (p)FMEA, tolerance analysis, DoE, SPC, GR&R, and CpK. Familiarity with mechanical CAD (Solidworks), ERP (SAP), and PLM (Agile) software. Excellent organizational skills. Able to manage multiple fast-paced projects simultaneously. Ability to communicate effectively and professionally across a range of technical disciplines with a broad slate of stakeholders, including management, peers, customers, and suppliers. Prior experience with the Design Control processes for medical devices and clinical application of surgical and/or endoscopic instruments is a plus. Experience in an ISO 13485, ISO 9001, or medical device manufacturing environment preferred. 10% travel (including international) Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Designing components and producing mechanical drawings in a government regulated environment for volume manufacturing processes which may include cast metal, injection molded plastic, sheet metal stamped, and others Working within multi-disciplinary teams to define requirements for new and current designs Developing mechanical assemblies, with careful consideration for key functions and safety Mentoring and coaching other engineers in problem solving Qualifications BSME, or similar Experience designing for volume manufacturing processes such as metal casting, plastic injection molding, sheet metal stamping, compression molding, thermoforming, etc. Ownership of key components or assemblies through multiple product launches to market Comfortable with all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer Self-driven with the ability to excel in a high-energy, small, focused team environment, to maintain a strong sense of shared responsibility and reward, and to make work fun and interesting Preferred Post-graduate study or equivalent work experience preferred Robot design experience Surgical or medical device product experience is a plus Effective collaboration with multi-disciplinary functions like clinical, human factors, industrial design, interaction design, etc. SolidWorks experience Additional Information The Sr. Mechanical Engineer must utilize creativity and sound engineering judgment in the design of medical capital equipment components for volume manufacturing processes. Job Description Description of Position: The Advanced Research group within Intuitive Surgical is searching for a Senior Mechanical Engineer with a focus on the development of new catheter instruments, contributing to the exploration of a novel concept for a new application of surgical robotics from proof of concept through detailed mechanical design, prototype manufacturing, and pilot level manufacturing. This role is an exciting opportunity to join a small and innovative team in the early phases of product development. The Advanced Research team at Intuitive is a cross-functional team dedicated to the creation of the innovative medical robotic platforms, technologies and programs. We create transformational technologies in order to address the major pain points and unmet needs in our healthcare system. Our goal is to create the future of healthcare through platforms and ecosystems that empower providers and teams in order to deliver transformational life-enhancing care. The Senior Mechanical Engineer will develop robotic catheter instrumentation for robotic systems for minimally invasive surgical applications. The successful candidate will have both the technical depth to resolve complex mechanical, materials and manufacturing design issues and the ability to work in an interdisciplinary team to troubleshoot to root cause higher level system issues. They must excel in a high-energy, focused, small-team environment, and have a commitment to high quality prototypes and concepts and a demonstrated record of developing creating and innovative engineering solutions. A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required as well as a commitment to high product quality. Roles And Responsibilities Work in a small, cross-functional project team to design, develop, and verify flexible robotic surgical instruments Develop, implement, test and document new solutions, processes and designs according to corporate standards and departmental operating procedures Hands-on assembly and testing of equipment and devices to support proof of concept, design development, pre-clinical, and V&V activities Design and develop fixturing to aid in the testing and manufacturing / assembly of flexible surgical instruments Analyze and test product prototype designs, critically analyze results, and make design changes or recommendations to the design team Generate and execute test methods to investigate and determine root cause of design, manufacturing, or material defects Research and review literature and prior art to inform design decisions and architectures Observe clinical cases and participate in interviews with clinical experts to inform designs Provide support for pre-clinical and clinical labs Development and documentation of design and manufacturing documentation including: inspection procedures, assembly instructions, test methods, purchase specifications, BOMs, component / assembly drawings per the company’s operating procedures Qualifications Skills/Job Requirements: Minimum BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Materials Science, or related engineering or scientific discipline, or equivalent work experience Minimum 5 years of experience developing flexible instruments; medical devices preferred Experience with electromechanical design is a strong plus (Robotics experience preferred) Experience with plastics, plastics molding, extrusions, testing, process equipment, adhesives, and/or disposable medical products are a strong plus Experience with FDA QSR 21 CFR Part 820, ISO 13485, IEC 60601 and other related external standards Familiar with Product Lifecycle Management documentation control systems Familiar with all phases of the product development lifecycle; including proof-of-concept, design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer High autonomy and ability to work independently under limited supervision to determine and develop approach to solutions. Knowledge of component manufacturing processes, catheter development tools and equipment Excellent organizational skills; Able to manage multiple fast-paced projects simultaneously Excellent documentation and communication skills Ability to travel up to 10% of the time Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Surgeons need to see clearly in order heal their patients. Surgeons use the daVinci Surgical System for extended continuous duration under the intense stress of a surgical environment. Visual clarity and precise representation of the surgical field along with ease of use and optical comfort across the broad spectrum of surgeons are pillars of Intuitive’s vision products. Join the engineering team to developing the surgical viewer for the next generation system. Senior Mechanical Engineer must utilize creativity and sound engineering judgement in the design of medical capital equipment components for volume manufacturing processes. The Senior Mechanical Engineer is expected to use machine design and analytical skills to conceptualize, develop, and verify new mechanical designs. They are responsible for key system components and will interface with suppliers and manufacturing to build high-quality hardware prototypes and productize new designs. The Senior Mechanical Engineer should be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time constraints and ambiguous or incomplete information typical of research and development. Roles & Responsibilities Designing components and producing mechanical drawings in a government regulated environment for volume manufacturing processes which may include cast metal, injection molded plastic, sheet metal stamped, and others Working within multi-disciplinary teams to define requirements for new and current designs Rapid development and iteration of full-scale prototypes of candidate architectures to satisfy requirements Creating and managing design requirements, specifications, failure-modes analysis, and associated verification and validation testing. Generating and owning models for assemblies, components, and drawings, in a government regulated environment. Collaborating with vendors, suppliers, quality and manufacturing through the design-transfer and launch Mentoring and coaching other engineers in problem solving and technical expertise Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BSME or similar, with minimum 10 years of relevant experience. Experience designing for volume manufacturing processes such as metal casting, plastic injection molding, sheet metal stamping, compression molding, thermoforming, etc. Experience in working with optical design engineers to optimize molded plastic optical elements and the molding process; conversant in opto-mechanical design principles for critical mounts of optical components Proficiency using CAD, FEA and CFD simulation tools, and computational analysis (e.g. Matlab) to optimize designs. Direct experience in complete documentation of designs and release of designs in a rigorous document-control system Experience in designing and working with machine shops to have fixtures and parts built for quick, prototype evaluation Detail-oriented in creating reliable systems that harmonize multiple requirements, e.g. structural, thermal, packaging, acoustic, cleanability, ergonomics, user-interface. Comfortable with all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer Self-driven with the ability to excel in a high-energy, focused team environment, to maintain a strong sense of shared responsibility and reward, and to make work interesting and intellectually vibrant. Preferred Post-graduate study, MS or PhD in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent work experience preferred. Experience in growing design maturity for product launches, scalable manufacturing processes, design for reliability, yield, and cost. Effective collaboration with cross-functional teams like system analysts, field/clinical engineers, human factors, industrial design, UI design, etc. Solidworks, Matlab, Ansys and Windchill experience. Job Description Opportunity: The Company’s operations have grown significantly over the past several years, and with it, the level of complexity our accounting organization is facing. This role offers a great opportunity to implement the infrastructure needed to scale our Global Finance Shared Services Payroll operations. This role is for team players that can take on additional responsibility as they progress in their career and we are committed to providing an environment that foster career growth and development. We look to hire quality individuals with integrity, high capacity for growth, personal accountability, teamwork, and drive. If you exemplify our values and want to be part of our interesting journey in the world of robotic-assisted surgery, this is the role for you. Primary Function Of Position The Senior Payroll Manager will primarily be responsible for oversight and administration of our US and Canada payroll activities, and for the management and development of our payroll team. Responsibilities include developing and maintaining partnerships with Legal, Human Resources (“HR”), Tax, and Benefits along with ensuring compliance with federal, state and local agencies. The ideal candidate will have experience driving innovative and best-in-class payroll processes to ensure timely and accurate employee payroll via an efficient payroll process. In addition, the ideal candidate will have experience leading a payroll team in a high growth environment along with a strong understanding of US and Canada payroll laws. Job Duties Provide guidance and development opportunities along with supporting the day-to-day activities of the payroll team of seven (7). Provide subject matter expertise and be the escalation point to resolve issues. Partner with HR and Legal and act as a liaison with outside agencies for non-standard garnishments. Support the internal Global Employment Counsel when needed. Develop and support processes with Benefits and HR to ensure timely accurate transfer of data required for payroll processing. Manage all 3rd party payroll and timekeeping related vendors, and continuously drive improvements in operational processes and design and implement those initiatives. Provide guidance, training and development opportunities for the payroll team, including maintaining active engagement and establishing priorities in a dynamic environment. Review and approve payroll related journal entries and reconciliations. Provide guidance and support on accounting related items and act as the liaison with the corporate accounting team as needed. Research and understand the applicability of a new rules, tax code or relevant legislation pertaining to payroll at the federal and state levels. Absorb and manage the payroll process for new entities and/or countries as needed. Manage and support periodic internal audit, 401(k), IRS and worker compensation audits, and other payroll related audits. Establish, improve, and communicate payroll related processes and policies to the organization. Monitor and report on payroll metrics and internal payroll policy compliance. Complete necessary training as defined by the Company and Director to maintain and/or develop necessary skills and information. Follows Global Finance Shared Service Center project management methodology. Follows Global Finance Shared Services Center standard operation procedures and participates in the development and update of the procedures. Supports Global Finance Shared Service Center initiatives and guidance as well as the Global Finance Shared Service Center mission and vision. Assist with other responsibilities and ad-hoc projects as needed to support the company and department Qualifications Education and Qualifications: Minimum Bachelor’s degree required. CPP (Certified Payroll Professional) preferred. Minimum Seven (7)+ years of payroll experience in a fast paced, high volume, multi-entity organization. At least three (5) years of direct payroll management experience. Knowledge of labor practices pertaining to payday law, benefits, payroll and employee taxation, payroll accounting, and employment documentation. Knowledge of local and occupational tax withholding and reporting requirements for all US states. Proficient using ADP Vantage for payroll and Workforce for time keeping. Knowledge of Oracle HCM and SAP preferred. Proficient in Microsoft Excel including advanced formula functions and Microsoft Word. Excellent problem-solving skills, analytical mindset with good judgement and high level of attention to details and accuracy. Ability to identify an assess relevant metrics/analytics to manage the payroll process and team. Ability to prioritize workload of self and team members, multi-task, meet all deadlines, and work well under pressure in a fast-paced environment. Experience with equity compensation and frequent payrolls preferred. Strong customer service skills and a customer service focus. Identify and engage service solutions within and outside the payroll department. Strong written and verbal communication skills; appropriately communicates with all levels of customers within the organization. #HYBRID Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The person in this position will be expected to work with cross-functional teams to develop surgical planning software for minimally invasive robotics system, to improve the early diagnosis of lung cancer diseases. Successful candidates will have experience in software design and development. Roles And Responsibilities Participating in the full cycle of the development of surgical planning software with cross-functional teams of software engineers, machine learning engineers, UX designers, and clinic engineers. Strong verbal and written communication skills Nice To Have Skills & Experience Experience with cloud/AWS, docker container, database, front-end web, or mobile application development. Experience with medical imaging formats and PACS/DICOM system. Experience with software development process in a regulated medical device environment. #911 Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Responsible for ensuring suppliers meet ISI requirements for cost, quality, delivery and service. Drive suppliers to continuously improve business and manufacturing processes. Evaluate and select suppliers. Guide Engineering in choosing suppliers for new products and provide DFM input to new designs. Monitor supplier performance. Roles & Responsibilities Select and evaluate suppliers by leading efforts to find new suppliers in an existing or new commodity and works with Engineering to maximize use of the production supply base. Lead detailed projects of transfers of the supply of products and components Create strategies to effectively optimize the supply base by leading efforts to optimize supply networks. Drive suppliers to continually improve their business and manufacturing process performance to meet Intuitive's requirements for supplier excellence including ship to stock programs using a collection of best practices in project management, Six Sigma, Lean, SPC and negotiation by leading these efforts without managerial guidance at several suppliers simultaneously. Develop and influence using metrics for supplier part cost, delivery, quality, capacity and capability by creating metrics to measure real improvement and judge required intervention or change at the supplier or in a commodity. Drive corrective actions for supplier process by driving suppliers to true root cause analysis and corrective and Preventive actions. Drive changes to ISI specifications through influencing and educating resulting in changing specifications and drawings including driving the ECO process to implementation. Provide effective and timely supply base health information to management by creating and delivering data-driven supply base information to any level of management at ISI with little or no guidance (including QRB) and provide recommendations. Prepare and deliver supplier communications as required by independently working with suppliers on scorecard creation of QBRs, Supplier Summits, etc. Work with suppliers and ISI engineering for the new product introduction to: Create product supplier landscapes to determine launch readiness and report to management Develop supplier ramp readiness plans by judging business risk based on forecast, supplier capacity, quality performance, and process capability. DFM by engaging suppliers early in development cycle to feedback manufacturability improvements in the designs prior to production Influence and guide Engineering in choosing suppliers by determining selection criteria for preferred suppliers and leading the team effort to evaluate preferred suppliers. Deliver the following Quality deliverables: pFMEA, Special Process Validations, FAI, and Cpk by leading, training and mentoring suppliers through the pFMEA development, judging process validation requirements and signing-off on protocols as ISI rep, judging process capability with supplier as well as judging FAI suitability. Identify and investigate opportunities for cost reduction and/or quality improvement by judging opportunities and creating strategies to seize those opportunities, completes research and provides data-driven plans to management. Review, analyze and close customer complaints, manufacturing variance requests, and first article inspections by judging risk analyses and justifications, determining corrective and preventive actions at suppliers, looks for opportunities with suppliers to eliminate recurrence. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BS degree in Engineering or equivalent Minimum 8 years related experience in Supplier Quality and/or Supplier Development or related field Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentations to executive level management Excellent Interpersonal skills and team building skills A proven history of implementing Lean/6 Sigma/SPC Programs at suppliers Excellent Project Management skills Excellent analytical and problem solving skills along with good judgment Demonstrable knowledge in evaluating and challenging supplier technical, quality, and business capabilities Demonstrable knowledge of a wide range of manufacturing processes including understanding of key input variables for quality, cost and capacity (specialization can be in metal fabrication, plastics, electronics, and/or contract manufacturing) Excellent knowledge of 21 CFR part 820 and ISO 13485 (experience in auditing suppliers to these standards) Significant computer experience using Windows, Word, Excel, Access and ERP Information Systems, preferably SAP CAD experience with 3D modeling tools is a plus Proven ability to motivate suppliers Experience in a high-volume medical device company is a plus Ability to read and interpret detailed mechanical drawings and communicate technical information Ability to travel to suppliers on an as needed basis - domestic and international Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19.
