Job Description Primary Function of Position: Senior Supplier Quality Engineer (Sr SQE) will provide expertise and support compliance of Intuitive's Supplier Controls with all applicable Regulations and Standards (ISO 13485:2016, MDSAP, EUMDR etc.). S/he will work with cross functional organizations (Purchasing, Product Quality, Supplier Development and Supplier Engineering) to improve Supplier Controls Business Processes. Sr SQE will lead Supplier Monitoring Boards, Internal CAPAs (related to supplier controls), high visibility SCARs and key Supplier Audits. Roles & Responsibilities Own Supplier Quality processes including Supplier Controls, Global Supplier Manual, Supplier Selection, Evaluation and Re-Evaluations, SCAR Process and Supplier Monitoring as a Corporate Business Process Owner. Run quarterly Supplier Monitoring Boards with cross functional stakeholders presenting the status of Supplier Quality health with metrics on Audits, SCARs, Supplier nonconformances and ASL. Work with Regulatory affairs/Quality Systems team and Periodically analyze and review Supplier Controls processes to stay in compliance with latest applicable Regulations and Standards. Lead internal CAPAs related to Supplier Controls. Lead high visibility SCARs and Key Supplier Audits (Evaluations and Re-Evaluations) as a Lead Auditor. Guide Process Managers on ASL maintenance and Supplier promotions and removals. Support Internal and External Audits (FDA, MDSAP, EUMDR etc.) representing Supplier Quality in Audit Front rooms. Lead Projects as a Project Manager to improve Supplier Controls Processes to improve efficiency and compliance. Be a technical custodian of Supplier Data Monitoring and Analysis. Analyze and prepare data for Supplier Monitoring Boards and monitor tools and dashboards for accuracy. Review and Approve Product SCARs and be a board member for SCAR Review Boards Provide Guidance to International Intuitive Sites on Local/Regional Supplier Controls execution and maintenance. Provide guidance to NPI Project teams on Supplier Selection and onboarding Guide Purchasing department on Quality elements of Supplier Agreement negotiation with Suppliers Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BS degree in Engineering or equivalent, Masters degree preferred Minimum 15 years related experience in Supplier Quality and/or Supplier Development, Supplier Engineering or related field Expertise in one or more of the following commodities: metals, plastics, electronics, contract manufacturing, OEM, distribution, or services. Expertise in statistical process control, root cause analysis and corrective/preventive actions Excellent knowledge of 21 CFR part 820, ISO 13485:2016, EUMDR, MDSAP regulations (experience in auditing suppliers to these standards) Certified Lead auditor credentials preferred Ability to be a true team player and a partner to the cross functions teams; be part of the solution and demonstrate ability to use sound judgment in implementing practical Quality System and Compliance solutions. Ability to work with highly technical teams and effectively communicate in an engineering driven team environment Strong organizational, written, and verbal communication skills and the proven ability to prioritize tasks effectively in a deadline-driven environment Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentations to executive level management Excellent Leadership and Project Management skills Significant computer experience using Windows, Word, Excel, Agile, and SAP Ability to read and interpret detailed mechanical drawings and communicate technical information Ability to travel to Suppliers/other Intuitive Sites on an as needed basis (30%) - domestic and international Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. produces the da Vinci® Surgical System, a minimally invasive robotic surgery system that uses highly complex mechanics, replaceable instruments and accessories, and enhanced three-dimensional visualization to extend surgical technique and precision beyond the limits of the human hand. The Swing Shift Senior Engineering Technician is responsible for supporting the troubleshooting and repair of automated assembly equipment. The successful candidate will work closely with Manufacturing, Automation Engineering and Operations teams to monitor equipment status and performance. They will work to resolve problems and document repairs to production equipment, execute test protocols, document results, evaluate new manufacturing process instructions, assemble prototypes, and provide feedback to the engineering and manufacturing teams. In addition, this person will assist with developing equipment, fixtures, and maintain a clean and organized engineering lab space. A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required as well as a commitment to high product quality. Roles & Responsibilities Assemble, maintain, troubleshoot, and repair electro-mechanical assembly equipment. Support automation engineering team with projects involving equipment build, installations, line moves, upgrades, and validation (IQ/OQ). Assist with training of maintenance and operations personnel as needed. Mange material, assemble, test, and provide feedback on prototype and duplicate equipment and fixtures with minimal instruction and guidance. Maintain a clean well-organized development lab that includes multiple prototyping areas (materials, electrical and mechanical tools, and test equipment). Perform daily rounds, highlight potential problems, and take necessary corrective action. Provide daily ‘pass-down’ reports to Automation and Manufacturing Engineering. Document all repair activities and the appropriate adjustments made. Adhere to all safety and health rules and regulations associated with this position and as directed by supervisor. Occasional (<10%) travel to suppliers and other ISI locations. Able to work Swing shift (~3pm to 12AM). Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum 4 years of experience working as an engineering technician in a manufacturing environment. Must have good communication and documentation skills. Must have problem solving and critical thinking skills. Experience with relevant technologies such as sensors, electronics, controls, robotics, pneumatics, valves, and mechanisms is required. Familiarity with hand tools; electrical meters, electrical crimping and soldering, mechanical measuring fastening and aligning. Proven ability to troubleshoot machine sensors, actuators, and mechanical parts, identify a solution and replace parts as needed. Ability to read and interpret mechanical assembly and electrical drawings using Solidworks and Autocad is desirable. Ability to document troubleshooting, repair, and maintenance procedures. Technical degree or certification is desirable. Familiarity with Agile, SAP quality, and MS Office programs is desirable. Previous experience in medical device, aerospace, or other regulated manufacturing environment. Bi-Lingual Spanish/English is desirable. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The following reflects management's definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Under general supervision, follows oral and/or written instructions in performance of a wide variety of skilled technical maintenance, repair, and testing on complex digital and analog electronic components, electrical and electro-mechanical components, cable assemblies, sub-assemblies, assemblies, field replaceable units (FRU) and systems to support a wide variety of Robotic Systems. Regularly use of diagnostic software for localizing equipment and system problems, specialized testing equipment, analyzers, digital oscilloscopes, digital multimeters, clocks, timers, calipers, voltmeters, power supplies, rulers, and other test equipment as required. Roles & Responsibilities Analyzes wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, fab drawings, mechanical component drawings to conduct repair and testing of FRUs Performs repair of complex electro-mechanical assemblies per applicable work Instructions Performs testing of complex electro-mechanical assemblies per applicable work Instructions Aids with failure analysis and Final Test of assemblies and properly documents findings. Participates in investigational teams for FRU's to provide input if required. Communicates status of repairs with leads/supervisors and other departments as necessary. Provides detailed symptom descriptions for failures uncovered during repair, functional test and calibration to assist in component-level troubleshooting. Conducts quality inspection of own or other's work to ensure workmanship standards are met. Adheres to GDP guidelines when completing all documentation Initiates material requests. Reports quality issues and provides details necessary to create quality notification (VR, PL) records transactions in SAP as needed to preserve traceability. Follows all corporate, safety, SOP, DOP procedures and regulations. Maintains a clean and orderly workstation. Communicates process flow recommendations to Leads/Supervisor/Manager or designee. Maintains an excellent attendance record. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Education and/or Experience: Minimum High school diploma and AA or equivalent Minimum of AA or college degree preferred; 1-2 years related experience or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Language Skills: Ability to read, write and understand English. Ability to read and comprehend complex instructions, correspondence, and memos. Ability to write correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to other employees, supervisors, or engineers Mathematical Skills: Ability to do basic math. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply logical understanding to carry out instructions. Ability to deal with situations with several variables. Ability to report actual or potential quality issues. Ability to suggest and implement process improvements. Computer skills: Proficient in use of personal computers as part of daily work, including knowledge of the Microsoft Office suite and SAP ERP System, ACCS (Agile) system (our quality system) to retrieve and submit on-line documentation. Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical internal customers. Acute attention to detail; excellent organizational skills. High level of professional integrity and ethics Ability to work varying shifts. Must have ability to complete training courses. Ability to work in a team environment. Physical Requirements: Ability to lift up to 50lbs. Able to use office and test equipment in a typical office/light manufacturing environment. Repetitive motion. Substantial continual motion. Excellent hand-eye coordination. Vision abilities required include close, distance, color, depth and ability to adjust focus Typical production & repairs environment. General knowledge of clean and organized work areas and practices. High urgency and stress associated with customer deadlines. Some risk of exposure to electrical shock and commonly used chemical compounds such as epoxy, denatured alcohol and acetone. Willing and able to work extended hours when necessary. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The following reflects management's definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Under general supervision, follows oral and/or written instructions in performance of a wide variety of skilled technical maintenance, repair, and testing on complex digital and analog electronic components, electrical and electro-mechanical components, cable assemblies, sub-assemblies, assemblies, field replaceable units (FRU) and systems to support a wide variety of Robotic Systems. Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical internal customers. Acute attention to detail; excellent organizational skills. High level of professional integrity and ethics Ability to work varying shifts. Must have ability to complete training courses. Ability to work in a team environment. Physical Requirements: Ability to lift up to 50lbs. Able to use office and test equipment in a typical office/light manufacturing environment. Repetitive motion. Substantial continual motion. Excellent hand-eye coordination. Vision abilities required include close, distance, color, depth and ability to adjust focus Typical production & repairs environment. General knowledge of clean and organized work areas and practices. High urgency and stress associated with customer deadlines. Some risk of exposure to electrical shock and commonly used chemical compounds such as epoxy, denatured alcohol and acetone. Willing and able to work extended hours when necessary. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The following reflects management’s definition of essential functions for this job but does not restrict the tasks that may be assigned. Management may assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time due to reasonable accommodation or other reasons. Under general supervision, follows oral and/or written instructions in performance of a wide variety of skilled technical maintenance, repair, and testing on complex digital and analog electronic components, electrical and electro-mechanical components, cable assemblies, sub-assemblies, assemblies, field replaceable units (FRU) and systems to support a wide variety of Robotic Systems. Regular use of diagnostic software for localizing equipment and system problems, specialized testing equipment, analyzers, digital oscilloscopes, digital multimeters, clocks, timers, calipers, voltmeters, power supplies, rulers, and other test equipment as required. Must be trained and certified in all Service Depot repair cells. Demonstrate ability to achieve this goal within 30 days. Perform failure analysis and test on various electrical/electro-mechanical assemblies and document findings accordingly. Understand wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, fab drawings, mechanical component drawings. Electronic and Mechanical assembly skills (Examples: soldering, crimping, box build, fiber handling, optical component handling, cable routing, and use of RTV/epoxy). Performs simple and complex repairs on various electrical/electro -mechanical assemblies. Participates in investigational teams for FRU's to provide input if required. Performs complex tasks in preparation for repair and testing of all FRU's. Ability to verify assembly documentation accuracy, read engineering drawings etc. Sets up and operates machines/equipment /fixtures needed to perform repair and testing processes. Is able to initiate ECO's in conjunction with updates required in various work cells when required. Follows all applicable work instructions to perform repair and testing processes. Communicates status of repairs with leads/supervisors and other departments as necessary. Provides detailed symptom descriptions for failures uncovered during repair, functional test and calibration to assist in component-level troubleshooting. Conducts complex quality inspection of own or other's work to ensure workmanship standards are met. Properly completes required documentation and helps maintain its accuracy. Initiates material requests. Reports quality issues (VRs, Process Log), records transactions in SAP as needed to preserve traceability. Follows all corporate, safety, SOP, DOP procedures and regulations. Maintains a clean and orderly workstation. Communicates process flow recommendations to Leads/Supervisor/Manager or designee.. Maintains an excellent attendance record. Able to work with other personnel and across departments. Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical internal customers. Excellent listening, written and verbal communication skills. Able to work in a fast-paced, schedule-driven environment without sacrificing quality. Able to successfully prioritize and manage multiple projects. Acute attention to detail; excellent organizational skills. Able to logically address, analyze and resolve problems. Able to maintain a professional demeanor and diplomacy when dealing with others. Able to work under pressure of changing deadlines and still meet commitments. Analytical and problem-solving skills. Exercises sound judgment while working to resolve critical issues. High level of professional integrity and ethics. jobTitle: Sr. Analyst, Technical Accounting (Inventory & Cost Accounting) ***Open to relocation***
jobDescription: Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere—we strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture—our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let’s advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description The Senior Analyst, Technical Accounting, Product Operations is a highly visible position that plays a critical role in achieving our overall objective of delivering best-in-class financial reporting and business partner support and analysis. This position will serve as a bridge between the Corporate Accounting and Product Operations FP&A teams to ensure that our Inventory and Cost Accounting Processes are efficient, effective, and provide the right level of insight into our inventory-related activities. This role will be responsible for performing inventory-related internal controls and other analyses to ensure that the Company complies with US GAAP. This role will also be responsible for assisting with analytical review of our inventory-related balances and monitoring of timely compliance with our policies. The Company’s operations have grown significantly over the past several years and so has the demand for information relating to our inventory-related activities. Therefore, this is a highly visible role that frequently interacts with management as part of reporting on our inventory-related controls and monthly analyses. This role offers a great opportunity to work closely with a wide range of the Company’s Accounting, FP&A, and Product Operations departments. This role will further allow you to work with a small, agile, and high performing Finance department to develop a broad and deep understanding of the Company’s business and operations that are essential for strong career development. We are looking for leaders that can take on additional responsibility as they progress in their career, and we are committed to providing an environment that fosters career growth and development. We look to hire high-quality individuals with integrity, personal accountability, teamwork, excellence, and proactive thinking. If you exemplify our values and want to be part of our interesting journey in the world of robotic-assisted surgery, this is the role for you. Primary Function Of The Position We are looking for someone that can drive strong project management processes within our Finance and Product Operations teams to collect the data needed for decision-making and financial reporting purposes. The Senior Analyst, Technical Accounting, Product Operations will be responsible for monitoring and collecting data regarding our inventory and product costing policies. The Senior Analyst, Technical Accounting, Product Operations, will also be responsible for coordinating the inventory cycle count processes, as well as be responsible for analysis and reporting provided to management relating to inventory costing matters. This is a great role for someone with strong technical skills that would like to get additional exposure into the Company’s product operations, accounting, and finance activities, as well as getting a deep understanding of the Company’s business. Roles And Responsibilities Own and perform inventory-related controls, including monitoring of the cycle count and physical inventory observation programs, policies, and activities. Work with the Inventory Accounting Team, FP&A, and Product Operations in implementing and monitoring adherence to our Inventory Cycle Count Policy. Project management, including preparing presentations and reporting to the Company’s cross-functional inventory leadership team on the adherence and compliance with our Inventory Cycle Count Policies and Controls. Present to leadership in the Company on the progress of our inventory process. Work closely with our global teams to ensure that the right training and processes have been shared with respect to our inventory policies and controls. Oversee and monitor the Company’s Cost Accounting Policies and Processes. Oversee and assist in the standard costing setting activities, calendar, and deliverables, working closely with our Global Shared Services team. Ensure that the Company’s accounting policies are appropriately applied to all inventory-related activities and accounts. Coordinate and analyze activities relating to inventory matters with the Company’s FP&A organization. Provide guidance and be an expert on all U.S. GAAP matters relating to inventory and R&D. Help drive an efficient and effective process to ensure timely close and reporting of all inventory-related matters by closely coordinating with the Company’s FP&A organization. Monitor and analyze key metrics to track accuracy of our inventory and to provide insight into our inventory-related activities for management. Qualifications 3-5 years of public accounting experience with strong technical accounting skills, including experience working with inventory. CPA is highly preferred. Strong leadership and communication skills with the ability to drive consensus and conclusions. Strong technical (US GAAP) understanding and expertise. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and high capacity for growth and the ability to change along with the Company. High level of integrity and commitment to excellence. Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, or a related field. #HYBRID Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Impact of this role: In this position, you will make significant contributions to how the da Vinci Robot is built and tested. You will analyze assembly and test processes to identify opportunities for improving the methods, quality, and productivity of the manufacturing line. You will be responsible for development of new equipment, tooling and testers, and for continuous improvements to existing test and assembly fixtures. Roles And Responsibilities The ideal candidate will have experience developing custom PC and PLC based automated equipment including concept development, layout design, detailed component design, integration specification, control panel wiring, PLC/HMI programming, tool assembly build, start up and qualification. This Position Has Responsibility And Authority To Identify, design, qualify, document and implement automation test and assembly equipment solutions to be used in manufacturing of DaVinci products. Thoroughly document all aspects of the equipment, including its requirements, design, operation, and qualification in compliance with Good Manufacturing Processes (GMP). Perform design review for new equipment and tooling developed. Execute equipment design and process verification/validation, including DQIQOQPQ activities to allow production release of new equipment. Drive continuous improvement projects in the test and equipment space to increase manufacturing yields, improve test coverage, diagnostic capability, productivity, and error proofing. Utilize statistical tools to develop reports of process performance and identify areas of manufacturing improvement. Determine the root cause of equipment and system test failures. Maintain BOMs for test fixtures, tools or aids. Maintain spare equipment, hardware/software and computer configurations. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Required BSME/BSEE Mechatronics or Mechanical engineering with minimum of 4-6 years related experience. Requires material selection ability with an in-depth understanding of machine shop methods of fabrication. Ability to complete design concepts, mechanical design, load/stress analysis., kinematic and dynamic analysis. Ownership for the design, documentation, qualification, and manufacturing line support of new assembly/test fixtures and automated equipment solutions for manufacturing production. High Proficiency in mechanical design, CAD (SolidWorks), and working with PDM systems. Demonstrated work in component design, equipment assembly design, and completion of detailed mechanical drawings utilizing GD&T. Writing of equipment specifications, test protocols, test reports, PMC requirements. Hands-on responsibility for the building of equipment and the qualification transfer to manufacturing line requiring execution and support of DQ/IQ/OQ/PQ protocols. Hands on manufacturing line support when needed, including the debug, repair and redesign of existing assembly fixtures, automated equipment and test equipment. Ability to recognize opportunities in manufacturing improvement through the use of data collection and analysis to include 6 Sigma, SPC, control chart analysis. Onsite work required, position based in Sunnyvale, CA 10% Travel expected. Preferred Minimum MSME/MSEE (or equivalent) with 6 years prior experience. Prior hands-on Equipment Engineering experience supporting a high-volume manufacturing line. Demonstrated individual ownership for the design and build of complete automation work cells. Successful design and release of compound motion tooling/linkage elements used for automation assembly and process tasks. Control cabinet design and layout, electrical schematic creation, and full build. Prior hands on UL508 build experience a plus. Prior experience working with PLM systems (Agile preferred), SAP applications, including ECO creation, origination of equipment specification, test protocols, BOM, and work instructions. Prior Siemens TIA Portal Programming experience Prior experience in developing and supporting automating screw drive assembly applications. Experience with communication protocols, Profinet, Profibus, I/O link, TCP/IP, RS 232, and RS 485. Prior experience in interfacing PLC’s to a SQL database using an OPC UA interface. Experience working in a medical device company or other regulated business. #911 Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Senior Clinical Development Engineer (CDE) uses their in-depth knowledge of the surgical environment and medical technology to work with design engineers and clinicians to define, develop, and validate the clinical function of new products within our multi-port and single-port surgical robotic platforms. The primary focus of the CDE is to establish and validate data-driven clinical requirements to ensure a high-quality patient outcome. Job Description Job Description Primary Function Of Position The Clinical Research Associate – Level 3 will report to Manager, Clinical Affairs, and will play a key role to proactively support the conduct of pre-market and post-market clinical studies to ensure compliance with all the regulatory requirements. The ideal candidate will have thorough knowledge of Clinical investigation of medical devices for human subjects - Good Clinical Practice (ISO 14155), 21 CFR part 812, 50, 54, and other applicable regulations. Roles & Responsibilities Contribute to all clinical research activities to ensure successful management of clinical studies under the direct supervision of Clinical Affairs manager with dotted lines to clinical study manager. Maintain and track clinical study data and support in investigator qualification and selection, analysis of potential patient recruitment, and overall study status/progress throughout the life of a study. Manage site start-up/activation process, including: Heavy contribution to the preparation of study related documents (protocols, case report forms (CRFs) or eCRFs, draft informed consent forms (ICF) and complete checklists, able to support in clinical trial agreements and budget negotiation, clinical monitoring plan), Organizing IRB/EC submissions and applicable regulatory documentation with follow through to ensure successful outcomes. Amends clinical study documents (ICF, CRFs, Monitoring Plan, etc…) as needed and support clinical sites with institutional review board submission as necessary. Perform on-site and remote site qualification visits, site initiation visits, interim monitoring visits and site close out visits Conduct clinical study monitoring to ensure regulatory and protocol compliance as well as overall data accuracy in accordance with the study clinical monitoring plan. Complete source data verification of clinical study data entered in an Electronic Data Capture (EDC) system or on a case report form at sites to ensure regulatory and protocol compliance and overall accuracy. Serve as main liaison to participating clinical trial sites with focus on data entry, query resolution, investigational device tracking and accountability, and study conduct oversight at the participating clinical sites. Collaborate with data management to support data cleaning process Lead review of safety events and collaborate on development of narrative and reporting as needed Develop and manage study trial master file and maintain study documentation and clinical trial management system (e.g., correspondence, CRFs, study approval documents), trip reports, site contact documentation, monthly status reports (e.g., enrollment, adverse events, budget, etc.) Track, process and manage site payments and support in study financial tracking by developing tracking tools as necessary. Assist Clinical Study Manager on study scoping activities, including but not limited to development of pre-study questionnaires, study design and surgeon/site selection Support site audits and site audit preparation in anticipation of site inspections. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Possess advanced knowledge of Clinical investigation of medical devices for human subjects - Good Clinical Practice (ISO 14155), 21 CFR Part 11, 50, 54, 812 and other applicable regulations Typically requires a minimum of 8 years of related experience with a BA/BS university degree; or 6 years experience and a Nursing degree, a Master’s degree, or a MD or PhD with 3 years experience; or equivalent experience in a scientific field Clinical research/clinical trial management certification/education preferred Prior experiences working in a clinical setting is preferred Must be clinically savvy and possess time management, organizational skills and problem-solving skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills and interpersonal skills with high attention to detail Ability to work successfully in a team environment and ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks as necessary. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, PDF application Experience working with electronic data capture (EDC) systems required Experience in clinical trial management systems preferred Experience in medical device industry required Must be able to travel up to 40% Ability to multi-task and work in a dynamic environment with simultaneous projects/tasks Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Post Market team at ISI works at the intersection of Regulatory and Quality. The team engages across the organization to deeply understand how our products and processes perform, the implications of any issues and, support the execution of robust resolutions. Functions within the Post Market team include Post Market Surveillance, Field Action, Data Analytics, Clinical Engineering, Failure Analysis Engineering, and Continuous Improvement Quality Engineering. The Post Market Team advocates for safety and effectiveness improvements by assessing field product performance and QMS processes to identify, investigate, communicate, and execute on opportunities. The Continuous Improvement Quality Engineering Team requires a Sr. Continuous Improvement Quality Engineer with strong, hands-on experience in problem solving, technical savvy with complex electro-mechanical devices, and passion for the best practices to analyze, monitor, and improve product and process. Roles & Responsibilities Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Continuous Improvement Quality Engineering, the Sr. Continuous Improvement Quality Engineer is responsible for creating and supporting a quality culture by driving compliance activities around the CAPA Program, partnering across the organization to manage continuous process/quality improvement programs that strongly align with ISI standards and customer needs while meeting all applicable Medical Device Regulations and Standards. S/he will partner with subject matter experts on various corrective and preventive (CAPA) activities in addition to supporting other improvement initiatives. S/he will evolve existing processes/systems to ensure timely escalation identification of product quality & compliance issues within a closed loop quality management system. The CIQE will work to collect and analyze data, drive rigorous root cause analyses and facilitate cross-functional discussions to ensure we are seeing ‘all the way around’ issues for complete resolution. S/he will participate in internal/external audits as necessary representing the CAPA Program. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum Bachelor’s degree (Engineering or equivalent) combined with 6-8 years of related experience in Quality, Engineering, Operations, or a continuous improvement environment. Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Passionate about making products and processes better Able to assist people in finding creative solutions around constraints. Able to deliver presentations to a broad audience Knowledge of Quality Systems Regulations (21 CFR 820) and ISO 13485 preferred. Knowledge of Process improvement tools and methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma) is preferred. Green or Black Belt Certification in Lean or Six Sigma is a plus ASQ certification (CQE) is a plus. Experience gathering/processing internal and external requirements. Business Acumen - has demonstrated business knowledge and ability to display the linkage between projects and desired business results. Proven ability to drive creative problem solving related to product and process issues The ability to collaborate effectively with product and/or process subject matter experts in a cross-functional team environment is required. Technical Aptitude is required to collect and analyze data for determining an improvement strategy Ability to navigate multiple projects with changing priorities. Ability to execute to project timelines. Project Management experience preferred. Company Description Joining Intuitive means joining a team dedicated to using technology to improve patient care efficacy and decreasing invasiveness of medical procedures, with patient safety as our highest priority. We work in a high-energy, focused, small-team environment, and believe in applying first principle thinking, data driven decision making, continuous learning, systematic planning to deliver results and achieving our goals. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Ion™ endoluminal system is Intuitive's new robotic platform for minimally invasive biopsy in the peripheral lung, with an initial goal of improving the early diagnosis of lung cancer. This position will play a key technical role during the development of a novel new surgical robot system. The engineer will be expected to work with an incredibly talented team to design and build the embedded software platform.  The successful candidate must excel in a high-energy small team environment, be able to drive to solutions from rough requirements, and have a commitment to high product quality.  A strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required. Roles And Responsibilities Design and development of product-focused, rock-solid, C++ software in a heterogeneous, multi-processor SoC/FPGA/real-time-embedded environment Develop software for embedded Linux/QNX devices: Design and implement multi-threaded, distributed system C++ applications Design and implement code for GPUs using CUDA. Contribute broadly to many areas of software development, including but not limited to: Extension of current frameworks to new processors and operating systems Development of research prototypes used to evaluate new product concepts Distributed communication subsystem development Work on a cross functional team to develop technical specifications and evaluate design trade-offs – specifically in platform software Clinical study support, and participation in product demonstrations, as requested Contribute through design, V&V and transfer to manufacturing activities Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Master’s degree in Electrical, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field. Minimum, 5+ years industry experience developing and supporting embedded systems. Passionate about developing cross-platform, object-oriented C++ code (11 and higher). Experience developing for embedded Linux devices using C++. Strong ability to isolate and debug embedded hardware and software problems. Experience working on product-focused designs in a team environment. Excellent communication skills. A desire to deliver a quality and innovative product that improves many people’s lives. Experience unit testing. Willingness to work in Linux and Windows environments – whatever it takes. Strong intuition for, and interest in, designing systems for testability and scalability. Additional Pluses Experience with Python3 and bash scripts. Experience with Nvidia GPU, working knowledge of CUDA. Understanding of camera sensor and video signal standards. Experience with I2C, SPI and 1 wire protocol. Experience with additional embedded operating systems, such as QNX. Understanding of commonly used messaging and RPC frameworks and their associated tradeoffs for use in distributed embedded systems. Demonstrated experience in and comfort with all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, validation, and transfer to manufacturing. Experience designing software products in an FDA or other regulated industry or for mission critical applications; comfortable with concepts of design input, design output, traceability, risk analysis, and mitigations. Job Description Our team designs and builds the embedded software platform for next-generation surgical robotic systems. We’re looking for a high energy, talented engineer to contribute broadly to the embedded software stack. We are a small group that works in a focused, high-energy environment. We believe in applying first principles thinking, data driven decision making, continuous learning and systematic planning to deliver results and achieve our goals. Are you passionate about technology? Do you want to have a direct impact on helping people live better lives? Interested in the medical applications of robotics? Do you like to build complex distributed systems? Does working in a multidisciplinary, systems-oriented design team sound exciting? About The Role You’ll be joining the team responsible for developing several generations of our flagship product, the daVinci Xi, to develop new surgical robotic systems. You’ll have the opportunity and responsibility to own development of your features, end to end. From concept to cross functional requirements gathering, to implementation, test and verification, success is in your hands. You will be programming C/C++ systems software on microcontrollers deeply embedded in the robotic system but, you are in your heart, an integrator. Collaboration comes naturally to you which will help you develop robust solutions to complex problems and share them with other new product development engineering teams. Responsibilities In your first year, you will contribute broadly to many areas of software development, including but not limited to: Next generation board bring-up, and implement infrastructure to support mechatronic software development. Design and develop device drivers and their interface to high-level applications for devices such as: motors, brakes, LEDs, 1-wire, secure co-processors, and flash storage. Integrate new sensors (time of flight, hall effect, encoder, etc) and their data into the embedded real-time network Extension of Operating System Abstraction Layer (OSAL) framework to bare-metal embedded systems. Maintain current software and resolve problems found during integration of existing systems. Design and develop product-focused, rock-solid, C/C++ software in a heterogeneous, multi-processor SoC/FPGA/real-time-embedded environment Work with cross-functional teams to design technical specifications and evaluate trade-offs Perform formal risk analysis, develop software mitigations, run V&V and participate in design transfer to manufacturing activities. Qualifications 8+ years of experience and a Bachelor's degree in relevant field; or 6+ years of experience and a Master's degree; or 3+ years of experience and a PhD; or equivalent experience Passionate about developing cross-platform using C or C++ programming languages Experience working with bus interfaces such as I2C, SPI, UART, GPIO, and CAN Experience working on product-focused designs in a team environment Experience developing and supporting embedded systems Experience designing software products in an FDA or other regulated industry or for mission critical applications; comfortable with concepts of design input, design output, traceability, and risk analysis, and mitigations Natural communicator with high attention to detail and commitment to the highest product quality Proven ability to proactively engage with fuzzy requirements, learn how things work and apply that learning to new challenges Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The primary objective of a Sr. Engineering Technician is to provide troubleshooting, testing, repairs, equipment maintenance, and development support to the Manufacturing engineering team to meet productivity goals. Additionally, this person will play a significant role in the areas of Failure Analysis, First Pass yield, and MRB review. Candidates must be highly motivated with a strong sense of shared responsibility and shared reward is required as well as a commitment to high product quality. Engineering Support Roles and Responsibilities: Assist or execute engineering level tests and collect data to support design of experiment activities or characterize an assembly. Assist with parts order, build, and modification of development fixtures for evaluation. Document all activities to keep records. Generate or assist on the implementation of Engineering Change orders. Manage time and resources in accordance with project. Perform other engineering technician duties as needed. NPI And Sustaining Production Support Follow Production escalation process and provide engineering evaluation of any interruptions to production line. Perform quick triage of the issue and recommend best course of action to keep production moving. Perform simple reworks on the spot (cable crimping, solder components, tap threads, clean optics, adjust alignments etc.). Document all activities during escalation support in formal records. Order parts and assemble/bring up duplicate fixtures for production. MRB support (Evaluation and disposition of failed material): Review parts in MRB, analyze failures in detail, make decisions on dispositions and approve, document all findings in formal records. Manage scrapped parts and organize process around reviewing them with Manufacturing engineering. Execute stock purges that require engineering level test/measurements. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Understand wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, fab drawings, mechanical drawings. Ability to solve technical issues with a basic understanding of Electrical circuits and mechanical drawings. Working knowledge of computers, word processing and spreadsheet applications for documentation and data presentation. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to variety of technologies that allow effective troubleshooting. Examples: Digital and Analog Electronics components, optical components, servo components, machined parts, sheet metal parts, cable assemblies. Good communication skills to be able to partner effectively with production techs, supervisors, training department as well as Manufacturing/Design/Test Engineers. Proven ability to work well in team environment Familiarity with JIRA, Agile, and SAP or equivalent tools Minimum 5 years’ experience supporting a system engineering group in a product development organization Ability to read, modify, and execute test scripts use for debug Ability to troubleshoot complex PCAs down to component level. Document findings of investigation in quality notifications which are part of official Device History Records. Electronic and Mechanical assembly skills (Examples: soldering, crimping, box build, fiber handling, optical component handling, cable routing, and use of RTV/epoxy). Job Description The Automation, Equipment, and Test (AET) Group is responsible for making the robots that make the robots. We develop and support the equipment, fixtures, and tooling that enable, optimize, and streamline the manufacturing process for Intuitive’s Instruments and Accessories business unit. Primary Function Of Position The Senior Equipment Controls Engineer will be an integral member of Intuitive’s AET team. This position is responsible for design, develop, test, qualify, implement and maintain manufacturing equipment and control software that support high-volume manufacturing of Intuitive’s Instrument and Accessory product lines. The custom manufacturing equipment employs a wide variety of automated features, including electronic sensing, motion control, robot integration, machine vision, and data collection. This position will play a critical role in introducing new products and scaling manufacturing operations, while improving quality, yield, and efficiency. The ideal candidate will have experience developing control systems for custom automated equipment from design, through fabrication, to sustained production use, and will have demonstrated proficiency in selection and integration of electronic hardware for control and networking, as well as the creation of associated software. Success in this role will depend on the ability to manage numerous concurrent complex projects while maintaining the highest possible quality standards. Roles & Responsibilities Determine the optimal controls architecture to perform the specific set of operations for custom automated manufacturing and test equipment. Define, build, and support the control systems for custom equipment. Write the software to run custom automated equipment, including controller, HMI, data acquisition, and networking. Strive to create software that is organized, structured, documented, maintainable, and reusable. Ensure manufacturing equipment designs meet functional, safety, ergonomic, and documentation requirements, to facilitate efficient production operation across Intuitive’s US-based and international sites. Write V&V protocols, lead V&V execution, and write V&V reports for equipment and processes. Knowledge of factory intelligence, databases and organization of data. Leverage data acquisition to enable quality measurement tools such as SPC, Six Sigma, Cpk, and gauge R&R. Able to read and understand mechanical drawings and electrical schematic. Able to perform basic wiring and electrical circuit trouble shooting. Provide controls-related root-cause analysis and technical support to on-going production operations. Support product cost reductions derived from equipment and tooling used in manufacturing. Specify the control requirements for, and manage the creation of, manufacturing equipment which can be designed and fabricated by third parties. Lead cross-functional team projects focused on process and equipment development Serve as mentor for early-career engineers in the AET group Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BSEE, BSME, Controls, Software Engineering, Mechatronics or similar; advanced degree preferred. Minimum 8 years’ experience developing control systems for automated manufacturing equipment. Medical device industry experience is a plus. Familiarity with regulated Quality Systems, especially medical device regulations is a plus. Great attitude, eager, willing/able to take initiative, works well with others in team environment. Software proficiency in PLC programming (Allen-Bradley preferred) and HMI programming (Wonderware preferred). Familiarity with C/C++, LabVIEW, Matlab, Java, and Python. Experienced in industrial robot (Denso, Fanuc, Epson) programming. Familiarity with pneumatic controls, sensors, vision systems, servos and other actuators. Strong technical analytical skills including motion control algorithms and statistical methods. Experienced in industrial network performance trouble shooting and optimization. Knowledge of industrial communication protocols, such as EtherNet/IP, Modbus/TCP, EtherCAT and Serial/ASCII. Experience managing the development of control systems for complex integrated equipment. Proven ability to develop control systems that integrate electronic sensors, actuators, and motion control components to perform mechatronic tasks. Proven track record developing high quality, reliable industrial control systems. Spanish fluency is a plus. Ability to travel nationally and internationally. Travel requirements will be approximately 5%. #911 Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Impact of this role: In this position, you will make significant contributions to how the da Vinci Robot is built and tested. This Position Has Responsibility And Authority To Identify, design, qualify, document and implement automation test and assembly equipment solutions to be used in manufacturing of DaVinci products Thoroughly document all aspects of the equipment, including its requirements, design, operation, and qualification in compliance with Good Manufacturing Processes (GMP). Drive continuous improvement projects in the test and equipment space to increase manufacturing yields, improve test coverage, diagnostic capability, productivity, and error proofing. Maintain BOMs for test fixtures, tools or aides. Maintain spare equipment, hardware/software and computer configurations. Ownership for the design, documentation, qualification, and manufacturing line support of new assembly/test fixtures and automated equipment solutions for manufacturing production. High Proficiency in mechanical design, CAD (Solidworks), and working with PDM systems. Demonstrated work in component design, equipment assembly design, and completion of detailed mechanical drawings. Prior experience working with Agile, SAP applications, including ECO creation, origination of equipment specification, test protocols, BOM, and work instructions. Experience with developing programs for PC or PLC/HMI based automated equipment for manufacturing Prior experience with the hands-on building, startup, commissioning, and debug of assembly fixtures and automated equipment Experience in the full integration selection and commissioning of elements used automation equipment including Multi Axis robots, XYZ systems, electrical drives, pneumatic actuators and valve bank, I/O link, and sensors Ability to identify and resolve opportunities in manufacturing improvement through manufacturing line observation, and the use of data collection and analysis using 6 Sigma, SPC, control chart analysis. Onsite work required, position based in Sunnyvale, CA 10% Travel expected Preferred Prior hands-on Equipment Engineering experience supporting a high-volume manufacturing line Demonstrated individual ownership for the design and build of complete Automation work cells Successful design and release of compound motion tooling/linkage elements used for automation assembly and process tasks Control cabinet design and layout, electrical schematic creation, and full build. Job Description Who we’re looking for We’re looking for a skilled Senior Group Manager, Social Media to lead, develop execute and maintain our social media program across multiple channels. What You’ll Do Manage the team responsible for publishing, maintaining, and growing multiple social media channels Partner with cross-functional stakeholders to identify, create and direct a pipeline of social content Evolve organic and paid content strategy line with brand standards and business goals Optimize the capabilities and standards required to operationalize social media at scale across the globe Measure, analyze and communicate social media performance Responsibilities Plan, develop and execute comprehensive corporate social media programs with department leadership to amplify the brand and ensure global programs adhere to business standards while meeting prioritized business objectives Manage the team of social media experts responsible for growing social channels and engaging key audiences Maintain consistent contact with marketing, human resources, clinical, product and sales management teams to ensure alignment with, and the following of protocols, to create and publish content efficiently Monitor the social landscape and respond as needed Lead social media projects as product owner amongst cross-functional teams including IT, legal, public affairs, marketing, and others to drive understanding and advance capabilities at a market level. You have strong written and verbal communication skills simplifying complex ideas and concepts and making them clear and actionable. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Digital Engineering Group designs, builds, deploys, and supports both medical device and non-medical device software, data infrastructure, web portals, hardware, web applications and services to collect and analyze medical device machine data from thousands of systems deployed world-wide. This position would act as a leader in the Digital Quality organization and is responsible for all aspects of development and management of the overall non-medical device quality system and continued compliance and improvement.. Roles And Responsibilities This position has responsibility and authority for: Development, implementation, maintenance, and improvements to compliance of applicable regulatory requirements by maintaining an effective quality management system under ISO 9001 Building a team to support the various development and maintenance of the quality system Coordinate audits by the Notified Body and / or other regulatory bodies and third parties, and coordinates responses to applicable audit findings Collaborate with other Quality peers to implement digital solutions to support the Quality Management System Assessing the company requirements in all facets of quality management, from product design control through production to customer service, corrective actions, and audits Provide support to internal functions in the application, maintenance and improvement of quality systems, procedures, and department specific processes Prepare quality/performance reports and metrics for the QMS Ensure efficient and effective processes and tools are established for compliance with ISO and other standards and requirements Coordinate the communication and review of quality data in Management Review and other forums Must be able to work with Product development teams, Operations, SQA, Manufacturing, and support groups at all levels Work closely with Digital Quality leaders to define and drive the NMD QMS vision and roadmap Prepares reports and other information for readouts to Executive Management Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Competency Requirements: (Competency is based on: education, training, skills and experience. Job Description Overview Intuitive manufactures complex medical robotic systems in Sunnyvale, CA. This position requires an extremely motivated individual with high capacity to learn, analyze and drive technical issues to closure in the manufacturing environment. It requires both a proactive mindset to build a strong technical understanding of the product/processes, and a high level of urgency to react to unplanned problems when they arise. Joining Intuitive means joining a team dedicated to using technology to benefit patients by improving surgical efficacy and decreasing surgical invasiveness, with patient safety as our highest priority. About The Role As a manufacturing engineer, you will: Perform technical root cause analysis of trending manufacturing failures utilizing design documentation, manufacturing test data, system software tools, and a variety of lab / bench equipment. Lead cross-functional engineering team meetings to resolve manufacturing issues. Support the assembly, calibration and testing of robotic systems, with a focus on electrical components and embedded SW Perform regular analysis of factory data and use it to anticipate and solve manufacturing/quality problems. Deliver improvements in yield, reliability, serviceability, manufacturability, testability, capacity, and cost, primarily for electrical and electro-mechanical sub-assemblies. This position is highly collaborative, and strong communication/presentation skills will provide visibility amongst the engineering, production, and management teams. Qualifications Required Minimum BS or MS degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering/Science, or equivalent. Proven proficiency with use of EE lab equipment including Oscilloscopes, Spectrum Analyzers, Power supplies, and Multimeters Strong ability to read electronic schematics, assembly, and fabrication drawings Familiarity with prototyping using microcontrollers. Familiarity with Matlab and/or Python Candidate must be of high character and energy with focused attention to detail. “Self-starter” attitude and comfort in a hands-on environment, where he/she can demonstrate an ability to work with other engineers to influence product design to improve reliability. Strong Troubleshooting mind set - an ability to break down a system or process systematically and effectively into subparts to identify failures and troubleshoot to component level. Commitment to organized project/task tracking, and knowledge sharing using tools such as JIRA/Confluence. Job Description Company Description Primary Function Of Position Design and construct pioneering manufacturing equipment used to produce minimally invasive medical devices. This manufacturing equipment will range in complexity from custom manual fixtures to semi-automated electro-mechanical systems, integrating workholding, sensing, motion, and vision control. This position will play a critical role in developing cutting edge manufacturing capabilities to enable the future of minimally invasive surgery. The successful candidate will conceptualize, develop, and support the mechanical design of novel surgical robot systems, taking individual responsibility for the successful design of specific system components. The candidate will demonstrate creativity and sound engineering in the design of kinematics, robotic actuation, and sensing solutions along with the selection of engineering materials. The candidate must be able to coordinate their efforts within a team design effort and be able to report progress and milestones relative to the overall development project. He or she must excel in a high-energy team environment and be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time pressures and incomplete information typical of new product development. Roles & Responsibilities Independently applies expertise across broad range of design activities and scope to generate designs exhibiting best practices. Assist in the investigation of optimal methods and equipment architecture to perform critical manufacturing operations. Design and build in-house proprietary manufacturing equipment from concept to full solution. Develop metrics, protocols, and test fixtures for qualifying robot system designs Guide projects through the design control process (design specification, design review, risk analysis, etc.) Determine troubleshooting, maintenance, and calibration procedures for equipment. Improve product quality and reliability using Cpk, Gauge R&R, and similar quality tools. Provide equipment-related technical support to on-going production operation and expansion. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum of a bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent industry experience. Minimum 8 years’ experience developing manufacturing equipment. Self-motivated, willing/able to take initiative, works well with others in a team environment. 3D CAD proficiency, SolidWorks preferred. Ability to integrate mechatronics components such as sensors, motors, pneumatics, and motion and vision control components. Strong understanding of tolerance analysis and statistical methods. Excellent written and oral communications skills. Familiarity with regulated Quality Systems, especially medical device regulations, is a plus. Experience in an ISO 13485, ISO 9001, or medical device manufacturing environment is a plus. The position is on site at the Intuitive Blacksburg, VA facility. Able to travel periodically (10%). Additional Information All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role. Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Job Description Primary Function of Position: As Equipment Engineer you will use your background and experience with manufacturing equipment, to develop and deploy automated assembly lines. The successful candidate will work closely with Automation, Controls and Process Engineering, Maintenance, vendors and other teams to define, improve and monitor equipment reliability, throughput and process capability. They define, deploy, monitor and improve the Preventive Maintenance specifications, SPC on tool parameters, bill of material and spare parts requirement. They review, analyze and investigate equipment related scraps and provide root cause analysis and effective corrective actions. The position acts as a technical advisor on all equipment issues and provides technical feedback to the Automation and Manufacturing Engineering team. They are hands-on technical individuals with strong electromechanical troubleshooting skills. Roles & Responsibilities Support manufacturing and development of automated assembly equipment. Lead or be an active team member to drive continuous improvement programs relating to equipment performance and reliability, maximize Mean Productive Time Between Failure (MTBF), and Operational Uptime (AOU), and minimize Mean Time To Repair (MTTR). Manage day-to-day equipment issues in a production environment related to breakdowns, improvements, and upgrades. Develop maintenance and calibration documentation and procedures. Provide technical feedback, influence design and implementation of upgrades to improve reliability and increase production output. Support equipment related projects which includes but not limited to: Purchase and definition of new equipment, set-up, qualification, and release of equipment into production. Maintenance and upgrading of existing machines to set up of new equipment/lines. Production line duplications and bring up. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS or MS in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Mechatronics or related area. A minimum of three years of equipment management experience with a working knowledge of equipment qualification, calibration and PM procedures and practices. Previous experience in medical device, aerospace or other regulated manufacturing environment. Excellent mechanical and electrical aptitude. Knowledge in equipment control systems, PLC Knowledge 6 sigma methodology. Drafting and mechanical design experience is a plus (Solidworks) Ability to read electrical & plumbing schematics. Project planning and execution. Data Analysis with MiniTAB or JMP. Problem Solving. Logical thinking and root cause analysis capability. Able to travel periodically (5-10%). Bilingual (Spanish) a plus. Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical designs and manufactures highly complex robotic systems, endoscopes, instruments and accessories for use in surgery. We are looking for a hands-on, technically strong engineer to support new vision product development. The role will involve ownership of an opto-electromechanical system and accessories from proof of concept through detailed mechanical design, prototype manufacturing, qualification testing, and transition to full-scale manufacturing. The successful candidate has a track record on multidisciplinary teams from product concept through market launch. This person participates in creating system-wide architecture, has the proven ability map out schedules and work assignments, leads teams through concept and development, and plays an active hands-on role in solving challenging technical problems. The successful candidate will utilize creativity and sound engineering judgment in the design of medical capital equipment components for volume manufacturing processes. They are expected to use engineering and analytical skills to conceptualize, develop, and verify new mechanical and opto-mechanical designs. They are responsible for key system components and will interface with suppliers and manufacturing to build high-quality hardware prototypes and productize new design. They should be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time constraints and ambiguous or incomplete information typical of research and development. Roles & Responsibilities Lead and influence cross-functional project teams in the design and development of new products with complex illumination and vision device functionality Design and develop mechanical parts and assemblies for surgical illumination and vision systems, with careful consideration for mechanical design, kinematics, materials (plastics & metals) and stress analysis Design highly manufacturable products with various manufacturing techniques such as machining, welding, sheet metal, casting, and injection molding Analyze and test product designs. Including development of DOEs, data collection, and data analysis Create product functional and design specifications Vendor liaison to design new components to supplier inputs Develop fixtures, alignment tools and processes to assemble products Develop and perform component and subsystem verification tests and data collection Collaborate to attract top talent and invest in mentorship and training to retain and support the career development of team members Provide leadership by example to the mechanical engineering team and help foster an environment that encourages creativity, risk taking, and crisp execution Navigate complex technical and programmatic situations by driving timely decision making and setting appropriate priorities to focus the team for success Champion best practices for mechanical design while coaching and mentoring engineers Observe clinical cases and participate in interviews with clinical experts to inform designs Facilitate hardware and software integration of new prototypes and new products including surgical instruments, robotic manipulators, and imaging Support production of final product by troubleshooting process and component problems Provide engineering support to Manufacturing, Materials, Test Engineering, and Service to facilitate transfer of designs. Participate in planning, staffing, budgeting, and project/program cost tracking Document and communicate intellectual property Develop Design History Files per FDA requirements Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Minimum BS or higher in Mechanical Engineering, or equivalent work experience in commercial, medical and/or consumer products Minimum 10+ years of experience developing overall product mechanical architecture including thermal, mechanical, and optomechanical with consideration for electronic, software, and optical systems. Extensive mechanical design and engineering background with demonstrable achievements. Experience with design for machining & medium/high-volume injection molding experience a plus. Proficient in all phases of the product development lifecycle including design, implementation, debug, verification, qualification, and transfer High proficiency with 3D CAD (Solidworks preferred) and simulation tools (Matlab, Ansys etc.) that support design excellence. Tolerance analysis of high complexity and precision mechanical designs with excellent understanding of GD&T principles and drafting standards. Detailed knowledge of and experience on working with miniature parts, molded parts, PCAs, imaging and illumination systems is a huge plus Experience with Design for moldability is a huge plus Ability to create and own design documentation including mechanical CAD models, BOMs, product specifications, and test procedures. Knowledge of illumination and optical systems, stress analysis, thermal design and tolerance analysis Strong understanding of component selection criteria, and design for reliability and manufacturability. Strong project management, planning, budgeting, and change management skills Excellent teamwork skills with proven ability to cultivate collaboration across multiple disciplines to ensure timely project success Excellent communication (written, verbal), presentation, and documentation skills A passion for creating robust/reliable products and an excitement to learn and problem solve Direct medical device experience is preferred but not required Demonstrable track record Self-starter needing minimal supervision Self-confident and able to react quickly under pressure Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The primary function of the Sr. PMC Technician is to provide guidance and leadership to the PMC team supporting all cross-functional teams. The Sr. PMC Technician will troubleshoot and assess failure modes of semi-automated and automated test equipment, complete on-site preventive maintenance of equipment throughout ISI facilities, perform equipment calibration, and coordinate the calibration of equipment utilizing outside services. Roles And Responsibilities The Sr. PMC Technician works independently to implement Intuitive's PMC program. Essential duties and responsibilities include the following: Assist to monitor and improve monthly department key metrics. Review, create, and document new PMC procedures and work instructions to standardize the process. Review and redline new equipment PMC forms and instructions prior to Agile release. Collaborates with QE, ME, and NPI Engineering Team on preventive maintenance and calibration related updates. Responsible for ECO implementation in regards to fixtures and tooling (i.e. taking obsolete fixtures out of service) Identify PMC process gaps and collaborate with cross-functional teams on projects that would result in cost reduction, process improvements, increase efficiency, and error proof PMC process. Performs assessment and supports troubleshooting of ISI equipment not performing per equipment specifications. Manages Equipment Events (EEs) in SAP, ensuring satisfactory and immediate response to repair and/or escalate. Provide guidance and train PMC Technicians, review work orders, and ensure GDP is follow. Support and coordinate manufacturing re-layout and production line expansions. Maintains calibration certificates and user manuals. Assists and/or performs Initial / Operational qualification and validation activities on Equipment Fixtures and Tooling Involvement with all phases of the product development process, including prototype assembly, test, debug, transfer, and sustaining Participate and support internal / external audits as required. Perform peers audit as necessary. Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS degree or equivalent, OR an equivalent of Minimum 5+ years of PMC experience / engineering environment. Excellent communication and documentation skills. Project management skill is a plus. Working knowledge of 5S, Lean manufacturing, and Six Sigma is a plus. Proficient in SAP, Agile, MES, and PMC Module (establishment of Work Orders, notification, Activation & Inactivation, and Results recording) Understanding of Quality Control, Inspection, Metrology, PMC, GDP, and GMP Working knowledge of electronics and mechanical concepts. Understand wiring diagrams, schematics, assembly drawings, and mechanical component drawings. Excellent creative problem-solving skills. Comfortable troubleshooting and resolving complex assemblies for Equipment, Fixtures, and Tooling Experience with use of hand tools and measurement tools: dial calipers, micrometers, force gauges, Instron and other materials testing equipment Proficient with Microsoft Office (Words and Excel) for documentation and data presentation. Knowledge of Solidwork is a plus.
