Job Description Primary Function of Position: The Senior Production Control Manager will lead a team of worldwide planners to support production and engineering development activities in a fast paced, high-volume manufacturing/engineering change company. This role requires a creative/analytical thinker with a vision for how to raise process maturity to the next level and the ability to implement change. This position works collaboratively with all Manufacturing sites, Order Management, Product Marketing, Purchasing, Master Scheduling, other Planning groups, Supply Chain Commodity Management, Logistics, IT, and Warehousing to ensure continuous material supply to support internal and external customer demands. The Senior Production Control Manager will need to influence and lead continuous improvement activities of diverse scope and complexity to improve the efficiency of systems and processes. Roles & Responsibilities Fully accountable for worldwide plan fulfillment and FG availability along with owning Inventory Health metrics and working with world-wide MFG teams on optimizing productivity or resources such as labor time, headcount, materials, and equipment. Accountable to coordinate and track build plans vs actuals between all manufacturing sites weekly and quarterly. Work with Master Scheduling, Production management teams to understand build plans and changes to build plans. Responsible to standardize worldwide processes and IT tools around production planning and work order management in order to drive towards world class best practices. This would include metrics and reports to track shortage/escalations meetings including tracking of root causes to develop/implement short term and long-term corrective actions. Own and drive Planning strategy in all systems including o9/SAP/Agile. Work with o9 Business Process Architect, multi-site planning, multi-site purchasing and multi-site manufacturing to drive and influence strategy. This includes driving change management throughout the organization. Works with cross functional groups to align and drive business change across the Quote to collect process. This requires understanding of Order Management and Logistics processes and transactions. Monitor and communicate First Pass Field Rate and Back Order metrics along with root cause and driving projects with various teams to continue to drive to metric goals. Drive transaction discipline: work with all departments and MFG sites to ensure the correct representation of material need, material availability and material flow through the MRP system. This includes developing and maturing Policies, Procedures and Work Instructions. Mentor and develop team members through tactical problem solving, defining clear performance objectives, and translating challenges into growth opportunities to ensure team engagement in order to meet department and organizational goals. Drive our Culture Strategy by fostering our mission, founding principles, individual and leadership expectations. Qualifications Skills, Experience, Education, & Training: Strong oral and written communication skills ability to present and executive succinct executive presentations. No Travel constraints. Needs to work with different cultures and different time zones. Broad understanding of manufacturing processes such as MRP/Work order process/ quality processes/ Logistics/Order management/ECO and effectivity management/lifecycle management/material master/capacity/manufacturing processes/inventory/purchasing processes and systems. Strong Enterprise MRP systems background. Previous work experience with IT system and processes implementations and ability to drive process changes. This includes ability to understand transactional knowledge of all systems. Ability to lead system and process changes between manufacturing sites. Must have an ability to understand and interpret large data sets and simplify complex issues and data sets across various levels in the organization. Strong leadership skills required since communications across Operations teams and cultures is required to be successful. 10+ years of experience in Production Planning, Production Scheduling, Inventory Control and/or Master Scheduling with advanced knowledge of industry best practices in medical industries or similar discipline with analytical bias. Undergraduate degree required, preferably with a Bachelor of Science in an engineering discipline or in Operations Management, Industrial Engineering, or Supply Chain. Advanced degree (MS, MBA) preferred. APICS CPIM certification preferred. 3+ years of experience with advanced proficiency in Excel (pivots, lookups, etc.) Experience with SAP, Agile, o9 preferred. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Intuitive Surgical, Inc. produces the da Vinci® Surgical System, a minimally invasive robotic surgery system that uses highly complex mechanics, replaceable instruments and accessories, and enhanced three-dimensional visualization to extend surgical technique and precision beyond the limits of the human hand. The Sr. Software Test Engineer will develop and test new and innovative surgical devices and robotic instrument products for the Intuitive da Vinci Surgical System. He or she must excel in a high-energy team environment and be capable of making sound decisions when faced with the time pressures and incomplete information typical of new product development. The successful candidate must have strong technical depth in relevant areas and have a track record of successful product development efforts. Role And Responsibilities Represent Software Test Engineering on cross-functional project teams that design, test and develop next generation surgical devices and robotic instrument products Work closely with the hardware, software and system engineering teams to determine best methods to verify design requirements and to ensure design outputs are successfully integrated into effective system designs Build a software test team, manage the priorities, and provide hands on technical mentorship for test engineers. Support robotic instrument and surgical devices continuous integration & testing across multiple development platforms Develop, implement, test and document solutions for designs according to clinical and market requirements Develop test methodologies to perform manual or automated software verification. Provide rapid prototype firmware and iterative design support for the testing of new technology and to evaluate future product release content Provide engineering support for resolution of field and manufacturing issues Provide technical support to other company stakeholders on surgical device technologies Support the quality and regulatory processes as required Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS required, MS preferred (EE or CS preferred). Minimum 5 years of software testing experience for embedded devices. Experience testing complete firmware or software solutions for embedded systems using C/C++, Verilog or assembly language in Linux operating system. Develop tests at module and system level in Python. Debug software and perform reviews of test automation frameworks. Nice To Have Contribute to design documentation for test protocols, results and reports and complete tracing for all software requirements. Assist in analysis of test and field data, identify non-conformance trends, generate concise executive summaries, and recommend design improvements. Proven experience using electronic bench equipment such as oscilloscopes and function generators for the bring up and troubleshooting of hardware Proven experience in a fast paced, high transaction environment providing solutions throughout the entire product lifecycle Hands-on engineering with the proven ability to work well in a team environment Familiarity with software configuration management tools, defect tracking tools and effective peer review techniques Experience with designing products in an FDA or other regulated industry or for mission critical applications is desired; comfort with concepts of design input, design output, traceability, and risk analysis Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Site Reliability Engineers (SREs) at Intuitive fill the mission-critical role of ensuring that our complex, big scale systems are healthy, monitored, automated, and designed to scale. You'll use your interest in site operations and your experience writing code to work closely with our development teams from the early stages of design all the way through identifying and resolving production issues. Roles And Responsibilities Gain deep knowledge of our complex applications, potentially becoming a primary point responsible for the overall health and performance of one or more of them Assist in the roll-out and deployment of new product features and installations to facilitate our rapid iteration and constant growth Develop tools to improve our ability to rapidly deploy and effectively monitor custom applications in a Windows or UNIX environment Work closely with development teams to ensure that platforms are designed with scale, operability, and performance in mind Function well in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Job Description Primary Function of Position: The mission of Supplier Engineering is to build a world-class supplier network for our products that can ensure continuity of supply, scale to support demand, provides cost reduction and anticipates and mitigates supply chain risks. Supplier Engineers work throughout the product development lifecycle executing strategic projects to optimize commodities, sub-commodities and individual suppliers; executing detailed projects with suppliers to implement changes and improvements affecting quality, cost, capacity, risk, and sub-supplier management and to launch new products. This role will focus on manufacturing of mechanical parts and assemblies of part manufactured using all major manufacturing methods including CNC, sheet metal, plastic injection molding, and casting. The ideal candidate has experience bringing complex electro-mechanical devices market, preferably medical devices; has worked directly with manufacturing suppliers and component suppliers; and has demonstrated knowledge in a variety of manufacturing technologies, supplier management, and process verification and validation. Roles And Responsibilities Drive projects to continually improve supply base business and manufacturing process performance to meet Intuitive Surgical’s requirements for supplier excellence using a collection of best practices in project management, Six Sigma, Lean, SPC and negotiation Work with suppliers to execute cost reductions, capacity improvements, and risk mitigation Examples include supplier changes, manufacturing process changes, production optimization, facility changes, new equipment qualification, and new line validations Improve quality and ensure continuous improvement with suppliers by utilizing structure problems solving processes such as 8D, root cause analysis, corrective actions, etc. Manage quality discrepancies through the execution of quality notifications Drive changes to ISI requirements as necessary by initiating and managing changes to specifications and drawings through the ECO process Manage the planning and execution of supplier change management projects Collaborate with suppliers and internal stakeholders to determine deliverables and define timelines Complete project deliverables including: Supplier pFMEA, Process Validations (IQ/OQ/PQ), Inspection Reports, Gage R&R, and Process Capability Analysis Lead the team in overcoming difficult process issues Effectively prioritize and advance multiple concurrent projects and tasks Clearly communicate project status to key stakeholders Qualifications Skill/Job Requirements: Minimum BS degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent, advanced degree preferred Minimum 5+ years in engineering and manufacturing, preferably in the medical, automotive, or aerospace industries Excellent written and verbal communication skills including presentations to executive level management Demonstrated Project Management skills Outstanding analytical skills along with good judgment Ability to find common ground between various stakeholders, and bring people together to drive towards key goals Demonstrable knowledge of a wide range of manufacturing processes including understanding of key input variables for quality, cost and capacity Knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing techniques, certification preferred Knowledgeable of GD&T, certification is a plus Knowledge of 21 CFR part 820 and ISO 13485 is a plus Proficient in MS Office and ERP Information Systems, preferably SAP Experience in a high-volume medical device company is a plus Ability to travel to suppliers on an as needed basis – domestic and international The Following Skills Are Not Required But Highly Desirable Sheet metal qualification and contract manufacturing experience Electronics / Motion systems qualification and contract manufacturing experience Casting / MIM qualification contract Job Description Primary Function of Position: The vision systems analyst group is a part of the core technology engineering group at Intuitive. The goal of the group is to deliver the highest image quality to our surgeons for all our da Vinci robot systems. The focus of the group is mainly on the imaging algorithms, algorithmic tuning and calibration of the endoscopes, displays, and illuminator needed to accomplish excellent image quality. We also help spec and define the light source, optics, sensor and displays used on the da Vinci robotic systems because all these components contribute to the surgical image quality. Roles & Responsibilities Design, implement, and improve methods and algorithms used to characterize and calibrate image sensors, cameras, and illumination solutions Evaluate and improve real-time image processing pipeline algorithms Build protocols for optimizing and defining image quality specifications Perform calibration of cameras and the entire vision system Prepare and review patent applications Deliver superb camera video to clinicians Qualifications University Hiring Program Eligibility Requirements: University Enrollment: Must be currently enrolled in and returning to an accredited degree-seeking academic program in the Fall. Internship Work Period: Must be available to work full-time (approximately 40 hours per week) during a 10-12 week period starting May or June. Specific start dates are shared during the recruiting process. Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Current enrollment in an imaging-related [e.g., Imaging Science, Computer Science, Electrical & Computer Engineering] degree-seeking program at the master’s or Doctorate level Experience in developing image and video processing algorithms or control loops Demonstrated skill at solving complex engineering problems Strong scientific understanding of imaging physics and human perception Knowledgeable in camera sensors, displays, optics and illumination sources Proficient in Matlab (Python or C/C++ a plus) Experience with GPU/CUDA programming a plus Additional Information Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Company Description At Intuitive, we are united behind our mission: we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. As a pioneer and market leader in robotic-assisted surgery, we strive to foster an inclusive and diverse team, committed to making a difference. For more than 25 years, we have worked with hospitals and care teams around the world to help solve some of healthcare's hardest challenges and advance what is possible. Intuitive has been built by the efforts of great people from diverse backgrounds. We believe great ideas can come from anywhere. We strive to foster an inclusive culture built around diversity of thought and mutual respect. We lead with inclusion and empower our team members to do their best work as their most authentic selves. Passionate people who want to make a difference drive our culture. Our team members are grounded in integrity, have a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and bring diverse, real world experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and achieve their highest potential. Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients. Together, let's advance the world of minimally invasive care. Job Description Primary Function of Position: Lead and provide strategy direction and management to center of excellence that provides centralized expertise on medical device safety, functionality, and effectiveness. Multidisciplinary areas of technical expertise include Biological Safety, Device Reprocessing, Sterility Assurance, Packaging, Product Labeling, Engineering Verification and Reliability of Intuitive product portfolio. Technical Services is responsible to support end to end product life cycle at Intuitive across business units’ platforms and Operations and manages strategic partnerships to support market appropriate solutions and services in the above areas for our customers WW. Roles & Responsibilities This position has responsibility and authority for; Reliability Engineering, Design Verification, Packaging and Product Labeling, Reprocessing, Sterility Assurance and Biological Safety for all new product development and sustaining product portfolio. Including: Providing end to end support to all business unit platforms and Global Operations Developing and proliferating best practices as center of excellence across Intuitive Surgical in the above areas of technical responsibility Developing and leading strategic initiatives that address: Evolving global requirements and compliance Strong internal and external customers value proposition in products and services Customer needs and satisfaction Strategic third-party partner relationships for market appropriate products and services Continued evolution of technical areas of expertise to create best practices, leverage efficiencies and scale for business growth Identify new capabilities needed to support scale Deep collaboration with design engineers, product marketing, clinical, process engineering, human factors, commercial teams and operations Ensuring supply chain continuity of the manufactured medical devices to support da Vinci and Ion procedures Standardizing levels of services across business units, platforms and defining key performance indicators Providing centralized functional verification testing across enterprise for new product development and sustaining projects Driving long term strategies to enable efficiency, automation, and scale of operations Influencing medical device industry in development of new standards and active participation in platforms driving automation and efficiencies strategies to meet increasing volume demands Support functional Directors and Managers to: Direct teams of toxicologists, reliability engineers, packaging cover competing and overlapping projects and timelines Create and maintain guidance materials for teaching engineers the basics of test methods, cleaning, disinfection, and sterilization validation
